"Even Muslims have the chance to get Indian citizenship if they apply through the regular course. Every government has tried to come up with a similar law on citizenship. Why is there a hue and cry only this time,” asked Joshi.

“Republic Day should be a matter of pride for every Indian. After gaining Independence, the country is now run on the basis of constitution framed under the leadership of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar. Now it is the duty of each of us to maintain the glory of the constitution,” he said.

Later, another flag hoisting event was held at the RSS campus in Reshimbagh. This was addressed by Suresh Hiremeth, a member of RSS’s national executive committee.

“Japan, which is counted among the developed nations, also has the toughest geographical conditions. In 2011 it was hit by a Tsunami. Tokyo city was not much impacted but nearly 50 lakh persons living in other places were displaced. The 1 crore residents of Tokyo opened their doors for 50 lakh of their fellow countrymen. Each home welcomed them as their own family members. Shops were thrown open and the affected could take things free if they had no money,” said Hiremeth, in a probable reference to the opposition to over granting citizenship to foreign nationals under CAA.

“A lot of misconception is being spread these days only for political gains. Every political party has the right to carry out activities with an aim to come to power, but not through unfair means of misleading the people,” added Hiremeth.

Excerpts of a letter written by RSS founder Dr Keshav Baliram Hedgewar were read out before the Swayamsevaks at the Reshimbagh function. Sameer Gautam, a member of Hedgewar Smarak Samiti, said the RSS founder had written a letter to all the members on January 21 1930, expressing support to the Congress move to pass a resolution pressing for complete independence. Five days later, in its Lahore session, the Congress went through with the motion.

“As the Congress had marked January 26 as the independence day, even the Swayamsevaks were asked to observe the day,” said Gautam, adding that RSS supports national cause cutting across political organizations.

Title: BJP Telangana president K Laxman snubs KCR for ‘siding with Congress’
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

BJP Telangana president K Laxman

HYDERABAD: BJP state president K Laxman , on Sunday, criticised chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao for siding with the Congress on Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and National Population Register.

Laxman said: “Congress has sought that an assembly resolution should be passed against CCA. He (KCR), too, has announced the same. We have said many times that Congress and TRS are the same; now, it is evident before everyone.”

On the CM saying that he would get into national politics, Laxman said: “It is common for KCR to say that he would get into national policies after every election result. But his words remain just words.”

Title: Visakhapatnam: Sniffer dogs to have GoPros on their harness
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

VISAKHAPATNAM: In a first for the Indian Railways, the sniffer dogs of the Railway Protection Force at the city railway station will now GoPro cameras attached to the canines.

“Four sniffer dogs will be wearing GoPro cameras. These cameras will capture footage from the dog’s perspective. Dog handlers will be able to watch the stream from the camera in real time on their mobile phones,” said Jitendra Shrivastava, senior divisional security commissioner, RPF, Visakhapatnam.

Waltair divisional railway manager Chetan Kumar Srivastava, who inaugurated two new security gadgets—six units of body worn cameras and four units of GoPro cameras—on Sunday on the occasion of Republic Day, said that these advancements would help the Railways overcome any security lapses.

Title: Bars in Noida, Ghaziabad to remain open till 2am from April
Content:
Representative image

NOIDA: Closure timings of bars across Uttar Pradesh have been extended by an hour to 2am while those in star hotels can remain open till 4am. The UP government has specified this in its new excise policy for 2020-21, under which liquor outlets have been directed to mandatorily install a barcode system and upload other details of their stock online.The new policy will come into effect from April 1. The excise department is now looking for an agency to conduct geo-fencing of liquor outlets before establishing an integrated excise management system.The system, which was conceived last year but could not be implemented, will enable buyers to track the manufacturer of a liquor bottle along with other details that will ascertain its authenticity.The department has decided to pay 35 paisa per bottle to the agency that sets up the system. The move to determine the authenticity of liquor assumes significance because several gangs in Noida and Ghaziabad have been found selling spurious liquor in bottles bearing duplicate stickers of well-known brands.The excise department has sought proposals from agencies to implement the new system. “Once the new system has been implemented, a buyer will be able to see the nearest liquor outlet, prices of liquor in stock and other important details. But for that, one has to download the mobile app of the excise department,” said excise commissioner P Guruprasad over the phone.As part of an attempt to do away with sale of illicit liquor, the excise department will also provide alcohol meters to outlets where pilfering of liquor is rampant. District excise officer RB Singh said, “Digital meters would be effective in checking whether a bottle contains spurious liquor or original. This will also help us in initiating action against those found guilty.”Apart from forging stickers of well-known liquor brands, bootleggers in Noida and Ghaziabad often sell spurious liquor as cheap liquor sourced from other states.The excise department, in an attempt to augment its revenue, has also decided to allow bars to keep open till 2am. Bars in star properties can remain operational till 4am. But for the extensions in timings, the excise department will charge an additional fee ranging between Rs 1.25 lakh and Rs 2.50 lakh. The rate of occasional licence, which is valid for a day, has been increased from Rs 10,000 to Rs 11,000.Retailers, though, expressed apprehension about the new system. The president of the association of liquor traders, SP Singh, said, “The tracking system cannot be set up in places where internet speed is slow. The department could not implement the system last time as retailers found it difficult to turn everything digital.”The new policy is aimed at generating higher revenues for the department and its target has been revised from Rs 29,302 crore to Rs 32,025 crore in the next one. Gautam Budh Nagar is hopeful of achieving at least 90% of its annual target. Of the total revenue of Rs 1,037 crore, liquor trade has yielded Rs 624 crore so far.District excise officer Singh said those interested in renewing their licences would have to pay up the fees in February and March and the total figure would almost be on a par with the annual target.
