Title: Visakhapatnam: Tribals call for bandh on January 29, 30
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: The Joint Action Committee (JAC) of Adivasula Hakkula Parirakshana Samiti (AHPS) on Sunday staged protests demanding that the tents set up by private businesses in various parts of the Visakhapatnam Agency be removed. The tribal organisation also called for a two-day bandh on January 29 and 30, demanding the district administration and ITDA officials to strictly implement the 1/70 Act.

Further, the JAC demanded withdrawal of cases against a teacher, and 40 others, for allegedly demolishing tents at Kotha Balluguda village in Araku Valley mandal.

On Saturday, the police had arrested Suresh Kumar Venjula, a teacher by profession for allegedly supporting the villagers who demolished the tents.

JAC convenor Rama Rao Dora said that some businessmen have set up tents close to the girl’s hostel at Kotha Balluguda. “Some tourists, staying in the tents have been found making obscene gestures at the tribal girls,” Dora complained.

He further alleged that tourists living in tents were consuming alcohol and have also been enquiring about the availability of sex workers.

Title: Abolish Legislative Council: Visakhapatnam lawyers
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: A group of city lawyers are asking for the abolition of the AP Legislative Council at the earliest, stating that it was an unwarranted expenditure on the government. The government is likely to move a resolution to dissolve the Legislative Council in the Assembly this week.

Kuppili Muralidhar, a senior advocate and the president of Forum of Legal Professionals, said, “There is an urgent need to abolish the AP Legislative Council in order to curtail wasteful expenditure in view of the financial constraints faced by the state.”

However, advocate Abdul Raqueeb said that the LC is needed to put a system of checks and balances on the Lower House and ruling party.

Title: Hyderabad trembles as earthquake of 4.6 magnitude hits Telugu states
Content:
Photo used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: A 4.6-magnitude earthquake struck on the banks of river Krishna in Suryapet district of Telangana in the wee hours of Sunday. The tremors were felt in various parts of Hyderabad too, apart from other districts in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. Many people in various parts of the city, including Old City, Bowenpally and Ashok Nagar among others, said that they felt the ground shaking. After the earthquake, 26 aftershocks were reported till Sunday evening. No damage has been reported so far in any part of the city or other areas.Akbar Razvi, a resident of Hussaini Alam, said, “Around 2.30am, I felt mild tremors and rushed out of my house. Many of my neighbours also rushed out of their homes.”Scientists from Hyderabad-based National Geophysical Research Institute (NGRI) set up two temporary stations near Vellatur in Suryapet district and are monitoring seismic activity in the area.D Srinagesh, chief seismologist, NGRI, told TOI, “The Pulichintala dam surveillance camera recorded the quake. For two seconds, the fans were seen shaking and rumbling noise was recorded for around seven seconds.”He added, “On June 30, 1969, an earthquake with a magnitude of 5.3 was reported in the Telugu states. Since then, this is the second biggest in terms of magnitude. The epicentre of the quake is in Vellaturu on the banks of river Krishna. We have reports that suggested tremors were felt in various parts of the Andhra Pradesh and Telengana, including Hyderabad. No damages were reported. There have been stray reports of locals at Vellaturu informing about cracks the walls of their houses due to the quake.”Most of the aftershocks recorded by NGRI measured less than one on the Richter scale . “The aftershocks may continue for the coming few months. Tremors were felt in Krishna, Guntur, Suryapet, Khammam, Nalgonda, Rangareddy and Hyderabad,” said Srinagesh.Officials said that there is a fault that exists near the epicentre and it is yet to be named. Y Inna Reddy, a resident of Tallacheruvu in Atchampet mandal of Guntur district, said, “Around 2.30am, I was sleeping. Suddenly my cot and doors started shaking. We all ran out of the house and spent the rest of the night on the street.”The timing of the earthquake was recorded as 2.37am. While NGRI recorded it as 4.6 on the Richter scale, the National Centre for Seismology reported 4.7 at a depth of 10km.

Title: Karnataka: Hajabba hopes Padma award will help realize PU college dream for Harekala
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Honoured: District minister Kota Srinivas Poojari felicitates Harekala Hajabba at the Republic Day function Su... Read More

MANGALURU: It was a normal day in office on Saturday for ‘ Akshara Santha ’ when his basic Nokia handset rang to life. When he answered the call, little did Harekala Hajabba , 64, know that this call was all set to change his life and catapult him to national limelight . Hajabba has single-handedly revolutionised the educational dreams of a generation of children in his village of New Padpu , Harekala.

The call was from the ministry of home affairs to inform him of the Padma awards.

Standing in a queue to give his biometrics data for the ration that the government disburses through fair price shops, Hajabba said he did not understand much of the Hindi or English that the voice on the other side of the call spoke. Hajabba sought help from Abbas, an auto driver, who told him that the caller wanted to inform him about his selection for the country’s fourth-highest civilian award – the Padma Shri.

All this transpired around 11.30am. As the eventful day progressed, Hajabba sought help from his friends in the media to understand the import of the call. One of them, in turn, called up a senior IAS officer, who confirmed the government’s move to confer this award to Hajabba. As the news was formally announced, Hajabba was flooded with calls from friends and well-wishers who congratulated him and wanted to know what the award meant to him.

Accepting the felicitations that the district administration arranged for him at the Republic Day celebration, Hajabba later told TOI that it was the wish of the almighty that the government has selected him, a mere orange seller, for a national award. He thanked the media and elected representatives for highlighting his work. Hajabba said then deputy commissioner A B Ibrahim had recommended his name for the Padma awards in 2015.

His only wish through the Padma awards is that his dream of opening a PU college in the village become a reality. Hajabba thanked every stakeholder in his life for bringing this national recognition to him.

And for a change, a humble orange seller was the cynosure of all eyes at the Republic Day function, and most sought-after for selfies and pictures from admirers.

Title: Bhajanpura tuition centre roof collapse: Co-owner of building held
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

The site where the incident took place

NEW DELHI: Hari Shankar, the co-owner of the building in Bhajanpura that collapsed on Saturday evening, leading to the death of five people and injuring eight, was arrested on Sunday. Four children and their tutor, Umesh Kashyap (35), who was the other owner of the building, died when the under-construction roof of the third floor of the tuition centre collapsed. Kashyap and Shankar were brothers. Their wives also taught there.

On Sunday, forensic evidence was lifted from the site and the statements of the injured students was recorded by police. Some families have decided not to send their children to the tuition centre.

The families of the four deceased children — Furkan (6), Deeshu (12), Krishna (9) and Kirti (10) — said they had bought new clothes to perform at a function at school.

Deeshu death was a double whammy for his family as his grandmother had passed away just four days ago. “His birthday was on February 11 and we had planned to go to Vaishno Devi. He would often say ‘Fauji banunga’ and had even got an Army uniform stitched to perform in the Republic Day event at school. While practising, he had said ‘Aakhiri salaam’ (last salute). It seems what he said came true. I want to make him wear the uniform and cremate him,” said Mahipal, Deeshu’s father, a grocer.

Mahipal’s has two other children, Deepak (15) and a five-year-old daughter. Deepak also studied at the same tuition centre, but was in the morning batch.

The tuition centre called “Education Point” was started in 1996. The parents of the students said that both Kashyap, fondly called Ballu Bhaiya, and Shankar taught well. They called the incident a tragedy. “The fee was Rs 500, but if a family couldn’t afford it, then it was reduced. Ballu would even drop the children home if their parents were not able to pick them,” said Archana Tyagi, Kirti’s aunt, whose two children studied there.

Kirti and her elder brother, Yash, were together when the incident occurred. While Yash and Tyagi’s children were saved, Kirti’s body was recovered an hour later from under the debris. “My children will not go to the tuition centre anymore. Kirti had bought a dress for dancing in an event at school. She kept telling her mother to record her video and dress her properly,” said a sobbing Tyagi.

Local residents said at least 50 students were present at the tuition centre when the incident occurred. Classes were conducted on the ground, first and second floors. The maximum damage occurred on the second floor, but most students managed to escape. “Umesh tried his best to save the children from harm. His tuition centre was known not just in Bhajanpura, but other areas too,” said Ravinder Saini, Kashyap’s childhood friend.

Title: ICSI prelims: Seven from Ahmedabad in Top 25
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Seven students of the Institute of Company Secretaries of India (ICSI) in Ahmedabad bagged spots in the national Top 25. The results for prelims exam was out on Saturday. The city officials of ICSI said that the success rate of 66% is the highest in past three years.

From other centres in Gujarat — five from Vadodara and four from Surat secured their place in Top 25 students nationally.

Many students in the field of law are attracted to this course as well, because of the emphasis on company law. Mohanish Parikh (AIR 17) said, “The Company Secretaries course goes well with the subject I am studying and it motivated me to take this exam.” Maitri Kansara, AIR 18, is also a law student. “The study patterns are mostly similar in the law subject of this course, and this improved my understanding in both CS and law exams,” she said.

Nikita Gupta, securing AIR 20 said that she did not take any tuitions for the course.

Title: Telangana: National flag set ablaze after personal dispute
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

The national flag

The national flag was set ablaze at Thirumalapuram village of Kuravi mandal in Mahabubabad district on Sunday. A personal dispute between two government employees and the sarpanch led to the incident.

Sub-inspector Shankar Rao said that Thirumalapuram sarpanch Rambabu approached the police to lodge a complaint against one Karobar Upendar.

He alleged that an ongoing dispute between panchayat secretary Ramesh and Upender on the issues of governance, the latter deliberately set ablaze some papers pasted to the pole, after which the flames spread to the flag fluttering on top of the pole.

Rao said that the police is conducting an inquiry into the incident.

In another incident, Gundrapally sarpanch Rajeshwar Rao hoisted the national flag upside-down. Ward members brought this to the notice of rural district collector M Haritha.

In a similar incident, the rural district joint collector of Warangal, too, hoisted the flag upside-down, but immediately brought it down, set it right and hoisted the flag again.

Title: City’s East Point Golf Club set to become Category-I golf course this year
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Visakhapatnam: If everything goes as per plan, the East Point Golf Club (EPGC) at Mudasarlova area in Vizag city will be turning into a Category-I (Class-A) golf course by September this year. Once the EPGC gets the Category-I golf course tag, the EPGC will host national and international golf events.

The EPGC in Vizag city is the only major golf club in Andhra Pradesh which is open to the public with an 18-hole course. The golf club was categorised as a Class-B category golf course as it measured 6,041 yards. A Category-I golf course needs to measure over 6,700 yards.

Speaking to TOI, RVS Rudraraju, the secretary of EPGC, said that as per the norms set by the Indian Golf Union (IGU), the governing body of golf in India, a golf course should measure 6,700 yards to be able to host national and international golf events. “The works to redesign the East Point Golf Club and have it be a category-I golf course have been taking place in a phased manner and will be complete by 2020,” Rudraraju said.

“With Vizag all set to become the state’s executive capital, the port city will become a hub for golf tourism in the coming days and EPGC will host a good number of national golf events,” the EPGC secretary added.

Uday Shirname, former secretary of EPGC, said that the golf club is over a 100 years old and has more than 1,000 members, which include naval personnel, businessmen and professional golfers. “The landscaping and other works at EPGC have begun and once the works are complete, EPGC will get category-I status and will be able to host major golf tournaments,” Uday added.

The East Point Golf Club is spending over Rs 4 crore for the redesign of the course. The TDP government had allocated 12.72 acres of land close to the EPGC for further development of the club to attract international golfers.

“Since Vizag has emerged as a hub for cricket, badminton, and some other sports in Andhra Pradesh, it will will gain more importance in terms once it becomes the executive capital. Vizag also has better connectivity, which is ideal for golf tourism in the coming days,” an EPGC member said. The EPGC team has been chalking out plans to host some golf events at the club this year, they added.

Title: Karnataka: Youth draws PM Narendra Modi’s attention to delay in Kundapur flyover
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Vignesh Shenoy

MANGALURU: Vignesh Shenoy , a resident of Kundapur , has drawn Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s attention over the pending flyover work in Kundapur. In a letter dated December 24, he wrote: “We have an NH-66 expansion project going on from the past 10 years. It is in the heart of the city, located near Shastri Circle and beside Gandhi Maidan.”

“Due to the slow-paced flyover construction, the city has seen several accidents and many fatalities. People are risking their lives as it is in the heart of the city, and it’s a junction. “We have tried to draw the attention of every single politician. Only Modi can look into this and get the works expedited,’’ Shenoy said in the letter, and requested the government to stop collecting toll fees until all the pending works are completed.

Shenoy, who works in the accounts department of a private firm, said he drew inspiration from the Pumpwell flyover in Mangaluru, and decided to write to the PM on the issue. He told TOI, “It was only after trolls and people taking up the issue at the national level, that the local MP decided to speed up the works of the Pumpwell flyover. In one month, the flyover work has seen a lot of progress. We want to build similar pressure on the government, to see to it that the works are completed as quickly as possible. It takes more than 15 minutes to cross the 1 kilometre stretch. When the works are not complete, what is the need to collect toll?” he questioned.

He has received a reply from the Prime Minister's office that his concern has been forwarded to the secretary, ministry of road transport and highways. This is Shenoy’s second letter to the PM on the issue. For a letter sent a few months ago, he received no response.

In October last year, Kundapur Taluk Journalists Association organised a Shastri Circle Chalo protest, to express displeasure over the delay in completion of flyover works on NH-66.

Title: Delhi elections 2020: Will cut pollution by 70% with 60 smog towers, says Manoj Tiwari
Content:
Manoj Tiwari is flanked by Charu Pragya and Neelkant Baxi on left and GK candidate Shikha Rai on the right dur... Read More

NEW DELHI: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari on Sunday said that if his party won the assembly elections, it would install smog towers across the city to reduce air pollution.Replying to a query on “Twitter chaupal”, where Tiwari took questions from people on the micro-blogging site, Tiwari said smog towers had proved to be a great success in Beijing, which also faced severe air pollution about two decades ago.“Beijing was also very polluted 18 years ago. The Chinese capital then set up smog towers, which reduced pollution to a great extent,” Tiwari said.He added that air pollution in the city could be reduced by about 70% by installing 60 smog towers. “Each smog tower can clean the air of about 6 square kilometre. With 60 such towers, Delhi’s air can be cleaned by 70%. We will install these towers within a year or so after forming government in Delhi,” he said. “The tower costs about Rs 2.5 crore. By spending just Rs 125 crore, we can ensure that our children don’t have to wear anti-pollution masks.”Tiwari received several questions on Twitter, which were posed to him by Delhi BJP’s media co-incharge Neelkant Baxi and spokesperson Charu Pragya.To another question, Tiwari said the protest at Shaheen Bagh in southeast Delhi could have been ended by the police in a day had the protesters not pushed women and children into the forefront. He also alleged that Congress instigated the “fire” of rebellion against CAA and it would have “doused” by now had AAP government not “supported” it.When asked why BJP had not announced its chief ministerial candidate ahead of the polls, Tiwari said giving “good governance” was more important. “BJP’s symbol lotus is our face in this election, which is being fought under the presidentship of Manoj Tiwari and the overall leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi,” Tiwari said.AAP has regularly targeted BJP for not declaring its CM face with a “Kejriwal vs Who?” jibe. While BJP has announced a CM face ahead of every assembly poll in Delhi, this is the first time the party has taken a “strategic” decision to contest the polls in the name of PM Modi.Replying to another question, Tiwari said the electricity tariff in Delhi would be reduced by 30% by BJP government. He also questioned the free electricity scheme of AAP government, alleging it had no plan to continue the facility. “Only a few people are getting zero bills for up to 200 units. We have received several complaints from people that they got bills form power discoms despite consuming less than 200 units,” Tiwari said, showing “two such bills” at his Twitter chaupal, organised at Village Zamrudpur in Greater Kailash.

Title: Delhi elections 2020: Will cut pollution by 70% with 60 smog towers, says Manoj Tiwari
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Manoj Tiwari is flanked by Charu Pragya and Neelkant Baxi on left and GK candidate Shikha Rai on the right dur... Read More

NEW DELHI: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari on Sunday said that if his party won the assembly elections, it would install smog towers across the city to reduce air pollution.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

Replying to a query on “Twitter chaupal”, where Tiwari took questions from people on the micro-blogging site, Tiwari said smog towers had proved to be a great success in Beijing, which also faced severe air pollution about two decades ago.

“Beijing was also very polluted 18 years ago. The Chinese capital then set up smog towers, which reduced pollution to a great extent,” Tiwari said.

He added that air pollution in the city could be reduced by about 70% by installing 60 smog towers. “Each smog tower can clean the air of about 6 square kilometre. With 60 such towers, Delhi’s air can be cleaned by 70%. We will install these towers within a year or so after forming government in Delhi,” he said. “The tower costs about Rs 2.5 crore. By spending just Rs 125 crore, we can ensure that our children don’t have to wear anti-pollution masks.”

Tiwari received several questions on Twitter, which were posed to him by Delhi BJP’s media co-incharge Neelkant Baxi and spokesperson Charu Pragya.

To another question, Tiwari said the protest at Shaheen Bagh in southeast Delhi could have been ended by the police in a day had the protesters not pushed women and children into the forefront. He also alleged that Congress instigated the “fire” of rebellion against CAA and it would have “doused” by now had AAP government not “supported” it.

When asked why BJP had not announced its chief ministerial candidate ahead of the polls, Tiwari said giving “good governance” was more important. “BJP’s symbol lotus is our face in this election, which is being fought under the presidentship of Manoj Tiwari and the overall leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi,” Tiwari said.

AAP has regularly targeted BJP for not declaring its CM face with a “Kejriwal vs Who?” jibe. While BJP has announced a CM face ahead of every assembly poll in Delhi, this is the first time the party has taken a “strategic” decision to contest the polls in the name of PM Modi.

Replying to another question, Tiwari said the electricity tariff in Delhi would be reduced by 30% by BJP government. He also questioned the free electricity scheme of AAP government, alleging it had no plan to continue the facility. “Only a few people are getting zero bills for up to 200 units. We have received several complaints from people that they got bills form power discoms despite consuming less than 200 units,” Tiwari said, showing “two such bills” at his Twitter chaupal, organised at Village Zamrudpur in Greater Kailash.

Title: Hajipur, Asifabad await verdict on rape and murder cases
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Bhagwant Mann hits the road with Raghav Chadha, strikes a chord
Content:
While Chadha waved to the people in Old Rajendra Nagar, Bhagwant Mann’s fans frequently approached him for sel... Read More

NEW DELHI: The sleepy neighbourhood of Old Rajendra Nagar started reverberating with Aam Aadmi Party’s campaign song on Sunday evening as the party’s Punjab chief and star campaigner Bhagwant Mann reached there to campaign for Raghav Chadha.In the roadshow that began from Block 18, party workers reached out to residents to vote for Chadha. They distributed pamphlets and highlighted the works done by AAP in the past five years. The cavalcade, including cars and two-wheelers, passed through the lanes of blocks 18, 31 and 32 and the main market of Old Rajendra Nagar.While Chadha waved to people gathered in their balconies, Mann’s fans frequently approached him for taking selfies. At some places, both Mann and Chadha got down to greet people waiting in groups and urged them to vote for AAP keeping in mind issues like education, healthcare, infrastructure and women’s security and not pay heed to religion and caste.A two-time Lok Sabha MP from Sangrur, Mann was critical about political parties dividing people on the basis of caste and religion. “I am confident that people are smart and will vote on the merits of works done by the AAP government in schools, power and water supply in the past five years. That’s why we are confidently asking people to help us take this movement forward. I’m sure we will win all 70 seats in Delhi,” he said.A middle-class neighbourhood in central Delhi, most people in Old Rajendra Nagar had come as refugees from Pakistan after Partition.HM Singh, a resident of Block 31, said that residents are happy with the work done by the former AAP MLA Vijendra Garg and will support the party again.“The main road and drains are in a good condition. Small families have also been saving money owing to the rebates in electricity and water bills. This time we are demanding a mohalla clinic and a parking lot in the area. As there are many senior citizens, healthcare facilities at reasonable rates will benefit them a lot,” Singh said.Residents said that a parking lot was constructed by the municipal corporation, but it was being used for commercial purposes. Rajinder Kaur, who lives close to Salwan Public School, said that political parties should stop defaming others to make their own presence felt. “We get good water at cheap rates. We even get subsidy on electricity, so political parties shouldn’t malign AAP by saying the quality of water is not good or the government has done nothing in the past five years,” she added.However, AK Singh, another resident, said that the candidates “disappear” after elections. “They come here just before the polls, but are nowhere to be found once they get elected,” he added.

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Bhagwant Mann hits the road with Raghav Chadha, strikes a chord
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

While Chadha waved to the people in Old Rajendra Nagar, Bhagwant Mann’s fans frequently approached him for sel... Read More

NEW DELHI: The sleepy neighbourhood of Old Rajendra Nagar started reverberating with Aam Aadmi Party’s campaign song on Sunday evening as the party’s Punjab chief and star campaigner Bhagwant Mann reached there to campaign for Raghav Chadha.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

In the roadshow that began from Block 18, party workers reached out to residents to vote for Chadha. They distributed pamphlets and highlighted the works done by AAP in the past five years. The cavalcade, including cars and two-wheelers, passed through the lanes of blocks 18, 31 and 32 and the main market of Old Rajendra Nagar.

While Chadha waved to people gathered in their balconies, Mann’s fans frequently approached him for taking selfies. At some places, both Mann and Chadha got down to greet people waiting in groups and urged them to vote for AAP keeping in mind issues like education, healthcare, infrastructure and women’s security and not pay heed to religion and caste.

A two-time Lok Sabha MP from Sangrur, Mann was critical about political parties dividing people on the basis of caste and religion. “I am confident that people are smart and will vote on the merits of works done by the AAP government in schools, power and water supply in the past five years. That’s why we are confidently asking people to help us take this movement forward. I’m sure we will win all 70 seats in Delhi,” he said.

A middle-class neighbourhood in central Delhi, most people in Old Rajendra Nagar had come as refugees from Pakistan after Partition.

HM Singh, a resident of Block 31, said that residents are happy with the work done by the former AAP MLA Vijendra Garg and will support the party again.

“The main road and drains are in a good condition. Small families have also been saving money owing to the rebates in electricity and water bills. This time we are demanding a mohalla clinic and a parking lot in the area. As there are many senior citizens, healthcare facilities at reasonable rates will benefit them a lot,” Singh said.

Residents said that a parking lot was constructed by the municipal corporation, but it was being used for commercial purposes. Rajinder Kaur, who lives close to Salwan Public School, said that political parties should stop defaming others to make their own presence felt. “We get good water at cheap rates. We even get subsidy on electricity, so political parties shouldn’t malign AAP by saying the quality of water is not good or the government has done nothing in the past five years,” she added.

However, AK Singh, another resident, said that the candidates “disappear” after elections. “They come here just before the polls, but are nowhere to be found once they get elected,” he added.

Title: School students paint thoughts on saving waterbodies
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Trichy: A drawing competition for creating awareness on water pollution among school children was organised at Makkal Mandram hall here on Sunday. Around 273 children took part in the event and expressed their opinion and shared ideas to save waterbodies and prevent river pollution through their drawings.

Organised by the Citizen for Uyyakondan (CFU), a citizen group involved in restoring the polluted Chola-era Uyyakondan irrigation canal, the drawing competition was conducted for school students from class IV to class IX. Two topics were given for the participants namely ‘reason for water pollution’ and ‘the beauty of the canal in the city’. The children painted their thoughts on safeguarding the waterbodies.

In the 3-hour event, students from 24 educational institutes in the city displayed their skills for a cause. A certificate of appreciation was given away by Vriksha Book of World Records. Top three drawings of students in each of the classes were selected for award by the five-member jury. “The objective of the competition is to encourage school children to learn the importance of waterbodies and preventing pollution,” an organiser said. All the participants were awarded certificates for participation.

Title: Implement new traffic fines gradually: VTA
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Nagpur: A delegation of Vidarbha Taxpayers Association ( VTA ), led by Shrawan Kumar Malu, called on the Maharashtra home minister Anil Deshmukh to stress that the state government should exercise its powers and gradually implement the fines for traffic offences which have increased through the Motor Vehicle Amendment Act of 2019.

VTA’s secretary Tejinder Singh Renu told the minister that motor vehicle accidents and constant increase in traffic offences are a matter of concern and need attention.

The penalties to be levied from the offenders have been increased under the Motor Vehicle Amendment Act, 2019. The fines are high but the state reserves the power to lower them suitably. Renu said that the state government should gradually increase the present traffic fines. The police needs additional powers to control traffic as undiscipline can lead to many accidents and even fatalities, he said.

The home minister appreciated the suggestions submitted by VTA. Deshmukh assured that he will take views of DCP (traffic) on the matter and will take appropriate decision soon, said a press release issued by the VTA.

Title: Resolutions passed against hydrocarbon exploration
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Trichy: Panchayat grama sabha meetings of the central and delta districts held on the occasion of Republic Day passed resolutions banning hydrocarbon exploration in their hamlets. During the inaugural grama sabha on Sunday held after electing the new representatives to the rural civic body, the youngsters in the area managed to persuade their civic body representatives to take a stand against the hydrocarbon project.

Recently, the Union environment ministry exempted the hydrocarbon exploration activities from the rigorous environmental impact assessment and public hearing. Following the development, villagers of Pudukkottai, Thanjavur and Tiruvarur districts have utilised the grama sabha meetings as a tool to express their opposition by passing resolutions against any form of exploration activities in their jurisdictions. Neduvasal, Sornakadu, Azhagiyanayagipuram, Kaalagam and Andikkadu were among the agrarian hamlets in Thanjavur and Pudukkottai districts that passed resolutions banning hydrocarbon exploration in their respective jurisdictions. “We will send the copy of resolutions passed in the grama sabha meetings to the Union government. At any point of time, we will not allow the government or private companies to use our agriculture land to explore oil or gas,” Nimal Raghavan, a resident of Nadiyam panchayat in Thanjavur district , said.

People as voluntary groups irrespective of their political affiliation said that they had told the land owners in their villages not to give their land for any form of exploration projects. Stating that hydrocarbon exploration in the delta districts will be disastrous for the entire state, the grama sabha meetings asked the government to revive the farming sector. “Supportive data highlighting the economic benefits associated with agriculture in the villages in the districts will be sent to the government to make them realize the economic potential of encouraging farming in the delta districts,” Nimal added.

Title: Govt in no position to bail out stressed banking sector: Abhijit Banerjee
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Nobel economics laureate Abhijit Banerjee

Title: Karnataka: FASTag scam unearthed, NHAI blocks violators
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

MANGALURU: The National Highways Authority of India in Dakshina Kannada district, which tops in implementation of electronic toll collection through the RFID-enabled tag has unearthed a scam where some multi-axle vehicles (MAV) and light commercial vehicles (LCV) were purportedly using FASTag RFID stickers meant for light motor vehicles .

According to NHAI and toll booth operation management members, the scam has been active for sometime now, after electronic toll collection was made mandatory, and it has caused heavy losses to toll booth contractors.

Shivaprasad Rai, toll manager (Talapady, Sastan and Hejamady), explaining about the scam, said that vehicle owners of MAVs and LCVs had been issued FASTag stickers by producing documents of LCVs. The same stickers were fixed in their vehicles. “When MAV and LCV vehicles are scanned at toll booths, operators do not check FASTag registration (like vehicle numbers and other details). Once the machine scans the vehicle, money is deducted and the toll gate opens automatically and allows vehicles to proceed. During a thorough check, we found that some of the MAVs and LCVs are cheating toll booths using FASTag stickers meant for LMVs. The MAVs and LCVs have higher toll fee compared to LMV. We have reported such vehicles,” he added.

According to NHAI officials, the highest number of such cases was reported in Talapady, Surathkal and Hejamady toll booths.

These FASTag stickers are issued by e-commerce and private banks. FASTag was implemented for all vehicles across the country, instead of manual payment of toll, and was made mandatory from January 15. Shishu Mohan, project director, NHAI, told TOI that all such LMV FASTag stickers fixed in MAVs and LCVs have been blocked. The toll booth operators are asked to report the same, he said.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Bank manager dies as truck crashes into roadside tree
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: A nationalized bank manager, who was travelling in a container truck from Coonoor to Thudiyalur, was charred to death after the truck rammed into a roadside tree at Kallar near Mettupalayam on Saturday night. The truck driver, however, escaped unhurt.

The Mettupalayam police said B Nandhakumar, 36, from Pichampalayam near Tirupur, M Mathurathinam, 44, from Thempalayam in Tirupur, and N Rajesh, 33, from Pazhankarai in Avinashi, were travelling in a car to Udhagamandalam from Tirupur. S Vasantha Kumar, 38, from New Police quarters in Tirupur, drove the car.

When the car reached near Kallar bridge, Vasantha Kumar lost control of the car and collided head on with a container truck. As a result, the driver of the container truck lost control of the vehicle which came to a halt after crashing into a roadside tree.

Due to the impact, the container truck caught fire and the passenger who was sitting inside the driver’s cabin was charred to death. But the driver managed to escape. Initially, police said the deceased was the cleaner of the truck and the charred dead body was sent to the Mettupalayam government hospital on Saturday night.

However, preliminary inquiry revealed that the deceased was P Subramanian, 59, of Thudiyalur. He was working as branch manager of Indian Bank near Coonoor. He had boarded the truck in Coonoor. The container truck laden with tea dust was heading to Thudiyalur when the accident took place.

The Mettupalayam police have registered a case and further investigation is on.

Title: Hyderabad: 26-year-old driver stabbed to death
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: An auto driver was stabbed to death by a group of assailants behind a hillock near Bibi Ka Chashma in Falaknuma on Sunday afternoon.

The 26-year-old victim was identified as Md Azam, an auto driver from Vattepally in Falaknuma. According to the police, Azam was found lying dead in a pool of blood in the bushes behind a hillock near Bibi Ka Chashma at 3 pm on Sunday. “He was stabbed multiple times. He died on the spot due to critical injuries,” Falaknuma ACP Md Abdul Rasheed said.

Alerted by the locals, the police rushed to the spot and cordoned off the area. The clues team reached the spot and collected evidence from the crime scene. “A knife was seized from the crime scene. We suspect that there could be more than one assailant,” the ACP said.

Police are trying to identify the accused by analysing the CCTV camera footage of the lanes leading to the crime scene. “We are looking for all kinds of leads. CCTV camera footage is being verified. Family members and friends of the victim are being examined to get information about the suspects. The call details of the victim are also being analysed,” Falaknuma inspector K Srinivasa Rao said.

Police registered a case under section 302 ( murder ) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). A manhunt was launched to nab the accused. The body was shifted to Osmania General Hospital for postmortem.

Title: Corpn worker bags prize for thwarting open urination
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Trichy: Commending the efforts of a female sanitary worker for effectively preventing open urination in her jurisdiction, Trichy corporation felicitated her at the Republic Day celebrations at the main office. Times of India had on Saturday carried a report titled “Watchers keep litterers at bay near Uyyakondan canal” highlighting her role in turning away polluters from the stretch allotted to her.

K Jayalakshmi, who is attached to K Abishekapuram zone of Trichy Corporation, was awarded a three-gram gold coin and a certificate of appreciation by corporation commissioner S Sivasubramanian on Sunday. “This will be an encouragement for other sanitary workers to execute their duties efficiently,” city health officer A Jegannathan said. Jayalakshmi had on January 24 stood guard on Kulimikkarai road near Thennur Anna Nagar and thwarted the attempts of men to urinate at a space recently cleared by sanitary workers. As many as 18 other corporation employees including V Raj Periyasamy and A Sivaji were also awarded certificate of merit and Rs 2,000 cash prize for completing 25 years of service in the civic body. “Under smart cities mission, new potable water connections will be provided to the added wards,” the commissioner said.

Earlier, 103 officials including assistant executive engineer K Jegajeevanram, junior engineers K Ibrahim, K Srinivasan, V Raja and sanitary inspectors David Muthuraj and Prince Sagayaraj were awarded a certificate of appreciation for efficiently executing their duties in 2019-20 financial year. Residents welfare associations (RWA) across the city that implemented rainwater harvesting structures were also felicitated with certificate of appreciation. Seethalakshmi Ramaswami College, Holy Cross College and Srimad Andavan Arts College were also felicitated for supporting the civic body’s initiatives. TNN

Title: Sastra varsity honours three of its alumni
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Chennai: Sastra University honoured three of its alumni with awards in recognition of their service to the society at the global alumni meet held at the university’s centre in Chennai as part of Republic day celebrations on Sunday.

The 2019 Sastra distinguished alumni excellence award was presented to S Pazhanikumar, a 1992 mechanical engineering graduate and currently scientist at DRDO-CVRDE, for his outstanding public service and contributing to India's defence.

The 2019 Sastra distinguished alumni excellence award for corporate service was awarded to 1994 electrical engineering graduate S V Ramanan, Intellect Design Arena CEO (India and Asia). Electrical engineering graduate (1996) Girish Mathroobootham, founder & CEO of Freshworks, was presented the Sastra alumni award for his entrepreneurial excellence.

The event was presided over by Sastra alumni association president Sridhar Gopalan while vice-chancellor Dr S Vaidhyasubramaniam read out the award citations.

Title: VMRDA to develop land for ‘Pedalandariki Illu’ scheme
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: The Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority (VMRDA) will shoulder the responsibility of developing nearly 6,150 acres land. Land pockets across 10 mandals in the district, are being pooled by the district administration for distribution of housing sites to eligible beneficiaries under the ‘Pedalandariki Illu’ scheme.

As per a government order released on Saturday, the VMRDA will retain a 15 per cent share of the developed land to meet the expenses incurred. It has been estimated that the development of each acre of land will cost around Rs 50 lakh.

The developmental activities will include making plots, roads and a drainage system. Nearly 1.5 lakh beneficiaries have been found eligible for this scheme.

Speaking to TOI, VMRDA metropolitan commissioner P Koteswara Rao said that the development costs per acre varies from mandal to mandal based on the terrain and varied geological conditions. “The VMRDA will get 15% of the developed land for developing these lands,” Koteswara Rao said.

These 6,100 acre lands are primarily owned by the government and are being enjoyed by assignees and encroachers for decades. Under the land pooling scheme, the assignees will get 900 square yards developed plot per acre.

Encroachers who have settled for more than 10 years will be given 450 square yards plot per acre. Those who have been squatting for 5to 10 years will get 250 square yards land.

After allotting their share of the developed land to individuals and setting aside 15% for the VMRDA, the remaining part of the developed land will be vested with the district collector for housing scheme for weaker sections.

The state government, through an order released on Saturday also included encroached lands and lands specified in the AP Assigned Lands (POT) Act, 1977in the land pooling scheme.

These lands were beyond the purview of guidelines issued in the earlier orders. But the state government is taking up the housing scheme as a special case and a one time measure to distribute housing sites to the homeless and weaker sections of society.

However, the Left parties have demanded the state government to stall the on-going land pooling exercise in the district as it will deprive farmers of their livelihood.

Title: Inverted flag unfurled at YSRC party office in city
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Republic Day celebrations at the YSRC party office in the city began with a goof-up as the tri-colour unfurled inverted with the green shade on top and the saffron below.

The incident took place when tourism minister M Srinivas Rao hoisted the flag at the party office. The mistake did not go unnoticed with pictures and videos of the event went viral on social media causing a lot of embarrassment to the party.

Sources said that senior leaders were shocked to see the flag unfurl in that manner. They informed that the mistake was made by workers who tied the flag to the staff before the ceremony.

VMRDA chairman Dronamraju Srinivas, who was present at the occasion confirmed the incident and said, “It is an insult to the national flag, that too on such an important day. However, it is not the minister’s mistake. It was obviously the mistake of the people organising the ceremony. We are all taking collective responsibility for the goof-up.”

He added that the party will issue an apology, keeping in view the gravity of the incident.

Title: Textbook overtaken by changes in biz world, IIM-A students write a new one
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Twenty-one students at IIM-Ahmedabad decided to write a textbook themselves, incorporating the latest developm... Read More

AHMEDABAD: When Arun Nandewal, a 2018-20 batch PGP student at IIM-Ahmedabad (IIM-A), and his batchmates searched for textbooks on product management in India, they found just one. It was a book by IIT-Madras alumnus.

So Nandewal and 20 batchmates decided to write a textbook themselves, incorporating the latest developments in e-commerce websites , cab aggregators, massive multiplayer online role-playing games (MMORPG) including PUBG , blockchain , and many other aspects. Also included were the best practices and product development, and their links with various business verticals.

The team began writing the book in June last year and within six months it was ready with a 125-page book titled ‘Futuristic Outlook to Product Management Industry Review Guide 2019’. Nandewal, the lead author, said that the group is now attempting to introduce the book for course learning at IIM-A.

Ananya Dalal, one of the youngest members on the team, said the book will be a valuable resource. “It’s a dynamic book and our team expects it to be updated by each batch that comes after us,” he said. “The textbook is being peer reviewed and we have already taken suggestions from our professors.”

Nandewal said the book is for absolute beginners, and those who want to switch jobs or prepare for interviews. He said that each of his batchmates involved in writing the chapters had working experience in new domains such as blockchain, brand lifecycle, gaming, and OTT platforms. “We decided to collect and write case studies for the team,” he said. “The project soon attracted students from PGPX, PGP-FABM, and FPM programmes as well — bringing in the mix of experience and knowledge.”

Anshuman Singh, a PGPX student, said with his 14 years of experience in technology firms, he contributed a real-time product management case in the book. “Product management is an emerging area and almost all tech giants are hiring for it,” he said.

Title: Waltair division of East Coast Railway earns Rs 5,903 crore in first three quarters
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: The Waltair division of East Coast Railway (ECoR) has earned Rs 5,903 crore in the first three quarters of the financial year with a growth of 9.5% over previous year, said Chetan Kumar Srivastava , divisional railway manager.

The growth in freight loading of 9.35% was the best ever, with 48.63 million tonnes being loaded. Passenger traffic grew by 1.32%. Srivastava announced this while unfurling the national flag on the 71st Republic Day celebrations in the city on Sunday. He said that the division has played a vital role in national integration and has adopted the ‘path of innovative progression’ that made it a torchbearer for many.

Srivastava added that despite challenges thrown by difficult circumstances, the division is excelling in surpassing targets. The divisional railway manager further informed that the Visakhapatnam railway station bagged national tourism award 2017-18 for ‘best tourist-friendly railway station’ in India in 2019.

Title: India’s steel sector bound to improve: RINL chairman
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Vijayawada: Chairman and managing director of Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd ( RINL ), PK Rath unfurled the national flag at the Visakhapatnam Steel Plant as part of the Republic Day celebrations on Sunday.

Speaking on the occasion, Rath said, “The steel sector in India is bound to improve with the central government’s decision to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in infrastructure projects in the next five years.” He added that the per capita consumption of steel would increase with the planned investment by the government.

“The government investment would be focussed on projects such as industrial corridors, dedicated freight corridors, and the like. These projects will help in bridging the rural-urban divide and improve transport infrastructure and steel consumption,” the RINL chairman said further.

According to a press release issued by RINL-VSP, the company had enhanced its capacity to 7.3 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) from the earlier 3 mtpa.

Title: R-Day observed at ENC, Sainik School
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Visakhapatnam: On the occasion of Republic Day , a ceremonial parade was held at the Eastern Naval Command (ENC) parade ground at INS Circars on Sunday.

Vice Admiral Atul Kumar Jain, Flag Officer Commanding-in-Chief, ENC took the salute and inspected a 50-men armed guard and later reviewed the platoons comprising naval personnel drawn from all ships, submarines and establishments, Defence Security Corps and Sea Cadets Corps (SCC).

Vice Admiral SN Ghormade, Chief of Staff, ENC, was the conducting officer of the parade and Cdr Abhishek Yadav was the parade commander. Speaking of the occasion, Vice Admiral Jain called upon all to discharge their duties in safeguarding national interests.

He further highlighted the restrictions in the fundamental rights imposed on armed forces personnel to ensure discipline and efficient discharge of their duties.

Complementing the units of ENC for maintaining a high tempo of operations meeting all challenges on the Eastern Seaboard and displaying outstanding professionalism during mission-based deployment, the Vice Admiral reminded the personnel on parade of the fragile security situation in the region and urged all present to never let their guard down, adding that there should be no compromise on security.

Meanwhile, on the 71st Republic Day and the 52nd passing out parade of class XII was celebrated at the Sainik School, Korukonda on Sunday. Commodore CP Vinod, Commanding Officer, INS Satavahana, ENC and an alumnus of Sainik School, Kazhakoottam was the chief guest and reviewing officer on the occasion.He laid a wreath at the War Memorial and paid homage to the war heroes.

Title: Visitors irked as zoo jumbo Krishna refuses to socialise
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Krishna-the bull elephant at the Indira Gandhi Zoological Park

VISAKHAPATNAM: While a slew of visitors thronged the Visakhapatnam zoo on Sunday, many were not allowed the opportunity to meet Krishna— the elephant at the elephant enclosure. The local zoo’s famed bull elephant was in no mood to socialise and was even seen avoiding its mahout.

Some visitors who did manage to get a sight of him said that the elephant was trying to get out of this enclosure and was probably in musth.

Zoo authorities however refuted claims of the elephant behaving in an abnormal manner. “The elephant was not chained. But it was not approaching the mahout for some reason. Sometimes, they do not want the attention of humans. This was one of these days. However, it was not trying to get out of his enclosure, which is trenched anyway,” said Yesoda Bai, curator of Indira Gandhi Zoological Park.

Visitors however did maintain that the elephant was obviously trying to avoid people and said that the zoo staff had kept a close eye on the jumbo.

The curator too said that the staff was watching the elephant’s movements closely. “The elephant was trying to be alone. It was trying to avoid all the noise,” the curator added.

Sources at the zoo pointed out that this is not the first time that one of the elephant’s at the zoo has been in a foul mood. They informed that a female elephant had displayed similar traits some time ago. The curator strongly maintained that the elephant was not in musth.

Title: CBSE alerts against rumours on social media
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: With the CBSE annual class X and class XII examinations set to commence from February 15, the board is making arrangements for the smooth and fair conduct of examinations.

The board, on Sunday, issued a press release stating that certain unscrupulous elements have been spreading rumours by posting fake videos, messages on social media platforms in an attempt to spread panic among students, parents, schools at the public.

The board warned those involved in such rumour-mongers to refrain from such unlawful actions.

The board further stated that it is taking immediate remedial action whenever such information is brought to their notice.

The board has also stated that it will take legal action against those perpetrating such rumours.

In its release, the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) appealed to the general public to co-operate with the board for the smooth conduct of examinations and to not believe or spread misinformation on social media.

Title: With 46,000 nominations, Padmas seek out the unsung
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Padma award selection process has, over the past five years, become broad-based and more diligent to ensure a wide section of society and individuals representing a range of disciplines are recognised and honoured.

There were 46,000 nominations this year as compared to 2,200 in 2014, a 20-fold jump as the selection process has ensured that Padma awards move beyond the Delhi and Mumbai elites, with a greater focus on east and south India, an official said.

Sources said the effort has been to seek out stories and individuals who represent mainstream as well as niche disciplines and are making a significant contribution in a selfless and dedicated manner. By awarding people from ordinary walks of life along with celebrities, the government has sought to provide examples for citizens, regardless of their social background, to emulate. It has also provided inspiration as the Padma awards have recognised people who were hidden from the gaze of mainstream media.

In this year’s list, those awarded include Jagdish Lal Ahuja, who has been organising free food at PGIMER, Chandigarh, since the 1980s. Mohammad Sharif has been performing the last rites of unclaimed bodies for the last 25 years without differentiating on the basis of religion. Javed Ahmad is differently-abled and has been working with physically and intellectually challenged children in Pulwama and Anantnag . In her 70s, Tulsi Gowda is a reservoir of tribal knowledge of herbs and plants. Women from a wide range of disciplines have been recognised.

Sporting disciplines that are less discussed, such as kabaddi and basketball, have found recognition, as have para Olympians .

Title: Rallies against CAA, NRC amid Republic Day celebrations
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Activists of various organisations under the banner of LRPV took out rallies and staged demonstrations against... Read More

VISAKHAPATNAM: Activists of various organisations under the banner of Loukika Rajyanga Parirakshana Vedika (LRPV) took out rallies and staged demonstrations against the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) and the National Register of citizens ( NRC ) during the Republic Day celebrations in Visakhapatnam on Sunday.

Terming the BJP’s governance akin to the British rule, CPI(M) leader K Lokandham said that the saffron party has been trying to issue citizenship cards on the basis of religion. “The BJP government has been trying to divide India with its pro-Hindu approach and by forcibly implementing CAA and NRC across the nation.”

B Ganga Rao, another CPI(M) leader said, “There is an urgent need for Indians to remain united, uphold constitutional values and safeguard democracy.”

JV Satyanarayana Murthy of CPI, who was also among the protesters said, “We have decided to spread the message that Hindus, Sikhs, Muslims, Christians and people of other religions are all one and everyone stands united. We will not allow the BJP to sow seeds of communal discord among the people. We will continue our fight till the central government scraps CAA and NRC.”

Title: 220 youngsters from Jharkhand in Visakhapatnam as part of exchange programme
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

VISAKHAPATNAM: As many as 220 youngsters from Jharkhand are currently touring the city as part of the National-Level Youth Exchange Programme under Union ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports. On Sunday they visited all the popular tourist spots in the city.

The Visakhapatnam district co-ordinator of Nehru Yuva Kendra Sangathan (NYKS), an autonomous organisation under the ministry, G Maheswara Rao said nearly 70% of the youths seem enthusiastic and have voluntarily participated in all the activities as part of the programme for the last few days.

A total of 33 participants from Palamu, West Singhbhum, Bokaro, Hazaribagh, Chatra and Ranchi and 22 people from Garhwa are taking part in the programme, which will be held in the city till January 28.

So far, Swami Guneshananda from RK Mission, Visakhapatnam has addressed the youths on various principles of Swami Vivekananda. Philanthropist NC Ramachandra Reddy distributed Swami Vivekananda’s books among them.

A resource person who is an architect from Hyderabad, B Karuna Sri, gave a presentation on ‘youth-career’. Doctor S Uma Maheswari and fitness specialists S Murali Mohan, Ramya and Ramadevi spoke to them on health.

Speaking to TOI, one of the students, Rajesh from Jharkhand, said, “Visakhapatnam is a beautiful city and the beaches are amazing.”

Title: Republic Day: Patriotic spirit engulfs Visakhapatnam
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Visakhapatnam Steel Plant celebrated the day with patriotic fervor in Ukkunagaram. PK Rath, CMD, RINL-VSP unfu... Read More

VISAKHAPATNAM: The 71st Republic Day celebrations in the city saw the participation of people from all walks of life. Students, young professionals as well as organisations celebrated the day. Hundreds of students gathered at Andhra Medical College (AMC) where the NCC unit of the college— College (4A) Naval Medical Unit took the lead in the Republic Day parade.

RINL, Visakhapatnam Steel Plant celebrated the day with patriotic fervor in Ukkunagaram. PK Rath, CMD, RINL-VSP unfurled the national flag, took the salute and inspected the guard of honour accorded by the CISF Jawans, Home Guards and school children.

Rajesh Tripathi, IRSE, managing director, Dredging Corporation of India Ltd unfurled the national flag at the corporation’s office. The national flag was also unfurled at the premises of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL). V Ratanraj, executive director of the Visakha refinery inspected a guard of honour.

Meanwhile, two women bikers, 51-year-old Vaishali Kulkarni More and 41-year-old Supriya Goel embarked on their ride to Goa to participate in the India National Rally 1.0 organised by Women’s International Motorcycle Association . Biker group Road Thrill (RT) Vizag also conducted a ‘Grand Patriotic Ride’ from RK Beach to Bheemili.

Title: China-returned doc quarantined in Rajasthan
Content: A suspected case of coronavirus has been reported in Jaipur, following which the patient has been kept in isolation, state health minister Raghu Sharma said on Sunday.He said a doctor, who returned to India after completing the MBBS course in China, was kept in isolation at the SMS Hospital on the suspicion of being affected by the virus.Directions have been given to conduct a screening of his family. The minister said a blood sample of the patient was sent to the National Virology Laboratory , Pune. He said a total of 18 people from four districts had returned from China and district chiefs have been directed to keep them under watch.

Title: Marquee projects bring Greater Chennai Corporation engineers accolades
Content:
5,000 cycles at 378 locations to reduce carbon footprint and improve last mile connectivity from metro station... Read More

CHENNAI: For their exceptional work in completing a wide variety of projects including the T Nagar pedestrian plaza, cycle-sharing scheme and rainwater harvesting drive across Chennai, Greater Chennai Corporation awarded the team of special projects on Sunday.The team led by chief engineer (special and general projects ) L Nandakumar was given the award by corporation commissioner G Prakash. Raj Cherubal, CEO of Chennai Smart City Ltd , received the award as majority of the projects executed by the special projects team were using the smart city funds.While pedestrian plaza has been hailed as a tourist attraction on the lines of Trafalgar Square in London and Times Square in New York, the cycle sharing project has helped improve the last-mile connectivity and cut down on carbon emissions, said officials. The rainwater harvesting drive has ensured that around 3 lakh houses in the city installed structures that have helped improve the groundwater level in the city by at least four metres.Senior officials said the recognition by corporation was much deserved as most engineers worked on a punishing schedule to finish the smart city projects, especially the pedestrian plaza. They had to work till 4am through the night to supervise the digging up work on pedestrian plaza and then return to work at 10am to attend to other issues."It required co-ordination with other agencies like TANGEDCO, Metrowater and police. For instance, in one case Metrowater had to be coaxed to remove blocks in a pipeline which was then done using a robotic machine," said an official.Also multiple rounds of negotiations were conducted with the traders in Pondy Bazaar who suspected that the wide footpath was a backdoor move to bring back hawkers on to the road. "We convinced that this would increase their business as foreigners would come in. They are now happy," the official said.

Title: Police carry out raids in Bihar to nab JNU’s Sharjeel
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

A joint police team of three states —Delhi, UP and Bihar —conducted raids on the ancestral house of JNU studen... Read More

NEW DELHI: Former Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) student Sharjeel Imam has been booked for delivering inflammatory speeches in opposition to Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register for Citizens (NRC). A Delhi Police team along with cops from Aligarh and Bihar Police raided his residence in Bihar, but he was not found.

“A case under IPC sections 124 (offence by words, either spoken or written causes disaffection against government), 153 (promoting enmity between different religious groups with an intent to create disharmony) and 505 (statements conducing to public mischief) has been registered against Imam. He is currently absconding and efforts are being made to nab him,” said a senior Crime Branch officer.

Investigating officials said Imam had delivered a similar speech at Jamia Millia Islamia on December 13, 2019. Another speech of his, which was even more inflammatory and instigative against the government, was widely circulated on social media.

The Special Investigation Team of Crime Branch which registered the case is also probing the violence that occurred at Jamia on December 15 last year.

Meanwhile, the alumni of JNU’s Centre for Historical Studies , where Imam had studied, condemned his divisive statements. “Some TV channels are reporting that a JNU alumnus, Sharjeel Imam, said that the present anti-CAA movement is capable of permanently or temporarily cutting off the Northeast from India. The purpose of the legitimate, democratic, protests is exactly the opposite: to keep India socially and territorially a beautiful, harmonious nation. We, the students and alumni of Centre for Historical Studies, where Imam studied, reject with all contempt his alleged statement that calls for India to be dismembered,” read a statement by the alumni.

Title: Chennai: Group protests against CAA in Egmore
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Protesters gathered at the Rajarathinam Stadium

CHENNAI: A group of close to 300 people protested against the Citizenship Amendment Act in the city on Sunday. The protesters, who gathered at the Rajarathinam Stadium in Egmore around 7pm, raised slogans against the features of the law till it was past midnight. They then moved to the Chintadripet police station and demonstrated.

Earlier, at midnight on Saturday, more than 100 people with disabilities assembled outside the Madras high court to protest against implementation of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and the National Population Register (NPR). They held a peaceful candle light vigil holding posters.

S Namburajan of the Tamil Nadu Association for the Rights of All Types of Differently Abled and Caregivers said once implemented, the registry will have an adverse impact on the lives of the disabled. “At least 20% of people with disabilities were abandoned by their families or relatives on the streets. Now, if they ask for documents of their forefathers, where will they get them from? Government offices are not accessible. The government has no solution for that,” he said.

He further added that it took a long time for people to avail benefits because many did not get their Aadhaar cards. “Because of NPR, their plight might worsen,” he said.

Title: Kerala: Now, Catholic priest warns against 'ignoring love jihad'
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

KOCHI: Continuing the debate on " Love Jihad " in Kerala, a senior priest of the Catholic Church said the incidents of young women from the southern state being used as " sex slaves " in war-torn nations are a reality and turning a blind eye to it "amounts to giving a silent sanction" to that.

Days after the state government rejected the Syro-Malabar Church Bishops ' view over the issue of "Love Jihad" in the state, KCBC spokesperson Fr Varghese Vallikkatt has criticised the state and central governments for not conducting a proper probe into the cases of "missing women and children" from the state.

Kerala Catholic Bishops Council (KCBC) is the Apex body of the Bishops of various Catholic rites in Kerala. Syro-Malabar Church head Cardinal George Alencherry is its current president. Asserting that 'Love Jihad' is a reality, Vallikkatt said in a video released on Sunday that ignoring such incidents "amounts to giving a silent sanction" to it.

In the video clip, aired by media, the priest said no effective investigation has been carried out either by the Centre or by the state government into the whereabouts of the people who went missing "after being trapped in love".

Quoting media reports, Vallikkatt said such missing women and children were later traced to other nations where they are being used as sex slaves and terror operatives. Referring to the incidents of Christian women taken to Syria and Afghanistan after being allegedly trapped in "Love Jihad", he said some of them were traced even to jails of the conflict-hit nations. The priest further said the probe into the cases of 'Love Jihad' have not reached the real culprits so far.

He blamed governments for not maintaining a data of 'Love Jihad' cases even after the courts made strong observations on it.

Vallikkatt said that, in the video, he was expressing the views of the people on the issue.

His statement is also in line with the stand of the Synod of the Syro-Malabar Church, which recently kicked up a debate, saying "Love Jihad is a reality" and alleged that scores of Christian women from the state were being lured into the trap of Islamic State and used in terror activities.

The Synod has accused the state police of not viewing the matter cautiously and taking timely action in Love Jihad cases.

Responding to the allegations of the Synod, Kerala finance minster Thomas Isaac had said the charges of the Bishops have "no factual basis."

"If there are concrete cases or allegations, they will definitely be looked into. But the Kerala government does not believe that there is any basis for such generalisation," he had said.

Title: Centre should mind its job, says Ajit Pawar on NIA probing Elgar case
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Maharashtra deputy CM Ajit Pawar (File Photo)

PUNE: The Maharashtra government was trying to go to the root of the 2017 Elgar Parishad case when it was suddenly handed over to the NIA by the Centre, deputy CM Ajit Pawar said here on Sunday.

He also sought to remind the Centre about the federal structure of governance when asked about the development .

"I feel the Centre and state governments should do their respective works. The Centre can intervene when an issue of the national level crops up," Pawar said on the sidelines of the launch of Rs 10 'Shiv Bhojan Thali' - a flagship scheme of the Shiv Sena-NCP-Congress government .

Pune Police are probing whether "provocative" speeches made at the Elgar Parishad conclave led to the caste violence around Koregaon Bhima the next day.

Title: Man Crush Monday: 10 stylish photos of Vicky Kaushal
Content: From being an engineer to winning the National Film Award, Vicky Kaushal’s career has been nothing short of a roller coaster ride. A ride which is just seeing heights of success and we hope that this ride continues to climb high. He has changed the game completely for the new-age actors. Along this journey Vicky has also impressed everyone with his dressing skills. Similar to his movie selections his fashion choices have been splendid and well suited. From his movie promotions to his vacations, the actor has always tried experimenting with different outfits and has nailed each and every look. He is always setting new fashion trends for the youth to follow.The 31-year-old actor makes everything look so simple and effortless, from his acting to his fashion trends, his mantra for success is the same and that is simplicity at its best. What makes him our man crush of the day? His relatable style. The actor has a ‘desi’ comfort in his style, which can be worn by anyone. Be it kurtas or tuxedos, it's hard to keep our eyes off him.Here are some photos of Vicky Kaushal for all those who want to take some pointers from one of the most stylish men of Bollywood.

Title: PV Sindhu: To receive the Padma Bhushan at 24 is a huge honour, my parents are incredibly proud: PV Sindhu
Content: It was a super Saturday for PV Sindhu , who became the youngest sportsperson to be conferred the Padma Bhushan honour on the eve of India’s 71st Republic Day. The 24-year-old, who was in Lucknow for the ongoing Premier Badminton League when the news broke, was overwhelmed to say the least. “I couldn’t believe it when I heard the news. Even as I was processing it, my phone just kept ringing as people were calling from everywhere to congratulate me; my teammates brought a cake to celebrate. It was surreal,” shares Sindhu, adding, “It’s a huge honour and I’m grateful to the Indian government for this recognition. It’s a big boost not just for me, but for all young athletes aspiring for a career in sports. I would also like to take this opportunity to thank the Badminton Association of India (BAI) and the CMs of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh , who have always encouraged me.”Sindhu joins an elite list of sportspersons to be conferred with the Padma Bhushan. She is the third badminton player to be bestowed with the honour after Pullela Gopichand and Saina Nehwal. For a 24-year-old, the title of Padma Bhushan could be daunting, but Sindhu says the title will only motivate her to do better.“To receive this title at such a young age is a great honour and my parents are incredibly proud. But I don’t think the award will add more pressure, in fact, it will motivate me to push further,” says the Badminton World Champion.Sindhu is looking forward to receive the award from the President of India, Ram Nath Kovind, in a ceremonial function at the Rashtrapati Bhavan in March/April. “I have memories of receiving my Padma Shri award from former President Pranab Mukherjee and it was truly special. I’m sure this too will be equally memorable, if not more. It will be an emotional moment, that’s for sure,” she says.The World No.6, who became the first Indian woman to win an Olympic silver at the 2016 Rio Olympics, says the Padma Bhushan is the perfect shot in the arm for her ahead of this year’s Olympics in Tokyo. “This honour has given me a massive boost ahead of the Olympics. I hope I can take this encouragement and win the gold medal for the country this time,” she says, signing off.
