Title: Gurugram: Why three new MLPs could lead to more congestion, not ease it
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Except all three are in Sadar Bazar, within 900m of each other, and could end up causing traffic congestion in... Read More

GURUGRAM: The one multi-level parking (MLP) in the city having fallen into disuse, work beginning on three others — after 11 years — should have been welcome news.

Except all three are in Sadar Bazar, within 900m of each other, and could end up causing traffic congestion instead of easing it.

“There is no point to having three parking complexes so close to each other but with few access roads. The entire Old Delhi-Gurugram stretch is clogged because of illegal parking. There are other places which need to be cleared up. Why are they all in one locality?” asked Dhruv Singh, a resident of Palam Vihar.

There was a lot that didn’t work for the Sector 29 MLP — there was very little commercial activity nearby and few last-mile connectivity options to make the complex financially viable.

With that in mind, the three new MLPs have been planned as mixed-use ones. The Sadar Bazar area is a busy place with narrow lanes, lined with vehicles parked illegally on the roads. The idea was to decongest that. But streamlining traffic flow may need to factor in more.

“Thousands of vehicles will line up on the main road to get into the parking lots. It will get even more chaotic than it is now,” said S Velmurugan, senior principal scientist and former head of the traffic engineering and safety division of Central Road Research Institute.

To resolve this, he added, two things need to be done. “There should be multiple access roads to spread the traffic out. Availability of parking space and information about it need to be modernized. The conventional first come first serve system won’t do. Online booking and message boards displaying occupancy could streamline traffic. Most importantly, there has to be strict enforcement of no parking rules and restrictions on vehicle movement,” he said. Without this, he further said, these MLPs would fall into disuse the way other parking spaces in the city have.

Urban transport expert Sewa Ram said there needs to a dedicated traffic and market management policy. “Without a policy to streamline traffic and business operations in the area, the parking facility will not have much value. Streets need to be de-cluttered and pedestrian-friendly so people can access the stretch properly after parking,” he added.

In addition, there needs to be a thrust on mass transit. “Something like Chandni Chowk needs to be developed here. People shouldn’t have to depend on road transport to access the market. A tunnel road or elevated road for vehicles heading for the railway station could be explored,” Ram said.

The MCG said its plan is to provide enough parking space to the thousands of shop owners who have to park on the roadside now. “Once there is a dedicated space to accommodate these vehicles, things will be streamlined. We have asked the contractor to explore multiple access routes to avoid traffic converging on just one or two stretches,” a senior MCG official said.

Title: Gurugram: Bus service to cover five more routes, three in new sectors
Content:
A GMCBL bus

GURUGRAM: The Gurugram Metropolitan City Bus Limited (GMCBL) on Sunday added five more routes to its existing service to cater to the residents of new sectors.Responding to the demands from the new sector residents for bus routes in sectors 58-115, GMCBL came up with five new routes that were launched by state transport minister Mool Chand Sharma during the Republic Day celebrations in the city.The new routes include route 135 (from Sector-90 to IndusInd bank in Cyber City), route 242U (Gurugram bus stand-Farrukhnagar-Gurugram bus stand), route 122 (Sikanderpur metro station to Gurugram bus stand), route 111E (Vatika Chowk to Sector 55/56 metro station) and route 116E (Huda City Centre metro station to Railway station). Besides, route number 116E and 122, all other routes are going through the new sectors. (see map)According to the GMCBL officials, five buses will run on each of the newly launched routes and the number of buses might be eventually increased depending on the ridership.“These new routes have been created based on feedback from the residents and keeping in mind their mobility requirement,” said a GMCBL official.With the addition of these routes, GMCBL will be serving on a total of 18 routes with a fleet of 150 buses. According to the GMCBL website, the approximate ridership of the services are around 55,000 passengers per day. TOI had recently reported that a few new sector residents had visited newly appointed GMCBL chief Sonal Goel and requested her to run buses in the new sectors.The lack of public transport in these sectors has been a huge concern for the residents and the launch of the new routes, come as a big relief for the residents, especially as the metro routes will take another four years to be functional.“City bus service covering new sectors will be a big relief for us. We hope that these routes can be expanded in the future,” said Manoj Lakhani, a Sector 90 resident. Meanwhile, GMCBL is working on the approvals for the city bus route connecting Gurugram and Delhi which has been in the pipeline for a while now.The bus route is expected to connect Gurugram with Dhaula Kuan and Dwarka.“The route has already been approved by the chief minister during a GMDA meeting and we are just waiting for the interstate permit to run the bus,” said a GMCBL official.A route connecting Gurugram and Faridabad is also under process and is likely to be launched soon.

Title: Grammys 2020: Priyanka Chopra decks up in a plunging gown and Nick Jonas suits up in Gold, while also paying a tribute to Kobe Bryant
Content: Sushant Singh Rajput’s death case is currently being investigated by the Central Bureau Of Investigation (CBI) and they have been questioning a lot of people connected to the late actor. According to the latest report on India Today, three officers who are a part of the probe, have stated that their team has so far not found any evidence that suggests Sushant was murdered on June 14.

Title: 'I'm being taken to Delhi', tweets Chandra Shekhar Azad a day after his arrest in Hyderabad
Content:
तेलंगाना में तानाशाही चरम पर है लोगों के विरोध प्रदर्शन करने के अधिकार को छीना जा रहा है पहले हमारे लोगों को लाठि… https://t.co/J74HBDyjrc — Chandra Shekhar Aazad (@BhimArmyChief) 1580083762000

(With inputs from agencies)

NEW DELHI: A day after his arrest in Hyderabad, Chandra Shekhar Azad is being taken to Delhi, the dalit leader informed via Twitter.On Sunday Azad lawyer Mehmood Pracha was arrested by Telangana police while he was on his way to attend an anti-CAA protest being organised by the alumni of Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS) and All India Dalit Muslim Adivasi Progressive Front (AIDMPAF)."Dictatorship is at its peak in Telangana. People's right to protest is being snatched. First, our people were beaten with lathis and now they have arrested me. Now they have brought me to the airport and sending me off to Delhi. The Bahujan samaj will never forget this humiliation, the Telangana chief minister should remember. I will come back soon," Azad tweeted.As the police had denied permission for the public meeting, it took Azad and others accompanying him into custody and shifted them to various police stations.Azad and lawyer Mehmood Pracha were detained after they stepped out of a hotel in Masab Tank to go to the public meeting venue at Mehdipatnam.They were shifted from one police station to the other and some supporters following the police vehicle lost track of it. Though there were reports that they were taken to Bolarum or Medchal police stations, his supporters did not find him there.Few supporters of the dalit leader were detained when they went to Hyderabad police commissioner's office and tried to stage a protest demanding to know his whereabouts.Azad's supporters took to the social media to condemn his arrest and demanded his immediate release. #FreeBhimArmyChief was one of the top trends on Twitter. Some of his followers tweeted that he may be taken to the airport and sent back to Delhi.Azad's detention came 10 days after his release on bail from Tihar Jail. He was arrested by Delhi police on December 20 on charges of inciting people during anti-CAA protest. He was held when he tried to take out a march from Jamia Masjid to Jantar Mantar.

Title: Bihar: JNU student Sharjeel Imam evades arrest, house raided
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Sharjeel Imam

PATNA: A joint team of Delhi, UP and Bihar police conducted raids on the ancestral house of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) student Sharjeel Imam at Kako in Jehanabad district of Bihar late on Saturday night after an arrest warrant was issued against him by Aligarh police in a sedition case. Imam, one of the organisers of the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) protest at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, had allegedly made "seditious" statements in Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) by calling for cutting off Assam from the rest of India.

Jehanabad SP Maneesh told TOI on Sunday that raids were carried out in search of Imam at Kako Bazar but they could not arrest him. Apart from UP, cases have also been filed against Imam in Assam and Delhi for his January 16 provocative speeches at AMU, a video of which later went viral on social media. In the video, he is heard giving a clarion call to Muslims to cut off Assam from India at Chicken's Neck. Chicken's Neck, or the Siliguri corridor, is a narrow stretch of land of about 22km, located in West Bengal, that connects northeastern states to the rest of India. This corridor is inhabited largely by Muslims.

The SP admitted that some family members of Imam were quizzed. Sleuths of intelligence agencies also interrogated Imam's close relatives. A few of them have been detained as well, he said. "We are cooperating with the police teams from outside the state in their investigation. There is no case pending against Imam here," the SP told TOI over phone.

Authoritative sources said the police team left for Patna where some relatives of Imam were living. "Imam's immediate family members live in Patna. We can't share more information related to the ongoing investigation as it's a sensitive issue. Senior officials are monitoring the police operation," an officer posted at the police headquarters said.

Imam has stated on his official Facebook profile that he is from Patna and has done schooling from St. Xavier's High School here as well as from DPS-Vasant Kunj in New Delhi. Later he got admitted to IIT-Bombay, from where he did postgraduation in computer science. He also worked as IT programmer at the University of Copenhagen before coming to JNU, where he is a student in Centre for Historical Studies.

Meanwhile, another video of Imam has surfaced, in which he is heard asking people at a sit-in, reportedly in Gaya district of Bihar, to come out of villages and block national highways in a bid to cut off vehicular movement between states.

"...The remedy for our problems is forcing the government to agree to our demands... The first thing we did was to unite people. This step was important because Muslim people stopped coming out on the streets. Last time, we were seen in 1985 but we have not come out on streets thereafter, especially not in such large numbers. The second step will be to use the anger of Muslims by forcefully stopping vehicular movement by sitting on the streets and not getting up till this (citizenship) law is taken back," he is heard saying in the video, the authenticity of which TOI could not verify.

Title: Here's why Ajay Devgn and Saif Ali Khan's period drama 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' is a phenomenal success; Senior trade analyst shares his view
Content: Ajay Devgn, Saif Ali Khan and Kajol starrer ' Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior ' is on a phenomenal run in the domestic circuit. The period drama has been doing exceptionally well and creating several records while achieving milestone figures as well.The Om Raut directorial which earned Rs Rs 115.28 crore in the first week and Rs 77 crore in the second has gone on to enter the Rs 200 crore club with ease. The film has managed to dominate the ticket counters giving tough competition to other films like Deepika Padukone 's 'Chhapaak', Varun Dhawan-Shraddha Kapoor's 'Street Dancer 3D' and Kangana Ranaut 's 'Panga' as well.In an exclusive interaction with ETimes, senior trade analyst Taran Adarsh shared his view on Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior's remarkable run in the domestic circuit. Talking about it, he said, "It's a fantastic film which is completely flawless and beautiful. It's a very well made historical film with such brilliant performances and superb storytelling."Furthermore, he added, " There's so much of patriotism and love for your country for people in it. I would say full marks to the makers and the director especially, who has created such a beautiful film."Earlier in an interview with Etimes, Adarsh had even predicted that 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' would give 'Street Dancer 3D' and 'Panga' a tough run for their money at the box office. He had said, "Both the films will face tough competition from 'Tanhaji', especially in Maharashtra."

Title: Karnataka: Chaos within BJP as clamour grows for senior ministers to step down
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

MYSURU: Away from the glitter of Republic Day celebrations, chaos reigned in the BJP as ministers came under pressure to step down to accommodate defectors who won on BJP tickets and party loyalists who are waiting in the wings.

During an event at Suttur Mutt on Sunday, chief minister BS Yediyurappa refused to answer questions on the issue, tersely saying: “I will not respond to questions on cabinet expansion.” However, at the event, Yediyurappa welcomed Chikkaballapura legislator D Sudhakar as a “future minister”, indicating at least one of the 11 turncoats who won is certain of a place in his cabinet.

Earlier, Sudhakar had dismissed the possibility of defeated candidates being made ministers, citing the Supreme Court verdict upholding their disqualification. “The Supreme Court gave clear directives while dealing with our petition and it has to be factored in,” he told reporters.

However, AH Vishwanath, one of the disqualified MLAs who lost and who is reportedly pushing for a cabinet berth, found support in Chamarajanagar BJP MP V Srinivas Prasad, who said all 17 rebel MLAs should find a place in the council of ministers. “I stand by what I had said earlier,” he said.

Meanwhile, BJP legislator and former Union minister Basanagouda Patil Yatnal said in Vijayapura that all those who enjoyed privileges of power earlier should now make a “sacrifice” for the sake of the party. Yatnal appeared to be targeting former CM, opposition leader and present industries minister Jagadish Shettar and former DyCM and legislative council opposition leader KS Eshwarappa, who is now the RDPR minister.

“Despite serving as a senior minister in the [Atal Bihari] Vajpayee government, I’ve given up ministerial aspirations,” Yatnal said. “I expect all those who previously enjoyed power including those who served as CM, DyCM and opposition leader to sacrifice their posts now. Sacrifice is not only for cadres but also for leaders who make speeches about it.”

In Tumakuru, law and parliamentary affairs minister JC Madhuswamy said he was prepared to resign if the party instructs him to do so. “I will happily vacate my cabinet berth to ensure a stable government,” he said, adding sarcastically that he will even resign from his MLA seat if asked.

But health minister B Sriramulu, in Chitradurga, sang a different tune saying all those commenting on resigning from posts were talking in their “personal capacity”. He evaded questions on resigning and instead suggested he continues to nurture hope of being elevated to DyCM. “Yes, people are demanding it [that he be made DyCM]. However, it is up to the central leadership and I will abide by whatever decision they take,” Sriramulu said.

Reports suggest Yediyurappa has sent a tentative list of about seven names from the disqualified lot, who won on party tickets, and another set of BJP loyalists to central leadership for approval.

Title: Suspected case of coronavirus in Jaipur
Content:
Representative image

JAIPUR: A suspected case of coronavirus has been reported in Rajasthan, following which the patient has been kept in isolation, state health minister Raghu Sharma said on Sunday. He said a doctor, who returned to India after completing the MBBS course in China, was kept in isolation at the SMS Hospital in Jaipur on the suspicion of being affected by coronavirus.Directions were given to conduct a screening of all the family members of the patient, he said. In an official statement, the minister said a blood sample of the patient was sent to the National Virology Laboratory in Pune. He added that a total of 18 people from four districts of the state had returned to the country from China and the respective district chiefs and medical officers were directed to keep them under surveillance for 28 days.

Title: CAA Protest in Mumbai: Women stage Shaheen Bagh-like protest in Mumbai
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

The protests continued through wee hours on Monday with women raising slogans

MUMBAI: Hundreds of women have been sitting on a road in south Mumbai's Nagpada area since the January 26 night against the CAA-NRC-NPR regime, apparently drawing inspiration from New Delhi's Shaheen Bagh protest .

Holding placards and raising slogans against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, the National Register of Citizens and the National Population Register (NPR), the women sat down on the Morland road outside Arabia Hotel on Sunday late night.

Most of them are residents of Muslim-dominated Madanpura, Jhoola Maidan, Apripada, and Mumbai Central areas.

They have so far not withdrawn their agitation despite senior officers of the Mumbai Police urging them to do so, an official said on Monday morning.

The women protesters can be seen holding placards with slogans like "We stand against CAA, NRC, NPR", "They tried to divide us, Respect my existence or expect my Resistance" written on them.

Slogans hailing Hindu-Muslim unity and brotherhood were also raised.

Senior Nagpada police station inspector Shalini Sharma said she had requested the protesters to take a prior permission from the police, but the women refused to budge and continued to occupy the road.

In Delhi, thousands of people, including women and children, have been protesting since December 15 at Shaheen Bagh and nearby Jamia Millia Islamia against the CAA and the NRC.

He was 41.Bryant, a five-time NBA champion with the Los Angeles Lakers and two-time Olympic gold medallist, died in a fiery helicopter crash in suburban Los Angeles that also claimed the life of his 13-year-old daughter Gianna and seven others.Following are reactions to the death of basketball legend Bryant and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna.

Title: Amazon app quiz January 27, 2020: Get answers to these five questions and win Rs 20,000 as Amazon Pay balance
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Daily app quiz is live on the mobile app of Amazon. The daily quiz started at 8am and will continue till 12pm. As part of today’s app quiz, participants will stand a chance to win Rs 20,000 as Amazon Pay balance .

For those unaware, Amazon app quiz consists of five questions based on current affairs and general knowledge. To become eligible for the prize, participants must answer all five questions correctly. One wrong answer eliminates you from the quiz.

Result of today’s quiz will be announced on February 29. There is usually one answer of the quiz who is selected via lucky draw. Here are the five questions of today’s quiz along with their answer that can help you win Rs 20,000 as Amazon Pay balance.

Question 1- The root “hibern” in the word “hibernate” relates to which of these?

Answer: Winter

Question2- Which Indian is the current Chief Economist of the International Monetary Fund?

Answer: Gita Gopinath

Question3- Who was the first woman parade adjutant for the Republic Day parade?

Answer: Tanya Shergill

Question4- Which cricketer recently won the ‘Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy’ for ICC Player of the Year?

Answer: Ben Stokes

Question5- Which of these countries receives 20,000 tulips each year as a gift from the Netherlands?

Answer: Canada

Title: Remove encroachments from south Delhi forests: NGT
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

National Green Tribunal

NEW DELHI: National Green Tribunal has directed Delhi government to remove encroachments and illegal constructions from south Delhi's Jaunapur and Dera Mandi forest areas, stating that no encroachments can be allowed on forest land. The government has been asked to submit a status report of the work carried out. The next date of hearing is on May 14.

The green bench said intensive monitoring had to be carried out in order to remove encroachments, thereby restoring the area to its original direction. NGT stated that a report can be filed before the next date by email. "Let further steps in the matter be taken expeditiously," it noted.

NGT was informed that the forest department had demolished several illegal constructions in the area in August, 2019. However, the high court had ordered 'status quo' in the matter after a petition was filed against the demolition process.

Title: Air India Sale: Govt to sell 100% stake in Air India; issues bid document
Content:
(Representative image)

(These trademarks are proposed to continue with AI post sale. The time period for which they need to be retained will be mentioned in the request for proposal that will be issued after March 31 when qualified bidders have been selected.)

NEW DELHI: For the second time in two years, the government has rolled out the process to sell Air India by inviting bids to sell its 100% stake in AI and AI Express and its 50% stake in the ground handling JV AI-SATS. Interested parties will need to submit their expression of interest (EOI) by 5 pm on March 17, 2020, and qualified bidders will be notified on March 31. However, the preliminary information memorandum (PIM) for this key strategic divestment says these dates may be subject to change.The combined debt of AI and AI Express is Rs 60,074 crore. Interested bidders (IB) will be expected to take over Rs 23,286 crore of this debt — all of which is debt for aircraft that they will be taking over as the transaction. The brand name Air India, and its associated terms, will need to be retained by successful bidders for a time period that will be mentioned in the request for proposal (RFP) to be issued after March 31.The iconic Nariman Point HQ in Mumbai and the corporate HQ in Delhi near Connaught Place are not part of this transaction and will remain with the government. Successful bidder will be allowed to use them during the transition period for a couple of years. “AI is in possession of various articles of arts, paintings, objects and artefacts. These are not a part of the proposed transaction,” the PIM states.Learning from the experience of the first unsuccessful bid, the key changes made this time are: Offering to sell 100% government take in AI and AI Express, instead of 76% earlier. This change gives complete operational freedom to the new owner.Secondly, last time the bidders were expected to take over debt of Rs 24,576 crore and current liabilities of Rs 8,816 crore — a combine figure of Rs 33,392 crore.This time the debt expected to be taken over has been reduced by almost a third to Rs 23,286, crore all of which is backed by aircraft part of the transaction. The principle this time has been to make current assets equal to current liabilities for bidders. The entire working capital and other non-aircraft debt will be retained by the government.The transaction advisor is Ernst & Young LLP India.“Any private/public limited company, limited liability partnership, body corporate, whether registered or incorporated in India or outside India; or Fund; in each case which is eligible to invest under the laws of India (subject to such parties obtaining applicable statutory approvals) either as a sole bidder or as part of a Consortium are eligible to participate,” it says. The interested bidder, whether a sole bidder or a consortium, should have a minimum net worth of Rs 3,500 crore. Net worth of each participating member in a consortium should be at least Rs 350 crore (10% of Rs 3,500 crore).If a schedule Indian carrier is a member of such a consortia with its equity shareholding in the consortia upto 51%, the minimum net worth criteria will not apply.Except IndiGo, all other scuffle Indian airlines have a negative net worth. “The negative net worth of a member, only if it is a scheduled airline operator in India, would be considered as nil. However, the remaining members of the consortium in this case will have to meet the minimum financial capability” criteria it says. Foreign airlines will need to meet the net worth criteria.With 121 aircraft in its fleet (not including the 4 Boeing 747s that will be retained with the government with an AI subsidiary not being sold for VIP use), AI’s debt as on March 31, 2019, was Rs 58,282.9 crore, with contingent liabilities of another Rs 3,178 crore. AI has 13,629 employees (permanent and fix term contracts) with wage arrears of Rs 1,383.7 crore and a provision has been made in AI books for Rs 207-crore arrears for narrow body fleet employees.With 25 Boeing 737s in its fleet, AI Express has Rs 1,791 crore of debt.The PIM states in Q2 FY 2019-20, AI and AI Express’ combined share of international air travel to and from India is at 50.64% (among Indian carriers) and18.4% on an overall basis (considering both Indian and foreign airlines); and within India is 12.72%.In Video: Air India sell off: Centre offers 100% stake for sale

Title: Three snatch executive's car at gunpoint in Noida
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

NOIDA: Three men fled with an i20 car after allegedly threatening the owner at gunpoint on January 25 night. The car owner is a senior executive with a telecom major. He had gone to drop his brother-in-law in the City Centre area around 2am on Saturday when the incident took place.

According to police, Abhinav Singh, who stays with his family in Homes 121, works in Gurugram.

Sector 24 station officer (SO) Ramphal Singh said the accused allegedly picked an argument with Singh and then one of them threatened him with a gun. He said an FIR has been lodged.

Title: Kobe Bryant Death News: Kobe Bryant passes away: Priyanka Chopra, Farhan Akhtar, Ranveer Singh, Akshay Kumar and others remember the NBA legend
Content:
What a tragedy. #KobeBryant. #GiannaBryant RIP Deepest condolences to his family and wish them strength at this ti… https://t.co/vsExPoJdyS — Farhan Akhtar (@FarOutAkhtar) 1580094186000

This is heartbreaking. Rest In Peace Kobe. — Nick Jonas (@nickjonas) 1580069843000

I didn’t follow the sport and can’t claim to have known too much about him...but this untimely death of a father an… https://t.co/b6KSMGNF74 — Karan Johar (@karanjohar) 1580076063000

With love and rememberance... #RIPMamba ... #KobeBryant https://t.co/ZSibJr4uuy — Neha Dhupia (@NehaDhupia) 1580095426000

Thank you for the magic and the memories #RIPMamba #KobeForever — Kunal Kapoor (@kapoorkkunal) 1580093476000

#rip #legend #kobe & his daughter Gianna. This is such sad news. God bless their souls. https://t.co/nXT3u3Kiqu — Dino Morea (@DinoMorea9) 1580101162000

Basketball star Kobe Bryant passed away in a helicopter crash on Sunday. The 41 year old sportsman was travelling with his 13 year old daughter Gianna Onore Braynt, who also died in the accident. Fans and celebrities have been sharing heartfelt messages on social media, remembering the NBA legend.In a heartfelt note on Instagram, Priyanka wrote, “Kobe Bryant was my first real introduction to the NBA. I was 13 living in Queens NYC, the same age as his sweet little girl, Gianna. He ignited my love for the sport, competition, and striving for excellence. He inspired an entire generation. His legacy is so much bigger than basketball. This heartbreaking accident also took the life of his young daughter, Gianna. I’m shook and so saddened. My heart goes out to Vanessa, Natalia, Bianka, and Capri Bryant. You are in my thoughts. Also sending my condolences to the loved ones of the other family and pilot in the accident. Being at tonight’s Grammys ceremony in his home at the Staples Center is going to be surreal.” At Grammys, Priyanka remembered the legend by sporting the number ‘24’ on her index finger, Kobe Bryant wore the number during his high school days, while Nick Jonas wore a purple ribbon on his suit as tribute to Kobe Bryant.Akshay Kumar, Arjun Kapoor , Abhishek Bachchan, Ranveer Singh and Farhan Akhtar were among several Bollywood celebrities who took to social media to remember the much loved basketball star.

Title: BS Yediyurappa: My budget will do the talking
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa

MYSURU: Chief minister BS Yediyurappa on Sunday refused to field questions on the state’s finances, merely saying his budget on March 5 will do the talking. The question came in the wake of Siddaramaiah , leader of the opposition, claiming recently that the state’s coffers were dry and its finances were in the doldrums.

However, Yediyurappa insisted the state’s finances were sound and it will be better once promises made by the business community during his trip to Davos turn into concrete investment.

“I will present the budget for 2020-21 on March 5. People will then know about the state’s financial position,” Yediyurappa said during a visit to Suttur Mutt on Sunday. “I will answer Siddaramaiah’s comments during the forthcoming budget session of the state legislature. The Davos meet I attended will benefit the state immensely. It will bring huge investments that will promote industry and agriculture growth and various job-generation activities.”

Title: Delhi assembly elections 2020: 11 move Delhi high court, claim they were denied chance to file papers
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Delhi high court

NEW DELHI: Several aspiring candidates who wanted to contest the upcoming election in the capital have approached Delhi high court after being denied permission to file nomination papers.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

In their plea, the aspiring candidates have also demanded an enquiry on the manner the candidates were dealt with by the election officer. The candidates alleged that the officer allowed chief minister Arvind Kejriwal inside the election office out of turn.

Their plea urges the court to issue directions to poll panel to give them time to file their nomination papers again and also seeks a probe on the mode and manner the candidates were dealt with by the election office.

It further seeks appropriate guidelines to facilitate the smooth filing of the nomination papers by all candidates from all walks of Indian society.

The plea argues that the grounds of rejection of the nomination papers are "flimsy non germane".

The 11 petitioners told the court that in the wake of their democratic mind and a collective decision under a movement "Chaloo Chunaav Laade", they decided to individually contest the polls against the sitting chief minister Arvind Kejriwal and others.

Title: Awadhe Warriors 'trumped' out by Hyderabad Hunters in PBL
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

LUCKNOW: There were surprises galore for home side Awadhe Warriors on Republic Day as they conceded an unassailable 0-4 lead to Hyderabad Hunters with the rubber just three match old at BBD Badminton Academy .

It turned out to be a Super Sunday for the visitors as Vladimir Ivanov and Sikki Reddy upstaged the Awadhe Warriors’ ‘trump’ mixed doubles match against Shin Baek Cheol and Christina Pedersen 15-12, 15-14.

The hosts made the cardinal error of changing the pairing and going out all new. In the previous match against North East Warriors, KS Hyun and Christina Pedersen played and won. Ivanov and Reddy cashed on it to turn the tables on the Warriors. A win in the ‘trump’ match gives two points, and a loss takes away two points.

After Sourabh Verma had earned the opening point for Hyderabad by overcoming Subhankar Dey 14-15, 15-12, 15-10, the defeat of Cheol and Pedersen meant Tanvi Lad had to defeat PV Sindhu to keep the side afloat. But Sindhu was in good form to win 15-8, 15-8 to seal the tie in favour of Hyderabad Hunters.

Title: Delhi polls 2020: Tweeted song before filing for nomination, says Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga
Content:
Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: Responding to the Election Commission notice on why the expenditure for his campaign song should not be added to his election expenses, BJP candidate from Hari Nagar, Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga , on Sunday said that the song 'Bagga Bagga har jagah' was uploaded on his Twitter handle much before he filed his nomination.In his reply to the returning officer of Hari Nagar assembly constituency, Bagga also said since the song was tweeted from his personal account, it cannot be treated as a political advertisement and therefore does not require pre-certification from media certification committee of Delhi election office.The notice was served to Bagga on Friday.In the reply, Bagga said that the tweet was uploaded on Tuesday at 01.30am, well before he filed his nomination. He also requested the Hari Nagar RO to withdraw the notice or provide him with an opportunity of personal hearing or through his election agent or representative prior to taking any action.

Title: Photo: Aditya Roy Kapur unleashes beast mode for 'Malang'
Content:
Photo: Aditya Roy Kapur unleashes beast mode for 'Malang'

Aditya Roy Kapur and Disha Patani are gearing up for the release of their upcoming film 'Malang'. Directed by Mohit Suri, the film also stars Anil Kapoor and Kunal Kemmu in pivotal roles. The stars are currently on a promotional spree and they are leaving no stones unturned. To keep the excitement level high among the movie buffs, the stars have been treating their fans with some unmissable BTS photos, posters and songs. Now, Aditya took to his Instagram handle to share a new still from 'Malang'.In this still, the actor sports a sweaty face. He is flaunting his ferocious look in the picture speaks much about his character in the movie. Looks like that actor unleashed his beast mode. The post was captioned as ''M A L A N G . #7thFeb2020''. As soon as he shared the post, Kunal Kemmu, Manish Malhotra and others showered praises on his look. Apart from this, Aditya will also be seen in Mahesh Bhatt's 'Sadak 2' which also stars Alia Bhatt in the lead role. The film also features, Pooja Bhatt, Sanjay Dutt, Gulshan Grover and Makrand Deshpande in pivotal roles.

Title: Coronavirus: Goa govt to form special task force
Content:
Representative image

PANAJI: The Goa government has decided to form a special task force to monitor cases, if any, of coronavirus in the tourist state.Health minister Vishwajit Rane on Sunday said that people arriving in Goa from the virus-affected regions outside India would be closely monitored."I have given instructions to form a special task force to monitor any cases of coronavirus in Goa. All the activities, including people arriving from the virus-affected regions, would be closely monitored and reported to the state chief secretary," Rane told reporters.The task force will work as per the guidelines laid down by the Union Ministry of Health , he added.The coronavirus is a large family of viruses that causes illnesses ranging from the common cold to acute respiratory syndromes, but the virus in China is a novel strain and not seen before. It has killed 26 people so far, and has caused alarm because of its similarity to SARS ( Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ).No positive case has been detected in India so far.

Title: Karnataka: Manpower crunch hits Lokayukta hard
Content:
File photo of Karnataka Lokayukta

BENGALURU: The Lokayukta appears to have taken on far more than it can handle with its decision to scrutinise assets of every elected public representative from panchayat members up.Until August last year, the anti-corruption body had only members of the legislature in its sights, but it expanded its ambit by ordering even corporators and panchayat members to submit a list of their assets and liabilities.However, five months on, a majority of the affidavits submitted by the 1.3 lakh public representatives in the state are yet to be processed. Reason: The Lokayukta is short of hands to follow-up on these affidavits and identify lacunae, if any.“With 1.3 lakh public representatives, it is a very laborious task,” said an official in the Lokayukta office. “We need a dedicated team to process correspondence and verify affidavits. We cannot manage with existing staff.”The quasi-judicial institution has now urged the government to provide it more manpower , especially in Group B and C categories. Besides, the Lokayukta also faces a crisis in filling posts of additional registrars. Officials say the Lokayukta has requested the government to increase posts of additional registrars for speedy disposal of department inquiries conducted by institutions.“We have asked the government to create four additional registrars posts to deal with departmental inquiries and clear backlogs,” the official said. “The government must appoint retired high court or district and sessions court judges to these posts. We can proceed further only if there is sanction.”But sources say the government is dragging its feet since recruiting more personnel will only increase the burden on the state exchequer.Incidentally, the Lokayukta’s office recently sent two MLAs showcause notices over discrepancies in affidavits they had filed.

Title: Australian Open: Happy to play one of the greatest, says Nick Kyrgios
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Nick Kyrgios and Rafael Nadal. (Getty Images)

MELBOURNE: It's not quite loveall in the Rafael Nadal versus Nick Kyrgios Oz Open fourthround match-up, but the Aussie maybe softening his aggressive stand. And just as well because no one likes a target better than the world No. 1.

Kyrgios reckoned the 19-time major winner was ‘hell of a tennis player', but he has never hung out with the 33-year-old Spaniard and doesn't quite know him. "I'm super excited, playing one of the greatest tennis players on centre court at your own Slam, it's pretty cool. I'm looking forward to it. That's why you play, I guess,” he said.

Nadal might lead the headto-head 4-3, but the Aussie is in front on outdoor hardcourts --2-1. "Ever since the juniors, I enjoyed playing lefties. I feel like I kind of know what game plan I need to bring to be successful against them,” the 24-year-old said. "Rafa is a different beast altogether. I kind of know his patterns. Federer knows his patterns. Everyone knows his patterns, can't do anything about it. He executes them at the highest level.”

In their sixth meeting in Acapulco last year, Kyrgios saved six breakpoints and three match points. He even sent down an underarm serve that appeared to have rattled the Spaniard. "He lacks respect for the public, the rival and towards himself,” Nadal later said of Kyrgios. The Aussie promptly took to social media, posting, "Don't doubt yourself, there are plenty of people who will do that for you. I can smell blood when I play this dude".

Kyrgios attempted to put it all in perspective. "At the end of the day, we're two different tennis players. We go about it completely different," he said. "After Wimbledon, beaten by the better player. I shook his hand, looked him in the eye and said, too good. Even if we don't like each other, there's a layer of respect. He's one of the greatest of all time. I also read that he thinks I'm good for the sport. There's a layer of respect that we both have for each other. Doesn't necessarily mean we like each other. We're going to go out there and give contrasting styles and personalities."

Djokovic junior holds fort

Novak Djokovic's two children — Stefan and Tara — five and two years in age, are already swinging the tennis racket. The tiny tots have the blessings of their parents – 32-year-old Djokovic and wife Jelena.

"I'm giving Stefan all the time and space that he needs in the world. I really want him and my daughter to express honest desire to take the racket and the ball and go to the court or just hit against a wall," Djokovic said. "I like them to be active. They are active. They're trying different things."

The Serb, winner of 16 major titles, pointed out that Stefan also enjoys martial arts and football. "He likes to play (tennis) with me and with his best friend. He doesn't like to play with too many other people."

Asked who Stefan's favourite player was, Djokovic said: "He still hasn't expressed who his favourite is. I'm working on becoming his favourite player."

Title: Tracing 2,000-year-old Tamil footprint in southeast Asia
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

The Mariamman temple in Singapore, one of the oldest Hindu temples in the country

CHENNAI: Although the Tamil diaspora is rich, the history of Tamils in connection with those countries is yet to be studied in detail. Keeping this in mind, two Singapore-based institutions jointly documented an account of the 2,000-year-old history of the Tamils in Singapore and the other Southeast Asian countries.

The connection between Tamil Nadu and the lands across the Bay of Bengal speak of one of the most penetrating soft power projections in the world and yet that tale has largely been ignored. "The sense of history among ancient Tamils is different from that of the Greeks or the Chinese. They clearly lack written records meeting conventional standards of historiography, especially those dictated by European scholars," said Arun Mahizhnan who with Nalina Gopal documented the history.

Tamil classical literature, dating from 300BC to AD300, is rich with fascinating details and insights. "There are countless stone inscriptions, copper plates and palm leaves that record at least some aspects of life in ancient times. Some of these literary and lithographic references relate to Tamils in Southeast Asia . They provide a reasonably reliable evidence of the past," he said. Both Arun and Nalina were in the city to speak about the challenges they faced during documentation of the project.

Titled 'In sojourners to settlers', the first volume traces Tamil connections, settlements and influences in the Southeast Asia, especially in the pre-modern era. The second focuses on Singapore and relates the journey of Tamils from sojourners to settlers. Maritime links between south India and Southeast Asia date to the late prehistoric period. "Tamils acted as intermediaries in a trade network from the Roman empire and the Mediterranean in the west to the other side of the Bay of Bengal. By the early centuries (AD), pre-modern Tamil diasporas including seafarers and traders travelling to littoral areas in Southeast Asian polities had become common," said Nalina Gopal.

Epigraphic and archaeological finds that attest to the early presence of Tamils in Southeast Asia include 10 medieval Tamil inscriptions, coins, Indo-Roman Rouletted pottery, ceramics, beads, and bronze artefacts. "The oldest inscription in the Tamil language dates to the 2nd or 3rd century AD on a potsherd found at Phu Khao Thong in south Thailand bearing the word 'turavon', meaning ascetic," she said. While the 3rd century AD touchstone inscription of a perumpattan or Tamil goldsmith, from Khuan Luk Pat in Krabi Province points to the presence of pre-modern professional diasporas, the Takua Pa inscription points to the presence of a Tamil mercantile guild in the 8th-9th century AD.

"The Sangam anthologies contain the earliest literary references to Tamil contact with Southeast Asia. The Pattinappalai, dating to the 2nd century AD, describes the import of foreign merchandise from Kedah to the Chola port of Poompuhar, while Chithalai Satthanar's Manimekalai written in the 5th-6th century AD alludes to Java," said Arun.

Though Tamils have been traversing the Bay of Bengal and its hinterlands for some 2,000 years, most of them were sojourners. "They came, they saw, they acquired but most of them went back home. In the case of Singapore, the unbroken history of settled Tamils begins with the acquisition of Singapore as a British trading port in 1819, 200 years ago," he said.

Title: Bigg Boss 13: Bigg Boss exposes Asim Riaz and Vishal Aditya Singh’s nomination game; both get into a fight with Paras
Content: In the teaser of tonight's episode of Bigg Boss 13 , friends and family members of the contestants will enter the house. This might help them get a better perspective of their game, which is in its 18th week now.The promo of the show sees Vikas Gupta teasing Sidharth Shukla through a video as he talks about re-entering the house. Kashmera Shah shares she is entering BB 13 for lending her support to sister-in-law, Arti Singh. Besides the two, Shehnaz Gill 's brother and Himanshi Khurana will enter the house.There'll be another twist. In order to expose the hypocrisy of the contestants, Bigg Boss will show a video where a few of the housemates are seen discussing nominations.In the teaser, while Vishal Aditya Singh and Asim Riaz laugh after the video, Mahira Sharma and Paras Chhabra are clearly infuriated. Paras gets so angry with Asim that he declares, "show jeet ke jaonga mein, tum dono ki ph**d ke rahunga."Meanwhile, Vikas Gupta has already shared on his social media account how he plans to celebrate Shehnaz Gill's birthday today in the house.Alongside their photos, he wrote, "Happy Birthday #Khushi #shehnaazgill coming to celebrate your birthday #biggboss13 ke ghar wapas. Once again with #sidharthshukla #asimriaz #lostsoul #Mahirasharma #Paraschabra #Artisingh will miss #Shefali. May this year be the best year till date of your life. Good Health and Happiness."Kashmera Shah also made her intentions for entering the house clear on her Instagram account. She wrote, "I choose to be kind because it makes me happy but I will defend my family and my loved ones without hesitation. Make no mistake, I am fierce and I am coming to #BigBoss13 to support my family, @artisingh5."The latest contestant to be evicted from Bigg Boss 13 is Shefali Jariwala. With just a few weeks to go, it remains to be seen how contestants amp up their game on the show.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: 1,000 people screened in 7 days at Kempegowda International Airport
Content:
Over the past week, over 1,000 passengers underwent thermal screening at Kempegowda International Airport. (Fi... Read More

BENGALURU: Over the past week, over 1,000 passengers underwent thermal screening at Kempegowda International Airport Between 8am Saturday and 8am Sunday, 432 were screened for the virus, including 178 on board Indigo flight 6E 1772 from Hong Kong to Bengaluru; 226 on board Cathay Pacific flight KA 154 from Hong Kong to Bengaluru and 28 transit passengers.Those who visited Wuhan and got fever, cough and shortness of breath within 28 days of arrival in India, have been told to get a checkup done at the nearest hospital facility.For queries, call helpline number 91-11-23978046.

Title: China-returned Bihar girl shows coronavirus symptoms, rushed to PMCH
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: A girl from Bihar was admitted to ICU of a local hospital in Chapra after she showed symptoms similar to that of coronavirus . She is now being taken to Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH).The girl had recentally returned from China."The girl will be shifted to Patna's PMCH," said PMCH superintendent.

Title: Delhi polls 2020: BJP's trying to create divide, says Congress
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Subhash Chopra

NEW DELHI: Delhi Congress chief Subhash Chopra on Sunday alleged that in a bid to capture power in Delhi, Bharatiya Janata Party was trying to create a divide on communal lines and passing the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) was one such attempt.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

He also claimed that AAP government in Delhi was trying to cover up its failures with "lies and falsehood".

Chopra addressed small gatherings at the inauguration of election offices of Congress candidates in Okhla, Laxmi Nagar, Dwarka, Rajouri Garden and Shakur Basti assembly constituencies. He also targeted chief minister Arvind Kejriwal for not speaking against police's "high handedness" on students protesting in their universities and on the streets against the CAA.

Title: Grammy Awards 2020 Complete Winners List: Lizzo and Billie Eilish win big, Alicia Keys and others pay tribute to Kobe Bryant
Content: The stage was set on fire when artists from all around the globe came together under one roof for the prestigious Grammy Awards at the Staples Center in Los Angeles.Amid vivid and vibrant performances from the likes of Lizzo , Usher, FKA Twigs Alicia Keys and several stars even paid tribute to late Basketball legend Kobe Bryant , who passed away in a helicopter crash on Sunday along with his daughter Gianna.While the night was owned by Lizzo and Billie Eilish as they beat the likes of veteran sensations like Beyonce, Ariana Grande and Taylor Swift, here's the complete list of winners announced at the Grammy Awards by The Recording Academy.“IGOR,” Tyler, the Creator“Racks in the Middle,” Nipsey Hussle featuring Roddy Ricch and Hit-Boy“A Lot,” 21 Savage featuring J. Cole“Ventura,” Anderson .Paak“Say So,” PJ Morton featuring JoJo“Come Home,” Anderson .Paak featuring André 3000“Cuz I Love You,” Lizzo“When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?,” Billie Eilish“Truth Hurts,” Lizzo“Old Town Road,” Lil Nas X featuring Billy Ray Cyrus“Look Now,” Elvis Costello & the Imposters“Social Cues,” Cage the Elephant“This Land,” Gary Clark Jr.“This Land,” Gary Clark Jr.“Father of the Bride,” Vampire Weekend“While I’m Livin’,” Tanya Tucker“Bring My Flowers Now,” Tanya Tucker“Ride Me Back Home,” Willie Nelson“Speechless,” Dan + Shay“No Geography,” The Chemical Brothers“Got to Title: Australian Open: Federer takes Fucsovics in his stride; Sandgren shock for Fognini
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Roger Federer. (Getty Images)

MELBOURNE: Roger Federer started slowly, but made up for lost time by breaking early in the final three sets of his Australian Open fourth-round clash against Marton Fucsovics .

The superstar Swiss, playing his first tournament of the new year, has looked rusty in patches this week, tennis and temperament, but he did well to pick the spots and open the court with his range of designer shots on a nippy evening, when the temperatures dropped and the ball travelled slowly through the air.

Federer won 4-6, 6-1, 6-2, 6-2 against the heavy-hitting Hungarian, who in a bid to push the pace left gaping holes in the court. In their previous two meetings, the 27-year-old hadn’t taken a set of the Swiss. Federer, the six-time champion here, moved into his 15th quarterfinals at Melbourne Park to take sole ownership of the all-time record of most last-eight appearances. The 38-yearold, who has given longevity a new name, is also in a staggering 57th Grand Slam quarterfinal.

Federer, dressed in a striking shade of plum, was on court for over four-hours in his third-round match against Aussie John Millman, coming back from the dead in the deciding super-tiebreak. He carried strains of that encounter onto court on Sunday, Australia Day.

“It was a tough start for me, I thought Marton played well and clean,” the father-of-four said. “I struggled early in the match, the Millman match had taken away my confidence (for some) and I was beat from baseline. Then when the temperatures drop and it is cool like this, the conditions become really slow. I just had to take my chances after that. It was good that I able to recover after the Millman match, I feel better and I’m going to feel better with every match from here.”

The 20-time major winner plays American Tennys Sandgren, who shocked 12th seeded Fabio Fognini 7-6 (7-5), 7-5, 6-7 (2-7), 6-4 in 3 hours and 27 minutes in a match that had as many run ins and arguments as it had rallies.

Federer said he was looking forward to play Sandgren for the first time. “I’ve played a lot of tennis, but never against Tennys,” Federer said.

Sandgren put out the unpredictable Italian, who like the Melbourne weather can have all four seasons in an hour, for the second time on a major stage, after his third-round victory at Wimbledon six months ago. The 28-year-old American also improved to 5-2 against top-20 opposition in major competition. Fognini often flirts with the lines, on court and conduct, while it works wonderfully for his tennis, he was given a warning for unsportsmanlike conduct by chair Damien Dumusois, which led to an exchange that brought supervisor Gerry Armstrong on court. Fognini then received a medical timeout to tape his blistered finger.

Shortly after the Italian was granted a bathroom break which led Sandgren to tell off Dumusois. “He doesn’t get new rules because he’s Fabio, or does he?” the American asked before adding, “If you are wondering why players think some players get treated differently, I think you shouldn’t.”

“Between the first set and the second set, I didn’t know what was going on. There were some breaks, it seemed like we were dragging on for no real reason,” said Sandgren, who won 15 points in a row after Fognini had his fingers taped. “His play dropped a little to start the second set. It wasn’t just my good play as to why I got up 4-0. It’s a rollercoaster sometimes with him. You’re just a passenger. He doesn’t play well, all of a sudden he’s playing amazing, you’re stuck with your hands in your pockets. Shoot! I’d like to play tennis too.”

Sandgren embraced the opportunity of playing Federer in his second time in the last eight here. “It would be incredibly special to be able to play him at least once in my career. To play him on a big stage like the quarters of a Slam would be a ton of fun really,” the American said.

Djokovic, Kvitova advance

In other men’s matches, defending champion Novak Djokovic eased into the quarterfinals with a 6-3, 6-4, 6-4 win over Argentina’s Diego Schwatzman, the 14thseed. Djokovic, the second seed, will play Canada’s Milos Raonic, who moved past Croat Marin Cilic 6-4, 6-3, 7-5.

In women’s fourth-round matches, seventh-seeded Czech Petra Kvitova beat Greek Maria Sakkari, the 22ndseed, 6-7 (4-7), 6-3, 6-2. The Czech will play the top-seeded Aussie Ashleigh Barty who put out American Alison Riske, the 18th-seed, 6-3, 1-6, 6-4. Tunisia’s Ons Jabeur made her first Grand Slam quarterfinal, when she overcame Chinese Qiang Wang, the 27th-seed, 7-6 (7-4), 6-1; Jabeur will take on another first timer in the last eight American Sofia Kenin, the 14th-seed, who beat Coco Gauff, 6-7 (5-7), 6-3, 6-0.

Title: BJP will not win Delhi polls: Sachin Pilot
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

JAIPUR: “In Delhi, the BJP will not win assembly elections. Why? The reason is that it is the wisdom of the voters and you can’t blame money and muscle. The wisdom of the people , which prevails over everything,” said deputy CM of Rajasthan Sachin Pilot, while attacking BJP during a session “The Democracy Index” held on the fourth day of Jaipur Literature Festival here on Sunday.

Referring to the influence of money, muscle and media in elections, Pilot made a point that people did not vote for BJP in Maharashtra and Jharkhand assembly polls concluded recently. “Ultimately, it is the individual who presses the button. It is the people who elect their leaders,” said Pilot, who felt that informed citizen can minimize the role of influencers.

Responding to the culture of rising intolerance in the country, Pilot said that country’s tradition, culture, history and democracy is fairly strong to withstand any destruction. “The political landscape will not remain the same forever. Everyone has to promote the culture of keeping a check on those who are accountable,” said Pilot.

Countering the allegation of him being a beneficiary of dynasty politics, Pilot responded by stating, “I have worked tirelessly in the state as a Congress chief for my workers to feel proud of me for the last six years. I have got Congress back in power not because of my father or my grandfather.”

He drew an analogy from cricket to further explain the limited role of dynastic politics in shaping anybody's career and said, “Just like in cricket if you don’t play well you are bowled. Similarly, if you don’t deliver on the expectations of people as a political leader you won’t last. Gone are the days when just being the nephew or niece of someone was enough. You can get elected, may be once, but second time if you don’t perform, you can’t win,” said Pilot.

Raising hopes that the quality of leadership will improve in the country, Pilot said that I have been travelling across the length and breadth of Rajasthan to see the young guns at the age 20-21 contesting elections of Sarpanch, which was not the case 25 years ago. “I am 42; I have been in public life for about 20 years. Our role is to keep developing leadership and groom the next line of leadership. It will be unwise if I don’t do so,” said Pilot.

Title: Bengaluru: 495 apartments told to pay Rs 291 crore fine over sewage
Content:
Representative image

BENGALURU: Over the past two months, the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB) slapped notices on 495 apartments in BBMP's Mahadevapura zone, imposing a fine of Rs 291 crore as 'environmental compensation' charges for violating prescribed standards in treating sewage discharge.With KSPCB threatening to take action if the fines aren't paid within 15 days of receipt of notice and officials talking of disconnecting water supply, the apartments, a few of which have been fined several crores of rupees, are crying foul.Members of the affected apartment associations said KSPCB issued multiple notices to them between December 2019 and January 2020, seeking Rs 5,000 to Rs 3 crore as environmental compensation charges. TOI accessed several of these notices, a majority of which were issued to apartments in Bellandur and Whitefield.The KSPCB notice to Brigade Metropolis in Mahadevapura read: "As per the analysis report, the parameters viz., chemical oxygen demand, total nitrogen and fecal coliform are not meeting the stipulated standards (sic)." Brigade Metropolis has been directed to pay Rs 5,735 as sample collection and analysis charges.CBR Akriti apartment in Hoodi Circle was slapped a fine of Rs 3 crore for not having a sewage treatment plant (STP). Residents of the apartment, in their reply to KSPCB, however, stated, "Our apartment was constructed before 2016 and is validly connected to the underground sewage network (UGD) which is operated by the BWSSB."According to Bangalore Sewerage (Amendment) Regulations, 2018, buildings constructed prior to January 19, 2016 and connected to BWSSB underground drainage network are exempt from setting up STPs, unless they have violated provisions related to environment impact assessment.Members of KSPCB, however, said penal action was being taken in pursuance of a National Green Tribunal (NGT) order of December 2019 to prevent discharge of pollutants into Bellandur, Agara and Varthur lakes.The NGT order, however, said if works related to setting up of STPs and laying of sewerage network aren't completed before September 20, 2020, Rs 10 lakh compensation will be levied on erring PCB officers, while from February 1, 2020, apartments discharging sewage/effluents into lakes will be required to pay a compensation of Rs 5 lakh per month.Residents of apartments that have been slapped with steep fines, meanwhile, pointed out that KSPCB collected water samples without their knowledge. They say KSPCB started harassing them by issuing multiple notices without having collected a 'legal sample'.HA Nagaraja Rao, president, Bangalore Apartments' Federation, said KSPCB recently started issuing notices to many apartments across Bengaluru, claiming they had taken treated water samples many months ago."They then purportedly created reports, which state the samples aren't compliant with prevailing norms. We wonder how these reports came to be, when samples weren't even collected in quite a few cases," Rao maintained.He pointed out that apartments themselves were engaging a certified lab to test the quality of STP-treated water.

Title: K Amarnath Shetty Death: K Amarnath Shetty Death: Former Karnataka minister and JD(S) leader K Amarnath Shetty passes away at 80
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

K Amarnath Shetty (Vijay Karnataka image)

MANGALURU: Senior politician and JD(S) leader K Amarnath Shetty passed away at a hospital at Mangaluru in the Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka on Monday. He was 80. He was survived by his wife and two children.

Amarnath Shetty was admitted to AJ Hospital due to age-related complications a couple of days back. Hailing from Moodbidri , about 55 kms from here, his rise in political field was phenomenal.

Known as upright and decent politician, he entered politics from grassroots level in 1965 by becoming the president of Paladka gram panchayat, Karkala taluk. Later he became the president of Moodabidri TMC. He was elected from Moodbidri assembly constituency thrice in 1983, 1987 and 1994. He held posts of tourism, religious endowment, youth affairs and sports, ports and labour minister during the Janata Dal (Secular) regime when Ramakrishna Hegde and J H Patel were chief ministers.

After losing to his Congress opponent K Abhayachandra twice in a row, he declined to contest in the last Assembly polls. He had contested ten times from the Moodbidri Assembly segment.

Born in the Mundrudeguthu Family of Paladka to Kanthappa Shetty and Rathnavathi couple in the year 1940, Shetty was basically an agriculturist but displayed his leadership skills early by entering into active politics by the age of 25. His leadership skills saw him enter politics through Samstha Congress. He later joined Janata Party, where he remained till his end with the split faction of JD(S). He held the post of senior vice president of the party’s state unit till his last days.

Not only in politics, Shetty was active in social work in the field of education, social service and cooperative sector.

Mourning his death, Karnataka chief minister B S Yediyurappa recalled him as a simple and honest politician. D Veerendra Heggade, Dharmadhikari of Dharmasthala also mourned his death saying he has lost a good friend with his passing away. He stated even while Shetty did not have power or position, he was seen working for the welfare of the people.

BJP state President Nalin Kumar Kateel said that in his death the people of the coast have lost a great leader who had strived for the welfare of the people from the grassroots level.a row. Bantavara Alias Nadavar Mathr Sangha has also mourned the death of the leader.

JD(S) national president H D Deve Gowda visited the family of Shetty at Moodbidri and offered his condolences. Sources said former chief minister H D Kumaraswamy may not be able to come for the final rites to be held on Tuesday as he was busy with programmes at Channapatna, but may come for the ceremony to be held on the eleventh or the thirteenth day.

Title: Skin Care: A new study reveals a link between sleep and glowing skin
Content: If your skin has been looking dull and lifeless, then you need to look at your sleep pattern. A good night's sleep can actually be good for your skin, which is now backed by scientists. A new study by Nature Cell Biology shed light on how a good night rest can be good for your skin.The study was conducted on mice and their collagen. It was found out that the sleep phase can regulate the extracellular matrix, which provides structural support to cells in the form of connective tissue like bone, skin, cartilage, etc. Half of our body is made of matrix and half of it is collagen.The study discovered that collagen is made of two types of structure. One is a thicker form, which is fully formed by the age of 17. It remains the same for the rest of our lives and is permanent. The second type is the thinner structure, which breaks down under stress. The study found out that these structures can actually repair itself while we rest at night.The thinner fibres protect the permanent structures from the daily wear and tear on the skin cells."If you imagine the bricks in the walls of a room as the permanent part," says lead author Karl Kadler, B.Sc., Ph.D., "the paint on the walls could be seen as the sacrificial part which needs to be replenished every so often."Collagen is the most abundant protein in the body. It provides the glow and improves skin's elasticity and strength. Beauty sleep is pretty much real, as good rest can now actually help to boost collagen naturally.
