The contestants respond to Sudeep's statements by showing the placards.The eviction process starts. With Deepika Das and Priyanka left in the bottom two, Sudeep announces that one would stay back in the house while the other would end their journey.Moving on, Sudeep announces Priyanka as the evicted candidate and Deepika Das safe from eviction.Priyanka bids farewell to everyone and wishes them good luck too.Back on stage, Sudeep welcomes Priyanka and lauds her for being a good competitor inside the glasshouse. He also interacts about her journey inside the house and a video clipping of Priyanka's journey is also played, which leaves her emotional.When Sudeep wishes Priyanka all the best and bids goodbye, the latter requests him to dance with her. Sudeep promises to dance with her during the finale. But Priyanka tries hard to convince Sudeep for a simple move and finally fulfills her wish.

Title: My heart is broken for his wife and family: Ellen DeGeneres, Kim Kardashian and other TV celebs mourn the death of Kobe Bryant
Content:
He was great,charismatic & among the hardest-working athletes ever,but what impressed me most was how deeply-involv… https://t.co/dfQhflIHZB — Jimmy Kimmel (@jimmykimmel) 1580069315000

Like everyone, I’m stunned and saddened by the news about Kobe Bryant. My heart is broken for his wife and family. — Ellen DeGeneres (@TheEllenShow) 1580070067000

Just devastated to hear about #KobeBryant .An extraordinary athlete, and a genuinely kind, wonderful man. Sending… https://t.co/4wXPQhqf8t — Reese Witherspoon (@ReeseW) 1580070202000

N.B.A star and Oscar-winning storyteller, Kobe Bryant (41) died on January 26 in a helicopter crash near Los Angeles along with his 13-year-old daughter Gianna Onore Bryant and seven others on board. The news has left family, friends and fans of the sportsman shocked.Reality TV star Kim Kardashian wrote, "My heart is so heavy. No one should ever experience what the families involved are going through. This has affected us all so much but I cannot begin to imagine what Vanessa is feeling losing her husband and her baby girl. I cry just thinking about it. I am praying for the Bryant family, the Altobelli family and the families of all who perished in this unthinkable tragedy. Rest In Peace Legend."Kim's sister Kylie captioned her post as, "at loss for words right now. praying for this beautiful family."Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel , on whose show Kobe Bryant appeared a number of time, wrote, "He was great,charismatic & among the hardest-working athletes ever,but what impressed me most was how deeply-involved Kobe was with his 4 daughters. Pray for them, Vanessa, his parents & his fellow passengers' families on this sad and shocking day. We will never forget you Kobe."A shattered Ellen DeGeneres wrote, "Like everyone, I’m stunned and saddened by the news about Kobe Bryant. My heart is broken for his wife and family." Reese Witherspoon tweeted, "Just devastated to hear about #KobeBryant. An extraordinary athlete, and a genuinely kind, wonderful man. Sending love, prayers & compassion to his family. To his entire @NBA family as well."

Title: Kobe Bryant: Absolutely devastated: Virat Kohli condoles demise of Kobe Bryant
Content:
Reuters Photo

Rest in peace Kobe and his daughter and also the victims of the helicopter crash. Devastated 💔 https://t.co/6vno0IZ3uK — Shreyas Iyer (@ShreyasIyer15) 1580090712000

Gone too soon. Rest in peace legend. #KobeBryant 👑 https://t.co/zU1FZrXri8 — Jasprit Bumrah (@Jaspritbumrah93) 1580092590000

NEW DELHI: India skipper Virat Kohli condoled the demise of American basketball legend Kobe Bryant and said he was "absolutely devastated to hear the news".Taking to Instagram, Kohli said that in his childhood he used to get up early to watch Bryant play."Absolutely devastated to hear this news today. So many childhood memories of waking up early and watching this magician doing things on the court that I would be mesmerized by. Life is so unpredictable and fickle. His daughter Gianna passed away too in the crash. I am absolutely Heartbroken. Rest in peace. Strength and condolences to the family," Kohli wrote.Bryant and his 13-year old daughter Gianna Maria Onore Bryant were among the nine people killed when a helicopter they were travelling in crashed amid foggy conditions and burst into flames in the hills above Calabasas, local media reported."Sad day for the sporting world today. One of the greats of the game gone too soon. Rest in peace Kobe Bryant and his little daughter Gianna and the other victims," Rohit Sharma wrote on Instagram."Rest in peace Kobe and his daughter and also the victims of the helicopter crash. Devastated," Shreyas Iyer tweeted.Taking to Twitter Jaspirt Bumrah wrote, "Gone too soon. Rest in peace legend. #KobeBryant."Bryant, 41, and his daughter were expected at the Mamba Sports Academy in Thousand Oaks for a basketball game scheduled for Sunday afternoon (local time), CNN reported.Los Angeles County Sheriff Alex Villanueva told reporters that as per a manifest, nine people -- including the pilot -- were on board the helicopter that crashed on a hillside.No one survived the crash, Los Angeles County Fire Department Chief Daryl Osby said. Officials did not reveal the identity of the victims.LA County Fire Department's Capt. Tony Imbrenda said that they did not immediately have any information as to whether the helicopter radioed a distress signal."Individuals that saw the chopper said it was coming down at a fairly significant rate of speed and impacted the ground on the hillside," he told reporters.The 41-year-old Bryant had won five National Basketball Association (NBA) championships in his 20-year-long career while playing for Los Angeles Lakers.

Title: Vishnu Vishal's 'FIR' teaser
Content:
My best wishes to my brother @thevishnuvishal #FIRteaser https://t.co/fF99EPN3eC @VVStudioz @itsmanuanand — Kichcha Sudeepa (@KicchaSudeep) 1580042077000

Very happy to launch the fab teaser.. goodluck @TheVishnuVishal and team #FIRteaser - https://t.co/PD3UZ5Q3Cr @VVStudioz @itsmanuanand — Kajal Aggarwal (@MsKajalAggarwal) 1580042272000

Actor Vishnu Vishal was in the news recently for sharing his experience of his going into depression and also about his mental and physical transformation. Now, the teaser of Vishnu Vishal's upcoming movie ' FIR ' was unveiled yesterday by Kannada star Kichcha Sudeep, Kajal Aggarwal, Nivin Pauly and Rana Daggubati. The close to a minute teaser impresses and looks interesting and intriguing with an amazing plot.While FIR stands for Faizal Ibrahim Raiz, looks like Vishnu plays Abu Bakker Abdulla a Muslim youth who becomes the most wanted by the cops with Gautham Menon playing a cop who is on his hunt. Directed by Manu Anand, FIR also stars Manjima Mohan, Raiza Wilson in lead roles with Reba Monica John, Gaurav Narayanan and Gautham Vasudev Menon in important roles.The visuals promise a racy thriller with a strong story line and the dialogues are powerful. The teaser ends with Vishnu Vishal saying, "Just because someone prays to god five times a day, doesn't mean he is a religious extremist."Produced by Anand Joy, under the banner Sujataa productions, the film has Ashwath composing the music, cinematography by Kirumi-fame Arul Vincent and editing by Prasanna GK.

Title: Amitabh Bachchan’s granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda chills with her friends in her latest Instagram photo
Content: Amitabh Bachchan’s granddaughter and Shweta Bachchan ’s daughter Navya Naveli Nanda might not be a part of the showbiz just yet but she sure is one of the most loved and followed star kids we have in Bollywood . The young Diva, who is a spitting image of her mother Shweta Bachchan, is an ardent social media user. She is often seen sharing pictures of herself with her followers are they just cannot have enough of her updates.She recently took to her Instagram handle to share a picture were she is seen chilling with her friends. Dressed in casual attire, she is seen sipping on her drink as she pauses and poses for the picture. Her open tresses and no make-up look complement her overall look. She captioned the picture as, ‘Mood’, followed by a heart emoji.The star kid was in the news for her rumoured affair with none other than Meezaan Jaaferi . The two were once snapped together where the actor tried to cover his face, adding fuel to the fire.However, Meezaan, in an interview clarified that they he is not in a relationship with Navya and that she is his sister’s best friends. His sister and Navya study together in London.

Title: Ghaziabad: Woman on two-wheeler hits tractor, dies
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

GHAZIABAD: A 29-year-old woman died when the two-wheeler she was riding hit a tractor on a railway overbridge in the Kotwali area on Sunday morning. The driver fled with the vehicle after the accident.

The deceased has been identified as Meenu Tomar, a resident of Surya Enclave. She worked as a sales executive at a jewellery showroom along Ambedkar Road.

Meenu's husband works in a private company and the couple have an eight-month-old daughter.

The accident took place when Meenu was on her way to the showroom. Eyewitnesses said the tractor driver suddenly applied brakes on the Dalda overbridge. Meenu was right behind it. She crashed into the tractor and died on the spot.

Police said an FIR has been lodged and efforts are being made to identify the tractor driver.

Title: UPSEE 2020 registration to open today at upsee.nic.in, check how to apply
Content:
Online Application for UPSEE 2020: 27th Jan 2020 1400 hrs to 15th Mar 2020 2359 hrs

27th Jan 2020 1400 hrs to 15th Mar 2020 2359 hrs Online Correction of Application: 16th Mar 2020 1400 hrs to 03rd Apr 2020 2359 hrs

16th Mar 2020 1400 hrs to 03rd Apr 2020 2359 hrs Online Availability of Admit Cards: 27th Apr 2020 1400 hrs to 10th May 2020 1700 hrs

27th Apr 2020 1400 hrs to 10th May 2020 1700 hrs UPSEE 2020 Examination: 10th May 2020

Uttar Pradesh State Entrance Examination (UPSEE) online registration and application process will be open today at 2.00 PM. The online application link for UPSEE 2020 will be available from January 27, 2020, to March 15, 2020. The candidates who wish to appear for the UPSEE 2020 are advised to visit the official website of the exam - upsee.nic.in - to register and submit the online application.UPSEE 2020 examination will be conducted by the Dr A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University, Uttar Pradesh, Lucknow, for admission to degree level engineering institutions and other professional colleges across the state. As per the exam schedule released by the University, the UPSEE 2020 examination will be held on May 10, 2020.The candidates can follow the steps provided below to register and apply for the UPSEE 2020 exam:1) Open the official website of the UPSEE - upsee.nic.in2) Click on the registration link available on the official website3) Enter your basic details to register and create a login ID and password4) After successful login, enter your personal details, education qualification, and upload supporting documents like photograph and e-signature5) Make the online application fee payment using the payment options provided on the page6) Note down the payment reference number and also download the filled application form for further reference

Title: Chinese Premier Li arrives in coronavirus hit Wuhan, 1st such visit by top leader
Content: BEIJING: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang visited the coronavirus hit Wuhan city on Monday, the first such trip by a top leader as the death toll climbed to 80 with 2,744 confirmed cases.Li arrived in Wuhan to inspect the epidemic control and prevention work, state-run China Daily reported.He heads the high-powered group of the ruling Communist Party of China (CPC) officials empowered to deal with the rapidly spreading virus on war footing.

Title: Kobe Bryant Death: Leonardo DiCaprio, Taylor Swift, Camila Cabello, Justin Bieber and others mourn the untimely demise of Kobe Bryant
Content:
Kobe was truly larger than life, a legend. May he and all those who lost their lives today rest in peace. Love and… https://t.co/86PTiYgXuT — Leonardo DiCaprio (@LeoDiCaprio) 1580079991000

Just devastated to hear about #KobeBryant .An extraordinary athlete, and a genuinely kind, wonderful man. Sending… https://t.co/4wXPQhqf8t — Reese Witherspoon (@ReeseW) 1580070202000

My heart is in pieces hearing the news of this unimaginable tragedy. I can’t fathom what the families are going thr… https://t.co/uAW383RuHf — Taylor Swift (@taylorswift13) 1580074158000

RIP Kobe, hero to many including my grandson, extraordinary athlete and always kind to me & my family. My deepest condolences to his family — Whoopi Goldberg (@WhoopiGoldberg) 1580070506000

Gods don’t die. https://t.co/tJJFyQeTul — SAFDIE (@JOSH_BENNY) 1580069155000

This is heartbreaking. Rest In Peace Kobe. — Nick Jonas (@nickjonas) 1580069843000

#KobeBryant you were the greatest. You made our city and the rest of the world so proud. Every basketball fan knew… https://t.co/B8nqqbAcQa — Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) 1580070373000

MyGoes Out To Kobe’s Family,Friends,Fans. It’s SO HARD To Deal With The Death Of a GREAT STAR,Because We Feel As I… https://t.co/6K9ubazNEc — Cher (@cher) 1580071705000

I'm so sad and stunned right now. In Staples Arena, where Kobe created so many memories for all of us, preparing to… https://t.co/wDqvVbaqSL — John Legend (@johnlegend) 1580071133000

The entire world was shocked when the news of legendary Basketball player Kobe Bryant 's untimely demise made its way on the internet. The 41-year-old, retired NBA player passed away in a fatal helicopter crash in California. His daughter 13-year-old daughter Gianna was also accompanying him and she too lost her life in the tragic accident.While several fans have expressed their grief over the untimely demise of Kobe Bryant, many Hollywood celebs like Taylor Swift Camila Cabello and others mourned the loss of Bryant.PeeCee, who inked her finger with Bryant's iconic number 24 at the Grammy Awards even took to social media to pen a heartfelt note which read as "Kobe Bryant was my first real introduction to the NBA. I was 13 living in Queens NYC, the same age as his sweet little girl, Gianna. He ignited my love for the sport, competition, and striving for excellence. He inspired an entire generation. His legacy is so much bigger than basketball. This heartbreaking accident also took the life of his young daughter, Gianna. I’m shook and so saddened. My heart goes out to Vanessa, Natalia, Bianka, and Capri Bryant. You are in my thoughts. Also sending my condolences to the loved ones of the other family and pilot in the accident. Being at tonight’s Grammys ceremony in his home at the Staples Center is going to be surreal. 💔 #RIP #KobeBryant #RIPMamba"Bieber shared a throwback picture with Bryant and wrote, "It can't be. You always encouraged me mamba. Gave me me some of the best quotes that we smile about to this day.! Love you man!"While Camila Cabello termed him as her 'hero' in her emotional note which she shared on social media. "I’ve never been much of a sports fan but Kobe Bryant was a hero to me and it was his words and way of thinking and living that lifted me up during times where I felt like I couldn’t get off the ground. When I was 16 and going through what felt like an excruciatingly painful period in my life, I first saw Kobe’s MUSE documentary, and the mamba mentality is the only thing got me through every single performance. He was fighting inner demons, and so was I, and the way he used them to fuel his game on the court made me feel like I could use them to fuel me onstage. At my weakest moments I would channel a different person like he did, because when I felt broken and lost offstage, he taught me how to use my own pain, he taught me how to access strength I didn’t know I had, because on my worst days, I thought of Kobe and suddenly I could do things I didn’t think I could do. I watched every interview, I read every quote of his, and I wish that he knew how many times he saved me, how many times he helped me access a champion in myself that I couldn’t have seen on my own, how many times he helped me use my own demons, how many times he taught me how to use pain to make me a better person, how many times he taught me by example about life by the way he carried himself and the way he saw things.... and I never got the chance to tell him this in person. I’ve watched only two basketball games in my life, but what Kobe did for me changed the course of my life. I can’t imagine how many people he did this for. His legacy will live on in the lives and minds and souls that he touched, he made his mark not only in the game, but in humanity itself. He is a hero to me forever. Mamba forever" she wrote.

Title: Techie rallies for rear belts in cabs
Content:
passengers

accident

Vikrant Latkar

requests

Dnyanesh Salunkhe

Shyam Yadav

A 46-year-old software engineer is leaving no stone unturned to ensure thattaking cabs have the safest commuting experience. He has taken this request to Uber, ensuring that a traveller sitting in the rear also has a seat belt to protect him/her if antakes place.has been rallying this cause for the last three months. He has been approaching the cab aggregator through its customer care service as well as the drivers every day, checking if the seat belts are in place. When he began making these calls, Latkar was met with ignorance.The cab aggregators would put him on hold for long and would give no feedback to the complaints. This did not deter him from following up. Uber finally gave in by assuring Latkar that his message will be conveyed to the drivers — asking them to have a seat belt attached to the rear seat.His plea stems from a gruesome experience. “On one occasion, I was driving through the US when I met with a mishap. I was not wearing a seat belt and ended up getting several stitches. Back in India, I have had a difficult time due to absence of seat belts,” he said.Upon his return to Pune, he observed that drivers are rash. Many of the cabs, he saw, did not have a seat belt for the rear passenger. “In case the driver breaks when he/she is riding at a speed of 50 kmph, it is certain that the passenger will feel the jolt and may end up hurting their head on impact,” he said.These concerns were continuously raised with Uber, officials of which returned the call after a few weeks, saying, all the cars would have rear seat belts soon.Latkar has started urging his friends to intervene in case a car does not have seat belts. They are asked to give a low rating or told to demand a refund for taking the safety lightly.Drivers, however, are finding it a tad bit difficult to comply with the, who drives an Uber cab, said that not all passengers demand seat belts.Moreover, his car did not have them pre-attached. “The regional managers keep asking us the reason behind not having the belts. Our busy schedule does not allow us to spend a lot of time over fixing belts. If this is made mandatory I will get it done immediately,” he said.Another driveradded, “I had these rear seatbelts in my cab but had to detach them during servicing. I understand that it will act as a shield during the accident and will get it done soon.”One of the regional heads from Uber’s Pune office confirmed to having received Latkar’s requests. “We have communicated it to the drivers. They will have to fix belts on the rear seats to avoid accidents/injuries passengers,” the official said.

Title: Municipal schools get A+ for shaping their future
Content:
Ahmedabad

Corporation School

Welfare

parents

(Clockwise) Harin Pathak, Dr Ketan Indrekar, Dr Vijay Merchant, Chandresh Rajpal, Ujvala Parate, Yogendra Vyas; PICS: ANCELA JAMINDAR AND NILKANTH DAVE

Vijay Merchant

SCHOOL:Harijan

As AMC school board celebrates its centenary this year, eminent citizens recollect how teachers who were invested in their students’ future had a great impact on their livesMunicipalBoard is celebrating its centenary this year. Though municipal schools these days often come under severe criticism for the quality of education and drop-out rates, it remains a fact that they have shaped the lives of many who would not have been able to afford a private education.Some of the eminent citizens who are products of municipal schools of Ahmedabad include Additional Chief Secretary (Agriculture and Farmers’) Punamchand Parmar, GCERT advisor Yogendra Vyas, former MP Harin Pathak, former joint secretary at Social Justice and Empowerment Department Chandresh Rajpal and others.Manilal Patel, 90, former principal of Chharanagar Buniyadi Municipal School, is remembered by his students as someone who came home to rebuke them if they skipped school.“I worked hard to infuse enthusiasm for learning among the students. I would cycle to their homes and remindwhy it was important for a child to go to school. It wasn’t easy for me to convince them about how powerful a weapon education was. I worked two years consistently on it and the results started showing.”Patel even went on to learn the language of the Chhara community to reach out to them. “I dedicated my life to teaching because despite being a brilliant student I could not make it to a good post as my parents passed away when I was very young. I am glad my students remember me,” he says.“Teachers today complain when they work overtime. That never used to be the case during my days. People from economically weaker backgrounds want their children to get good education and teachers must do all they can to realise their dreams,” he adds.Though he has never received an award for best-teaching practices, he takes pride in having taught students who have gone on to do well in life. “That alone is my award,” he says.Lila More, former English teacher at Maninagar Marathi Shala No 1, remembers those days when teachers enjoyed immense respect and parents put faith in them. “Students will only learn if they are taught with love and affection. If you ask a student what their favourite subject in school was, the teacher who taught the subject would also be their favourite one. Teaching for me was a passion; not just a means of earning money,” she says.AMCSB Chairman Dhirendra Singh Tomar said unlike earlier times when municipal school teachers were required to be Class 10/PTC pass, today the teachers require a master’s degree. “I believe the school will show results if students attend classes regularly, pay attention to what is being taught and study well,” he said.AMCSB recently felicitated former students who have excelled in life and held important positions in their profession.Reminiscing the days spent in the classrooms, they spoke of love and kindness of committed teachers who taught them that ‘if they could dream it, they could achieve it’.Each of the former students has an interesting story to share, the kind that will inspire awe in you and reinstate your belief in the ‘nothing is impossible’ theory. Read on.♦ Additional Chief Secretary, (Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare)Age: 59School: Rajpur School no 2 in Class 1&2 andRajpur School No 5 for classes 3 to 7Happy and full of enthusiasm to enter the class of Meenaben on fi rst day of school, Parmar went and sat on the fi rst bench when the roll call began. The students would shout, ‘Jai Hind’, to mark their presence. He eagerly awaited for his name to be called out so he too could respond with a ‘Jai Hind’ but that did not happen for a couple of months since his name was missing from the attendance register.“And then on July 28, 1965, my favourite teacher called out my name for the fi rst time register. “And then on July 28, 1965, my favourite teacher called out my name for the first time during attendance. And I shouted a ‘Jai Hind’ with all the energy I could gather,” he says, picking out the date from his memory.It is after his best friend Raman began going to school that Parmar asked his father to enrol him too, but the latter did not pay much attention. However, he managed to convince his father who got relative Narayanbhai to take him to the principal of Rajpur Shala Number 2. Parmar was initially denied admission as he was not yet 5, but he was unrelenting.“We went again the next day and told the principal that I wanted to study. Looking at my keenness, he agreed. He allowed me to sit in Meenaben’s class but without registering me,” recalls Parmar.Parmar credits his school with nurturing in him the ability to think independently. “The stories of Arjuna and the bird’s eye, Gandhiji’s Ram naam, Sravan’s devotion to his parents had a profound impact on me. At home, I also had mother who made me read the Mahabharata, the Bhagwad Gita and the Ramayana. Learning and imbibing became a way of life,” he says.Among the teachers he remembers fondly are Pradipbhai, his teacher from class 4, and Amrutbhai, his class 6-7 teacher. “I was a rough diamond. They polished me,” he says.Parmar’s family lived in an urban slum. His parents were Gandhians and worked in a textile mill. His father was also a member of Majoor Mahajan Sangh till 1984 when the mills closed down. His mother supported the family in running the house. It was in 1982 that he topped the GPSC exam at the young age of 22. He became an IRS in 1984 and an IAS in 1985. “I thank all my teachers for making me who I am today. I am proud of my municipal school education and will remain indebted to everyone who mentored me,” he says.DESIGNATION: Former central ministerfor Home, Defence and PersonnelSCHOOL: Khadia shaala no -4THEREwere several teachers in his family, so the children were all academically inclined. He studied for a year at a municipal school in Khadia. Pathak recollects how his Maths teachers were strict and getting sums wrong meant risking a beating. Strict rules, however, worked for him, he says. “I ensured I delved into the subjects I learnt so I could prepare without rote learning.The skills I picked up in school helped me with preparing the budget and presenting it,” he says, adding, “The municipal school celebrated gurushishya parampara.The teachers played a big role in shaping our personality, encouraging us to be curious and be dedicated to the work we take up. They themselves were so committed that we did not have to look anywhere else for inspiration.”DESIGNATION: Advocate at City CivilSessions CourtSCHOOL: Chharanagar Buniyadi Municipal SchoolHIS father worked as a mason, while mother was a housewife. He recalls how his principal Manibhai Patel took rounds on the cycle during school hours to catch students who has skipped classes to play games. “These teachers at times used to give us a bath to keep us clean.,”he reminisces, adding, “Our Math teacher Gordhan Patel taught us so well – the tables, fractions, divisions, multiplications, additions and subtractions that I till date hardly make any mathematical mistakes. Our English teacher Chandni Prajapati would teach us English for free after school hours. Such teachers are hard to find today.” His principal is 94 but still visits him at times on a cycle.DESIGNATION: MBBS doctor at RajpurHirpur General HospitalKanya VidyalayMERCHANT’S mother wove clothes at Gandhi Ashram while his father worked as a labourer. He recalls, “We were economically deprived and I went to school in a torn halfpant one day. I wore it for 5-6 days. On the seventh day, my teacher called me and gifted me a new half-pant. She asked my parents not to send me to torn pants to school and promised to manage things for me if they did not have money. It was a touching gesture.”He said, “The syllabus was always completed on time. There was never any bias against any student.They used to engage us in outdoor sports activities and encouraged us to participate in different competitions. They were very affectionate, loving and kind.”DESIGNATION: Former joint secretary (Social Justice and Empowerment)SCHOOL: Kankaria Shala no 5 and 6ASK him what he liked the most about his school, pat comes the reply: “The seven Samurais; my teachers Madhuben, Lakshmiben, Leelaben, Jayaben, Leelavatiben, Bhanuben and Ganpatbhai.” Son of a mill worker father and a housewife mother, he knew that the only ticket to a good life was studies. And he loved going to school where cleanliness was “a big thing”.The school enforced strict discipline and students were encouraged to be part of scouts and guides. “I am good at arithmetic because of my municipal school education. They had so many interesting ways to teach us multiplication tables. If we did not understand something, they would repeat it and ensure we got the basics right. I liked arithmetic so much tha t I went on to study Statistics and aced at it,” he says.DESIGNATION: Senior personal secretary to CCI-T1SCHOOL: Maninagar Marathi Shala no 1PARATE’S parents were government employees. Though they could afford a private school, they put their kids in civic school for a formal education in Marathi, their mother tongue. Parate, a gold medallist in English literature, attributes her good handwriting and mathematical skills to her teachers, she remembers them as hard working, loving and “invested in teaching”. She left municipal school after class 8, but the life lessons she learnt there continues to guide her even today.“From dance to sports to studies, they always focused on overall development. Our English teacher Lila More used to ensure that the weakest among the students learnt the spellings right. And they never got bored of teaching us.”DESIGNATION: GCERT advisor and visiting faculty at SPIPA for IAS probationersSCHOOL: Dariapur Shala no 2HIS parents always emphasised on education; his father had completed matriculation and insisted on good schooling. Vyas still remembers his first day at school.“My mother had come to drop me to school on the first day. All of five, I had a shaved head with a tuft of hair sticking out. My teacher Prasannaben, a widow, too had shaved her head. I think that is what made me connect with her instantly.She was caring and I loved her story telling sessions,” he said. He credits his achievements to Mokabhai, his class 3 teacher who had a knack of teaching kids by employing fun methods.“There was no rote learning. I learnt to read, calculate and question things because of him,” he says, adding, “I think teachers’ salaries must be connected with students results, otherwise the situation will not improve.”

Title: Pankaja Munde to hold day-long hunger strike over Marathwada water crisis
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Pankaja Munde

AURANGABAD: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Pankaja Munde will be leading a day-long hunger strike and protest here on Tuesday to outline the issue of water crisis in the region.

"We are going to organise a day-long hunger strike over the issue of Marathawada water crisis and want the Uddhav Thackrey government to take measures to resolve the same. The protest is also about other problems which are in Maharashtra ", she said.

"Due to the lack of water, farmers are facing difficulties in Marathawada. Owing to low produce and lack of funds, they are not able to provide education to their children. The lack of water has increased unemployment in the region," she said.

"We are expecting that all the leaders of Maharashtra will join our movement. If we will not get success in one day rally then in future we will take some other steps," the BJP leader added.

Title: Centre to give political, economic benefits to Bodos by signing a tripartite agreement today
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Home minister Amit Shah and Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal (File photo)

NEW DELHI: The government of India is all set to sign an agreement with all factions of banned insurgent organisation National Democratic Front of Bodoland ( NDFB ) on Monday.

The accord will give political and economic benefits to the Bodos.

Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) is likely to do a press briefing in this regard, where home minister Amit Shah along with representatives of the NDFB and the Assam government will sign the accord. Chief minister of Assam Sarbananda Sonowal will be present for the signing.

It is expected that the central government will provide a massive political as well and economic package for the community.

The government has also made it clear that the Centre would not make the state's Bodoland territorial district into a Union Territory.

Home minister Amit Shah and representatives of Bru refugees had on January 16 signed an agreement to end the long-pending crisis of Bru refugees and for their settlement in Tripura in presence of Tripura chief minister Biplab Kumar Deb and Mizoram chief minister Zoramthanga.

"Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi all the issues of Northeast are getting solved. This is one such step. Approximately 30,000 Bru refugees will be settled in Tripura. Rs 600 crores rupees package has been given for this," Amit Shah had said after signing the agreement.

Centre also said that Bru refugees, who will be settled in Tripura, will get a 40 by 30 feet plot along with Rs four lakh fixed deposit, cash assistance of Rs 5000 per month for two years and free ration.

Title: Delhi Weather Today: Delhiites wake up to chilly morning
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

File photo of a cold morning in Delhi

NEW DELHI: It was a cold morning in the national capital with light drizzle in few areas of the city. Fourteen trains are running late by up to three hours in northern states due to weather conditions.

"The minimum temperature was recorded at 8.5 degrees Celsius at 8:30 am," a MeT official said.

Track the pollution level in your city

The humidity level was recorded at 95 per cent.

The weatherman has forecast partly cloudy sky with mist and very light rain/drizzle and the maximum temperature is expected to settle at 20 degrees Celsius.

The air quality recorded at 9.34 am for Delhi was 316, Faridabad was 282, Ghaziabad was 379, Greater Noida was 336, Gurugram was 246 and Noida was 344.

An AQI between 0-50 is considered 'good', 51-100 'satisfactory', 101-200 'moderate', 201-300 'poor', 301-400 'very poor' and 401-500 'severe'.

Title: 'Love Aaj Kal': Sara Ali Khan starts her new week with this cute BTS photo
Content:
FacebookTwitterPintrest

Ever since the makers of ' Love Aaj Kal ' dropped their much-awaited trailer, actress Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan have been treating their fans with some interesting BTS photos from the sets . Recently, the ' Simmba ' actress took to her social media handle to share a new Behind the scenes picture and it is unmissable!In this photo, we can see her sipping coconut water. She looked fresh as morning dew in a white crop top and pleated grey skirt. She completed her look with a brown handbag. The post was captioned as, ''Start your week with some coconut water 🥥 🌴#hydration #is #key No stress if you need to peeSo come copy #ZoeGrab a 🎫 and watch the #movie 🎥#bts #LoveAajKal ❤️❣️💋🍿😍#valentinesday''.Last week the makers dropped the first song from the film titled ' Shayad '. The song was well received by the audience. Talking about the response to the song, Imtiaz in a statement said, "I believe there is something magical in the world. It's not absolute, it can only be experienced, it's 'Shayad'. I'm glad that people are connecting with the innocence and nostalgia of this song."'Love Aaj Kal' presents a contemporary and relatable portrayal of two love stories - one set in Udaipur in the early 90s and the other in modern-day Delhi. Featuring Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan, the film is scheduled for release on February 14.

Title: Tamil Nadu: MK Stalin invites farmers to protest against hydrocarbon projects
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

M K Stalin

CHENNAI: Opposition leader and DMK president M K Stalin on Sunday demanded that the Centre and state governments scrap the hydrocarbon extraction projects , which he said will turn the delta districts into deserts.

He called on party workers and farmers to participate in larger numbers for a massive protest against the project at five delta districts - Thanjavur, Pudukottai, Cuddalore, Nagapattinam and of Tiruvarur.

"The BJP-led Central government had recently exempted oil and gas companies from getting environmental clearance. It is very clear that their aim is to turn the Cauvery delta into a hydro carbon extraction zone,"he said.

He said as the Vedanta group was a major contractor in the hydrocarbon project, the ruling AIADMK government would do nothing to stop the project. "It is now all in the hands of DMK workers and other opposition party leaders and workers to stay united and save the Cauvery basin," Stalin said

Stalin said chief minister Edapaddi K Palaniswami 's letter to Prime Minister Narendra modi on the recent notification of exemptions given to oil and gas companies was merely an eyewash.

He said during the last eight years of the AIADMK regime more than 5 lakh acres of kuruvai cultivation in the Cauvery delta had been affected. DMK is striving hard to fix the loss of the farmers by pressing the state government to completely waive agriculture loans, he said.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: Crocodile's presence in Mandsaur village triggers panic
Content:
Forest officials rushed to the spot and rescued the crocodile.

INDORE: Panic spread among residents of Hirnikheda village in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur district on Sunday when a crocodile was spotted in an agriculture field by villagers.The villagers informed the police and the forest officials following which a team was sent to capture the reptile in Malhargarh tehsil.The team cornered the crocodile and captured it in a cage, forest guard Jitendra Pawar told reporters, adding, the crocodile was taken to Chambal river where it was released.Forest officials were unsure of how the crocodile wandered into the agriculture field near an isolated pond. The reptile would have been noticed in the past, had it grown in the village pond.In Video: Crocodile triggers panic in MP village

Title: Watch Muddulakshmi-Premaloka Mahasangama this week
Content: The content of Muddulakshmi and Premaloka serial has been integrated for the one hour special show Mahasangama which will be aired for one hour from tonight to 1st February at 7:30pm.The high point of the show being Dhruvanth after all these years pleads Muddulakshmi to forget the past to get back her in his life. Meanwhile, Sharvari kidnaps Muddulakshmi’s daughter Dhrusti to stop Dhruvanth and Muddulakshmi from getting reconciled. Surya helps Muddulakshmi by protecting her daughter. Now that the tales have turned, Will Muddu be able to accept Dhruvanth? Will they get back together as a happily married couple or will the ghost from the past continue to haunt them back will be revealed in Mahasangama.

Title: Arun Vijay back to the sets of 'Sinam'
Content: Sushant Singh Rajput’s untimely demise on June 14 has brought his relationship with girlfriend Rhea Chakraborty in the limelight. The actress is being interrogated by the Central Bureau of Investigation as well as the Enforcement Directorate. Even a drugs angle is being probed by the Narcotics Control Bureau. Amidst this controversy, Rhea Chakraborty has found some support in Bollywood, while there are a few who have raised questions against the actress. Title: Srijit is happy with Anirban’s portrayal of a dark, disturbed, psychopath killer
Content: The biggest surprise of Srijit Mukherji ’s latest release ‘ Dwitiyo Purush ’ is the rough look of Anirban Bhattacharya and Rwitobroto Mukherjee. Srijit is well aware of the supreme talent Anirban has and he has continuously utilized it in his last few films.In ‘Dwitiyo Purush’ again he uses Anirban in a never before seen avatar. The versatile actor has surprised everyone with his new look of Khoka, who is synonymous to violence and Srijit is happy to see the response from the audience.“Anirban plays someone from a particular stratum of the society which is not shown enough in Bengali films. He has done a fantastic job. It’s my sixth film with him and he has exceeded all my expectations each time,” the acclaimed director heaped praise on the ‘Gumnaami’ actor.While speaking about his character in the upcoming thriller, Abirban had earlier revealed how he slipped into the character effortlessly.“In Khoka, you won’t see any grey zone. He is a completely dark, bloody character, a hardcore villain. I have done six films with Srijitda thill now… and believe me I have given everything to slip into Khoka’s character. I even had to gain some weight to play this character. See, I have seen many dark characters in my life and the language you hear from Khoka comes from them. When I had moved to Kolkata for the first time, I used to stay in a place in Koley Market. In those days, it was pretty much rough,” said Anirban.Produce3d by SVF, the recently released thriller sees Parambrata Chattopadhyay and Raima Sen reprising their roles, Anirban Bhattacharya, Rwitobroto Mukherjee and Gaurav Chakrabarty are the new joiners in the ‘Dwitiyo Purush’ cast.The story of ‘Dwitiyo Purush’ commences from where ‘Baishe Srabon’ had left off and sees Parambrata reprising the role of chief detective Abhijit Pakrashi and Raima Sen bring back her character, Amrita.

Title: PV Sindhu: 'A great encouragement': PV Sindhu on being conferred with Padma Bhushan
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

PV Sindhu (AFP Photo)

LUCKNOW: Elated on being conferred with India's third-highest civilian honour, Padma Bhushan , shuttler PV Sindhu on Sunday said that such awards serve as great encouragement for sportspersons to achieve a lot more.

"I felt very happy. I am very thankful to the Ministry, the Badminton Association of India, the Sports Authority of India and also the government of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana because they really have been very supportive. I think it is a very good encouragement to sports. I am very thankful," Sindhu said.

Asked if the award would come with increased responsibilities, the 24-year-old looked at the positives.

"Responsibilities would definitely increase, but these kind of awards give us a lot of encouragement to do a lot more," the reigning women's singles world champion added.

Sindhu made her career debut in 2009 and over the years has won medals at multiple international tournaments, including gold at the 2019 World Championships and silver at Rio Olympics.

Sindhu, boxing legend Mary Kom and captain of India's women's hockey team, Rani Rampal, are among the 141 people conferred with Padma awards on the occasion of the 71st Republic Day.

Bliss! #HappyRepublicDay 🇮🇳

Title: Coronavirus disease harder to contain than SARS: All you need to know about difference between Coronavirus and SARS
Content:
How is Coronavirus different from SARS?

The new virus has created alarm because much about it is still unknown, such as how dangerous it is and how easily it spreads between people. It can cause pneumonia, which has been deadly in some cases. Unlike SARS, new virus infectious in its incubation period, which can range from 1 day to 14 days, making it harder to contain. This was not the case with Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) making the new coronavirus harder to contain. At a press briefing in Beijing on Sunday, the head of China's disease control agency, Gao Fu, said it was "not as powerful as SARS," but officials warned it could be getting stronger. How fast is the virus spreading?

China says the virus is mutating and can be transmitted through human contact. Two scientific analyses of the epidemic say each person infected is passing the disease on to between two and three other people. By Sunday, the pneumonia situation had resulted in a total of 80 deaths, while 51 people had recovered and 5,794 remained as suspected patients, state-run Xinhua news agency said. Almost all provinces in China except Tibet have reported the virus cases. During the past 24 hours, 769 new confirmed cases, 3,806 new suspected cases and 24 deaths from the disease were reported. The condition of 461 people being treated for the virus was termed as "critical". A total of 32,799 close contacts have been traced, the commission said, adding 30,453 among them were currently under medical observation while 583 others were discharged on Sunday. The mayor of the Hubei province capital Wuhan, which has emerged as the epicentre of the epidemic outbreak, said he expects another 1,000 new patients in the city, A high power committee on Sunday said the virus' ability to spread was getting stronger. Is the Chinese government doing enough to stem the outbreak?

Compared to the very low bar set by the Chinese leadership’s secrecy and inaction during the SARS epidemic in 2002 and 2003, Xi has responded with speed and alacrity to the latest health emergency. But there are also signs that the government, especially at the regional level in Hubei province, the source of the outbreak, was slow to recognize the danger and is continuing to mishandle the crisis. Some public health experts have asked whether the sweeping travel restrictions that have been imposed are leaving people without access to medical care, while many Chinese remain unconvinced the government is being completely forthcoming about the toll of the disease. Even as officials in Wuhan said nothing publicly, government scientists shared information with the World Health Organization on the last day of 2019, isolated the virus and posted details about it on an international database 10 days later. There is evidence, too, that local authorities kept a lid on the crisis in the first days of January so as not to upset the cheerful tone for a provincial legislative session that is a highlight of the local political cycle. How many countries are affected by the Coronavirus till now?

In addition, 17 confirmed cases were reported in Hong Kong and Macao special administrative regions and Taiwan, besides eight in Hong Kong, five in Macao and four in Taiwan. Overseas, confirmed cases included seven in Thailand, four each in Australia and Singapore, three each in the United States, the Republic of Korea, Japan, France and Malaysia, two in Vietnam and one in Nepal. What are the governments around the world doing to stall the outbreak?

Three research teams have begun work on developing potential vaccines, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations said. Scientists hope to be testing the first possible vaccines in three months time. China is testing the HIV drug Aluvia as a treatment. On Sunday, China temporarily banned nationwide the sale of wildlife in markets, restaurants, and e-commerce platforms. Wild and poached animals packed together in markets are blamed as incubators for viruses to evolve and jump the species barrier to humans. There are severe travel restrictions in Wuhan, with urban transport shut and outgoing flights suspended. China will halt all group tours, affecting tourism both at home and to other countries, from January 27. Hong Kong has barred residents of Hubei province from entering the city. France, Italy, Japan, Australia and the United States have all said they are working to evacuate citizens from Wuhan. Airports around the world have stepped up screening.

(With inputs from agencies)

NEW DELHI: The coronavirus outbreaks has shown no signs of abating. As per the latest reports, 80 people have died in China and as many as 2,744 people have been confirmed with the deadly virus across the nation.

Title: ‘Golondaaz’ motion poster creates a buzz
Content:
সব খেলার সেরা সেই ফুটবল ভারতীয়দের প্রথম খেলতে শেখালেন যিনি.. On This #RepublicDay , unveiling the motion poster o… https://t.co/mdXbbaS7sl — Dev (@idevadhikari) 1580013282000

Dhrubo Banerjee’s next ‘ Golondaaz ’ has already created a ripple on social media and why not! Tolly superstar Dev will be seen as Nagendra Prasad Sarbadhikari , the forgotten hero who is known to be the father of Indian football.Fans are keeping their fingers crossed about any update from the project and on Sunday, celebrating the Republic Day, the first-look motion poster from ‘Golondaaz’ was launched. The poster looks every bit intriguing and it will surely raise the excitement bar among football-crazy Bengalis.“I have been trying to rediscover the lost pride in Bengalis. People know about the Bengali renaissance but are not aware of the contribution of this man. He is completely forgotten. My film is not a biopic but a means of creating a movie based on Nagendra and the times. Every Bengali must know about him. The present generation does not know much about Sarbadhikary, how he introduced the game and popularized it among Bengalis. My movie will weave the tale with references from real-life events,” commenting on his film earlier an excited Dhrubo Banerjee had said.The director is also pretty much impressed to see Dev’s eagerness while practicing the game with former Indian football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia for the film.This film will also mark Dev’s return to SVF after the 2017 blockbuster ‘Amazon Obhijaan’. For years, they have ruled the commercial space of Bengali cinema and now the hit jodi is set to weave magic yet again. Interestingly, Dev has never been part of a football movie.Nagendra Prasad Sarbadhikari was the founder of many sports clubs in Kolkata in the 1880s, including the famous Sovabazar Club which, an iconic sports institution of that era.Besides Dev in the titular role, the film has an ensemble cast including Anirban Bhattacharya Ishaa Saha , Indrashish Ray, Srikanta Acharya and John Bhattacharya in pivotal roles.

Title: AP Legislative Council: Andhra Pradesh cabinet clears resolution to abolish Andhra Legislative Council
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

YS Jaganmohan Reddy

AMARAVATI: The Andhra Pradesh assembly on Monday passed the statutory resolution to abolish the Legislative Council with 133-0 votes on Monday.

The speaker announced that the House adopted the resolution with prescribed majority. After a day-long debate in the assembly, the speaker took up the voting on the issue and passed the resolution.

Speaking on the resolution, chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy said that the YSR Congress Party-led government has decided to abolish the bill keeping the peoples’ interests in mind.

He said that people's interests are paramount for the party than its political interests. He expressed serious anguish over the developments in the Legislative Council. The chief minister observed that the government was proud to move the resolution as it found no use of the existence of the council.

He said that there was no point in having a council which was creating hurdles to make laws by the legislators elected by the people.

He said that the council chairman’s decision to refer the important bills passed by the assembly to the select committee had pained him and many legislators.

Reddy said that it was not mandatory for the state to have legislative council as only six states in the country had two Houses.

He said that the Upper House was created through a law made by the assembly to give advices on key issues. He said that the council was set up to bring some intellectuals who could provide more insight into the bills.

“Surprisingly, the Legislative Council in the state had become a big impediment to implement the people's agenda. People gave mandate to the legislators elected by them to make laws in their interest. We might need to give a serious thought whether to continue this council if the council continues to block the bills passed by the assembly,” the chief minister said amidst thundering applause by the members.

He said that the present assembly had enough number of intellectuals including professors, doctors, engineers, IT professionals, journalists, farmers and actors.

He said that the government has been working for the uplift of the people for the past seven months. He said that it has brought some revolutionary lagislations to empower the underprivileged sections.

He wondered that the council was used even to stall the bills like introduction of English medium in government schools and creation of separate commissions for SCs and STs.

“Those who are talking big about Telugu medium in the council are not sending their children to Telugu medium schools. Chandrababu Naidu will defend the English medium in assembly and encourage his members in the council to stall the bill. How should we understood these conspiracies?” asked the chief minister.

He said that he was unable to understand as to what was the trouble for the TDP members if the government set up separate commissions for SCs and STs. “We trusted that council would really help us making better laws. The council had shattered our trust,” said the chief minister.

He said that the Opposition leader in the assembly stayed in the council gallery for hours together only to influence the chairman and breach the rules. He said that chairman had clearly violated the rules by referring the bills to the select committee.

“The chairman himself said that it was against the rules. Still, he took the decision. It is like committing a murder despite knowing that it is crime,” the chief minister fumed.

Earlier in the day, the state cabinet chaired by Jaganmohan had passed a resolution to abolish the Legislative Council. The resolution was subsequently moved in the assembly. After holding consultations with the legal experts, ministers, legislators and senior functionaries of the party, the chief minister had decided to go ahead with the move.

The chief minister took the decision to abolish the council after receiving the setback in the Upper House which referred the three-capital cities bill and CRDA repeal bill to the select committee.

The chief minister had dropped enough hints on going for dissolution of the council in the assembly on Thursday.

He said that expenditure of nearly Rs 60 crore per year and Rs 300 crore during the five-year tenure on the council would be a waste if the council continues to block the bills passed by the assembly.

The resolution will be sent to the Centre seeking introduction of a bill to dissolve the Upper House.

He needs all your blessings and love" (sic).Shwetha and Kiran became the proud parents of a baby boy last year (2019). The actress has been quite particular about her personal life and started maintaining a low profile soon after she became pregnant.On a career front, Shwetha is a popular face of the Kannada entertainment industry and has done both film and television projects. Apart from movies, Shwetha has also done a number of popular television shows including Sumathi, Kadambari, Sukanya, and Arundhati.She has also participated in the reality television show Bigg Boss Season 2 as a contestant. She has also taken part in Dancing Star and hosted Dance Dance Juniors.

Title: Nirbhaya case: Convict Mukesh Kumar seeks urgent hearing in SC against rejection of mercy plea
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

NEW DELHI: Death row convict in the 2012 Nirbhaya murder and gangrape case Mukesh Kumar Singh on Monday moved the Supreme Court seeking urgent hearing on his plea against dismissal of his mercy petition by the President.

The 32-year-old Singh's mercy plea was dismissed by President Ram Nath Kovind on January 17.

A bench headed by Chief Justice S A Bobde said, "If somebody is going to be hanged then nothing can be more urgent than this" and asked Kumar's counsel to approach the mentioning officer as the hanging is scheduled on February 1.

The bench also comprised justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant .

The warrant for execution of death sentence for the four convicts in the case has been fixed on February 1 at 6 am.

Singh had moved the mercy petition after the Supreme Court had dismissed his curative petition against his conviction and death sentence.

Title: Lucknow Police lodges sixth FIR in anti-CAA protests
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Seven days after scores of women sat on an indefinite dharna at Ujariyaon in Gomtinagar against the new citizenship law, police registered an FIR against against 150 persons including a woman on Sunday night.

This happens to be the sixth FIR registered by the Lucknow Police against protests since the imposition of prohibitory orders.

Four others were registered at Thakurganj police station for violation of section 144 of Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) that the police had clamped in the state capital the day the protests began.

On Sunday night, sub-inspector, Hussain Abbas of Gomtinagar police station, lodged an FIR naming a woman along with 150 unidentified ones and booked them for rioting, unlawful assembly and disobedience to order of public servant, assault on public servant.

“Despite repeated warnings by policemen on duty, women failed to obey,” stated Abbas in his FIR to the police.

Title: How Raima reacted after she got the offer from ‘Dwitiyo Purush’?
Content: Raima Sen’s phone didn’t stop ringing ever since her latest release ‘ Dwitiyo Purush ’ hit the theatres. The pretty lady reprises her role of Amrita, Parambrata Chattopadhyay aka detective Abhijit pakrashi’s better half in the Srijit Mukherji directorial and she is super excited to see the overwhelming response from the critics and fans alike.We asked Raima what was her first reaction when Srijit offered her the role in this much-anticipated ‘Baishe Srabon’ sequel.“I was very excited when I got the offer. I did not know that there was going to be a sequel. When they did call me I was quite excited. 22shey Srabon was a huge hit. I was quite happy to work with Srijit after so long… and happy to work with Param (Parambrata) and Abir. I met Abir on a work thing after a long time. It was good fun… it was a very comfortable, homely atmosphere… it was relaxed this time. I was tense during the shoot of 22shey Srabon. I was working for the first time with Srijit,” said Raima.The versatile actress is also geared up for her Tamil debut as she will be seen as one of the leads in ‘ Agni Siragugal ’, being directed by Naveen of Moodar Koodam fame. Raima will share the screen with Arun Vijay and the ‘Tarikh’ actress has already started shooting for the film.

Title: U-19 World Cup: Battle of wrist spinners as India start favourites against Australia in quarter-finals
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Getty Images.

POTCHEFSTROOM (SOUTH AFRICA): Indian wrist spinner Ravi Bishnoi 's repertoire of skills will meet a match in Australian Tanveer Sangha's variations in a face-off between two talented tweakers during the quarter-final of the ICC U-19 World Cup on Tuesday.

The white ball cricket in recent times has seen wrist spinners emerge as an important cog and junior cricket is no different where Bishnoi, easily the tournament's most impactful bowler, would like to give his team the advantage over the Australian side.

With 10 wickets from three games and game-changing 4 for 30 against a gritty New Zealand side, Bishnoi has proved why Kings XI Punjab has invested Rs 2 crore on him during the auction.

Statistically, even Sangha has been at his best with 10 wickets with 5 for 14 against minnows Nigeria. But there's been a four-wicket haul against the West Indies and a wicket to show against England for the player of Indian origin.

On Tuesday, both the wrist spinners will be key to their team's chances and Australia will look to improve their dismal record against India at the junior level.

In the last five U-19 encounters since 2013 (different teams have played though), India have won four with one game being abandoned due to rain.

As a team, India are way ahead both in terms of quality as well as temperament with the likes of Yashasvi Jaiswal (two half-centuries), his opening partner Divyansh Saxena and skipper Priyam Garg showing glimpses of their talent.

In the bowling department, lanky UP boy Kartik Tyagi, who breaches the 140 kmph barrier quite regularly, and left-arm seamer Akash Singh, moving the white ball back into the right-handers, are a heady combination.

And there is left-arm spinner Atharva Ankolekar , who came back brilliantly against the Junior Black Caps despite being attacked early on. He got three crucial breakthroughs but a finger fracture in his right hand could be an impediment while fielding.

While Jaiswal, Garg, NT Tilak Verma and Saxena make India's batting look strong, Australia skipper Mckenzie Harvey (nephew of former Australian all-rounder Ian Harvey) is a tough customer with the bat as he showed with an innings of 65 against England in their final group game.

Then there is Conor Sully, who bowls brisk medium pace and also has the ability to use the long handle to good effect.

Title: Suffering from severe depression, mother kills two-month-old in Kolkata
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: The body of the two-month-old baby girl missing from her home in Beliaghata area of the city was found in a manhole near her residence, police said on Monday.

The mother was arrested for allegedly killing her baby and dumping the body in the manhole, a senior officer of Kolkata Police claimed.

The mother is probably suffering from "postnatal depression" which led to the killing of her baby, the officer claimed.

On Sunday, police started a probe after the mother alleged that her baby was kidnapped by an unidentified person from their residence.

She had alleged that an unknown man barged into her flat in the afternoon when she and the baby were alone at home. She was hit by the unknown youth who fled with her baby, the police said.

A search was launched and police started questioning the security guard of the flat, the babysitter and the mother.

"There were several discrepancies in the claims of the woman, the babys mother. We started questioning her which continued for several hours after which she admitted of committing the crime... it seems she is under severe depression that led to this mishap. We have arrested her," the IPS officer said.

Title: CAA Protest in US: Pro-Pak elements infiltrating anti-CAA protests in US; pushing own agenda
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Anti-CAA protests interrupted Indian Republic Day celebrations in some US cities (Pic: Twitter)

WASHINGTON: Pro-Pakistani elements have infiltrated the anti-CAA protests in the US to execute their hidden agenda against India, an Indian-American community leader has said.

During a recent protest against the CAA in Washington DC, posters were seen reflective of the presence of pro-Pakistani elements.

Not only this, at least two Pakistani-Americans were among the main organisers of the anti-CAA protests in Washington DC on Sunday, claimed Indian-American community leader Adapa Prasad.

The Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) came into force in India last December amid protests in India and around the world.

The Indian government has stressed that the new Act does not deny any citizenship rights but has been brought in to protect the oppressed minorities of neighbouring countries and provide them citizenship.

"Darakshan Raja, a Pakistani-American activist who also co-ordinates Kashmiri separatist protests in Washington DC area along with another Pakistani-American Muslim activist named Khudai Tanveer, were one of the main coordinators of the anti-CAA protests," Prasad told PTI.

Prasad and his team shared videos and pictures of the individuals from the anti-CAA protests in Washington DC, which was attended by more than 500 Indian-Americans from in and around the city.

Prasad said one of the posters written in Urdu said “Hans ke Liya hai Pakistan, Larr ke lengey Hindustan”.

"This in English means we easily got Pakistan, now we will fight out to get India," he said as he shared the picture of the said poster.

"This is disgusting. Pro-ISI and pro-Pakistani elements are using this protest to execute their hidden agenda which is depicted in their own poster," Prasad said.

He said the protests are also being misused by pro-Khalistani activists to push their agenda.

"Arjun Sethi, a pro Khalistani activist, was also amongst the coordinators of the anti-CAA rally," Prasad said.

Sethi had recently testified before a Congressional Committee on Kashmir.

In recent weeks, some of the Indian-Americans, during private conversation in WhatsApp groups, had expressed apprehensions that their anti-CAA protests could be misused by elements close to ISI and Pakistan.

NEW DELHI: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will conduct the next Central Teachers Eligibility Test (CTET) on Sunday, July 5, 2020. The online registration link for the CTET July 2020 examination is available on the official website ctet.nic.in. The candidates can apply for the CTET July 2020 examination till February 24, 2020.The CBSE CTET exam consists of two papers - Paper 1 and Paper 2. The CTET Paper 1 exam is meant for the candidates who wish to be teachers for class 1 to 5 and CTET Paper 2 is for those who wish to be teachers for class 6 to 8. Those who intents to be a teacher for both levels (classes 1 to 5 and classes 6 to 8) will have to appear in both the papers (Paper 1 and Paper 2).The Paper-1 will be held in the morning session and Paper-2 in the evening session:The candidates need to follow the CTET exam syllabus released by the CBSE on the official website of the exam. The candidates can click on the direct link provided below to download CTET July 2020 exam structure and syllabus:Since the CTET exam is in May, the candidates now have enough time to read the syllabus in detail. This is also the time, candidates should make short notes on each section/topic which would serve as the quick reference for revision during the last week of the exam. Writing notes will also help candidates in understanding and memorising the concepts clearly.It's always important to read from the syllabus provided by the CBSE Board for the exam, however, the candidates can also take help from various reference books available in the market. Make sure the reference books that you pick has all important topics mentioned in the CTET exam syllabus.This is another important tip that all students must follow. Take as many mock tests as possible to be confident about your exam preparation. Previous year's question papers will also help you in understanding the exam pattern and learn how to manage your time during the exam.

Title: Republic Day: By the bay, one country and its colours on display
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Young artists livened up the proceedings with folk dances

Models depicting international landmarks such as Statue of Liberty in New York, Westminster in London and Burj Al Arab in Dubai on a float on the Marina promenade grabbed the attention of visitors. A delegation led by chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami had visited the cities last year to attract industrial investments for the state.

On Sunday, models of these iconic buildings were displayed to highlight ‘achievements’ of the government on the occasion of the 71st Republic Day . A total of 16 tableaus of 15 state government departments were showcased on Kamarajar Salai. The social welfare department displayed a live marriage with a young couple in traditional wedding dress greeting visitors in a hall and a ‘valaikappu’ ceremony – both exhibits highlighting schemes and programme rolled out by the department.

The agriculture and horticulture departments showed a range of fruits harvested in the state. While the police department’s float had the exclusive patrol car for women security and highlighted the ongoing drive to fit CCTV cameras, the department of co-operation brought farmers and engaged them in cultivation, live. A demo model on organ donation was part of the department of health and family welfare’s float.

Floats were decked up with portraits of late chief minister J Jayalalithaa while deputy chief minister O Panneerselavam also featured in a couple of tableaus.

Ahead of the colourful disp l ay, governor Banwarilal Purohit unfurled the national flag. This was followed by the contingents of the Army, coast guard and the air force participating in ceremonial marchpast. The contingents of different wings of the Tamil Nadu police including Mounted Police and prison also participated.

The celebrations also had a variety of cultural events with artists from Arunachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir and Telangana performing traditional dance forms such as rikham pada, rouf and mathuri. Students from city schools and colleges performed folk dances of Tamil Nadu such as karagam and kavadi.

Title: Verve missing as Mumbai nightlife policy kicks in
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

'Mumbai 24 Hours' policy came into force from the January 26 midnight. (File photo)

MUMBAI: The much-touted Mumbai nightlife experiment received a tepid response on the first night of its implementation on Sunday, primarily due to the lack of awareness about the new regime.

Cleared by the state cabinet on January 22, the ' Mumbai 24 Hours ' policy allows shops, eateries and theatres in malls and mill compounds located in non-residential areas to remain open round-the-clock.

The policy came into force from the January 26 midnight.

In upscale Nariman Point and Worli areas, several shopping malls remained closed during the night.

However, state tourism minister Aaditya Thackeray, who is the prime mover behind the Mumbai 24x7 initiative, sounded optimistic.

"It would gather pace in the coming weeks when people will start realising that it is safe for them to come out late night and enjoy," Thackeray told reporters late night when asked about several shopping malls remaining shut in the night.

He said a huge response to the move on the very first night was anyway not expected.

Sources attributed the tepid response to little awareness about the overall concept and the services that are covered under it.

Thackeray said, "The shops complying with safety and waste processing norms are being allowed to operate under the nightlife policy".

He reiterated that Mumbai is safe for all and it will remain so.

As per the policy, keeping shops, malls and eateries open in the night is optional and not mandatory.

Explaining the rationale behind the need of such policy, Thackeray had said on Wednesday that Mumbai is a "24x7 functional city" where people who work in night shifts and the tourists in transit need to have access to food in late hours.

The bars, permit rooms and pubs are currently excluded from the purview of the policy.

Title: Praggnanandhaa stuns former world champ Topalov in Gibraltar chess
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Praggnanandhaa . (Getty Images)

GIBRALTAR: Young Indian Grand Master R Praggnanandhaa pulled off a huge upset, beating former world champion Veselin Topalov in the sixth round of the 18th Gibraltar chess festival to record his fifth straight win here.

The 14-year old Chennai lad needed just 33 moves to put it across the Bulgarian. He had started with a loss against compatriot P V Nandhidhaa but since then he has been on a winning spree.

Praggnanandhaa, who recently won the world under-18 title, said: "It was very tough to prepare against him."

He is in second spot on five points with six other players and will take on Chinese GM Wang Hao in the seventh round.

Seventeen-year old Russian GM Andrey Esipenko jumped to sole lead with 5.5 points with a win over Georgia's Ivan Cheparinov with black pieces.

The Russian player would be unpaired in the seventh round as he decided to take a bye.

A bunch of players including Indians -- B Adhiban, K Sasikiran, Shardul Gagare, Karthikeyan Murali, last year's runner-up here, SL Narayanan, are in joint third place with 4.5 points.

Adhiban beat Gabriel Flom, while D Gukesh, the world's second youngest Grand Master ever, defeated Martin Percivaldi to move to four points.

Also winning were Karthikeyan Murali against Qi B Chen and Gagare over France's Maxime Lagarde.

Top-seed and world No.7 Shakhriyar Mamedyarov's moderate run continued as he was held to a draw by Indian GM Aryan Chopra. He is now on four points.

Meanwhile, second-seeded Frenchman Maxime Vachier-Lagrave, beat Fernando Peralta to register his third win in the tournament and take his tally to 4.5 points.

Swedish women's legend, Pia Cramling, a former world No.1, drew with Ukraine great Vassily Ivanchuk in 30 moves.

Important results after sixth round: Andrey Esipenko (5.5) beat Ivan Cheparinov (4.5); R Praggnanandhaa (5) beat Veselin Topalov (4); B Adhiban (4.5) beat Gabriel Flom (3.5); D Gukesh (4) beat Martin Percivaldi (3).

Shakhriyar Mamedyarov (4) drew Aryan Chopra (4); SL Narayanan (4.5) drew Daniil Yuffa (4.5); Maxime Vachier-Lagrave (4.5) beat Fernando Peralta (3.5); Shardul Gagare (4.5) beat Maxime Lagarde (3.5).

Title: Karnataka: Course change delights nurses, but some services may suffer
Content:
Representative image

a

BENGALURU: The Indian Nursing Council’s recent decision to phase out a diploma course for would-be nurses from the academic year 2021-22, replacing it with a longer, existing degree programme, has touched off a debate among various stakeholders.The nurses’ community in Karnataka has welcomed the move to stop admissions to the three-year general nursing midwifery (GNM) diploma and make the four-year BSc nursing programme the only point of entry into the profession. This, they say, will improve the quality of personnel training to be nurses, lead to better wages, and open up more opportunities. GNM pass-outs currently earn less than BSc ones in government and private hospitals, and they are not preferred by recruiters abroad as GNM is not perceived as graduation.Health service providers and government officials see things differently. They contend that the Council’s steps will lead to an oversupply of highly skilled nurses, who may start seeing certain roles as too low profile or less rewarding. This, in turn, will cause a shortage of home and geriatric caregivers, especially in rural areas, and make these services expensive.An estimated 3,215 GNM nursing schools in India have produced 1.2 lakh every year. Karnataka has 800 such schools, which admit 60 students in each batch. Nearly 48,000 nurses with these diplomas enter the industry each year in the state. Students from non-science backgrounds could enrol in GNM.The GNM admissions this year will be the last ones. From the next academic year, 2021-22, the said schools cannot enrol any students in this programme. These seats will be converted to BSc nursing, according to the Council’s directive to all states.The circular, issued in September 2019, instructs states and their local nursing councils to ensure no new GNM schools are approved. Inspections to renew, restart or enhance seats under the course must also stop.Karnataka has been the most vocal critic of the Council’s decision. In fact, to offset any potential adverse effects of the change, it is considering introducing a short-term nursing course.“The GNM programme is being phased out, and as a minister of medical education, I am very surprised. Those who complete four-year BSc nursing studies won’t go to serve in villages or work in branches like geriatrics. Courses like GNM are important,” said deputy chief minister CN Ashwath Narayan, who holds the medical education portfolio. “The decision-makers in the Council have perhaps not thought about these aspects. No qualification should become a dead end.”But nurses’ associations say the change, from diploma to degree programme, will be a morale and wage booster. “Nurses have faced huge disparities because of the existence of different courses. At government facilities, the designations and salaries of GNM and BSc nurses are not same even though they fall in the same cadre. The pay gap is wider in the private sector, where nearly 90% of the opportunities lie,” said Girijamba Devi, secretary, Trained Nurses Association.The entry-level salary for a nurse with a GNM certificate is about Rs 8,000. The same for a BSc nurse is Rs 12,000.“In the name of cheap labour, nurses are being exploited. This is the reason we have been fighting for a single entry level in the profession,” Devi said.Industry experts fear there will be a glut of well-qualified candidates, which will cause problems for the industry and patients. “Many patients who pay for home healthcare services need stabilisation care for recovery and rehabilitation. It’s not a very challenging task, but it’s an essential one nevertheless. Phasing out of the GNM course will lead to over-skilling of candidates,” said Meena Ganesh, cofounder and CEO, Portea Medical, a prominent home health service provider.Home services involve multiple levels of care and not every patient needs a highly skilled nurse, according to Meena, a member of Vision Group for healthcare in Karnataka.“Some patients do require high level of care, for which BSc nursing candidates are available. But the same level of tending is not necessary for persons who need wound dressing, catheter procedure or injections. Ensuring availability of highly qualified nurses for these obligations will be a challenge,” she said.The Indian Nursing Council administered the general nursing midwifery course. BSc courses in Karnataka fall under the purview of the Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences (RGUHS).Lakshmi Devi N, dean of nursing at the university, said the number of BSc nursing seats in Karnataka would climb to nearly 70,000 by 2021-22 because of the Council’s decision to convert GNM seats, and the varsity might struggle to handle so many enrolments.“Also, we will have to introduce a bridge course for students from non-science backgrounds in the first year to familiarise them with basic science,” she said.Currently, BSc nursing seats are offered to only science students after II PUC or class 12. After the GNM phaseout, these seats will be also available to commerce and arts students.Prashant Narayan, the general secretary of United Nurses’ Association, Karnataka, said candidates from such streams should not be allowed in nursing. “Nursing is a science course. Are non-science graduates allowed to pursue MBBS, BDS or pharmacy degrees? Then why should they be admitted to a nursing course? Only some states like Karnataka permit it, but many others, including Kerala, don’t,” he said.

Title: Southern Railway to commission new projects
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Southern Railway is planning to commission a slew of projects - the 11km third line between Guduvanchery and Singaperumal Koil, and gauge conversion of 37km on the Madurai-Usilampatti line by the end of this month, the 1.7-km-long fourth line between Attipattu Pudunagar to Attipattu by March, and doubling the line between Usilampatti to Bodinaikanur by April.

Electrification of 74km Cuddalore-Mayiladuthurai which is being undertaken by Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd (RVNL) and 40km Thiruvarur to Karaikkal port by railway electrification wing will also be commissioned by end of March, said Southern Railway general manager John Thomas at the Republic Day celebration on Sunday.

He said station development works at Chennai Egmore, Madurai, Salem and Tiruchchirappalli were being carried out. The zone is looking at eliminating manned level crossings in the coming years. Southern Railway's gross earnings and passenger earnings improved by 2.59% and 8.27 %, he said.

Divisional railway manager of Chennai division P Mahesh said the division was laying stress on improving punctuality of trains including suburban trains.
