Title: Delhi Police Last Date: Delhi Police Head Constable registration last date today, apply now at delhipolice.nic.in
Content:
Open the official website of Delhi Police - delhipolice.nic.in

Click on Delhi Police Head Constable recruitment link available on the homepage

It will redirect to the recruitment application page

Enter your details to register for the examination

Upload your photo and scanned signature

Make the application fee payment

Check your application form that has been submitted and take a print out of the same for further reference

The online registration process for the recruitment exam of Delhi Police Head Constable vacancies will close today, i.e. January 27, 2020, at 5.00 pm. The candidates who are interested and eligible to apply for the Delhi Police Constable post are advised to visit the official website of the Delhi Police to register for the recruitment examination.The Delhi Police Recruitment Department had invited applications to recruit 649 Head Constables. The online application process for the same started on December 23, 2019, and the last date of registration is January 27, 2020.The selection of the candidates for the post of Delhi Police Head Constable will be on the basis of Computer Based Exam (CBT), Physical Endurance & Measurement Tests, Trade Test and Test of Proficiency in Computer Operation.The candidates are advised to visit the official website of the Delhi Police for further details on the same.

Title: Sanjeev Kulkarni passes away: Kannada TV actor Sanjeev Kulkarni passes away at 49
Content: Kannada television actor and host Sanjeev Kulkarni (49) passed away on Sunday (January 26). The actor was reportedly suffering from cardiovascular disease and was admitted in a hospital in Bangalore for the past few days.According to his family, the popular actor was suffering from cardiomyopathy from the past fifteen years.Sanjeeva Kulkarni, who had been ill for a few months, needed more than Rs 45 lakh for his treatment. Many Kannada celebs from the industry lent their support for his treatment.However, rumors are rife that the actor reportedly left his last breath without any treatment due to financial constraints.The mortal remains of Sanjeev Kulkarni were cremated at the crematorium near TR Mill in Chamarajpet Bangalore yesterday evening.On the work front, Sanjeev Kulkarni was a talented actor who had worked in a number of TV serials such as 'Nagini, Raja Rani, Etu Ediraetu'. He became a household name after his viewers' letter based show Demandappo Demandu.

Title: Reopening HAL airport: Govt faces resistance
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

File photo of Hindustan Aeronautical Limited (HAL) airport

BENGALURU: Ever since Kempegowda International Airport (KIA), 30km away from Bengaluru city, was opened, multiple attempts have been made to relaunch Hindustan Aeronautical Limited (HAL) airport, but to no avail.

Huge traffic snarls has frequently hindered flyers from easily accessing KIA and the government has made repeated efforts to reopen HAL for at least domestic and short-haul flights. The most recent of these meetings was held between the three stakeholders — BIAL, HAL and the government — two months ago.

Sources say the two airports do not see “eye-to-eye purely for economic reasons”. Sources say while BIAL is worried over a “dip in revenue collection”, HAL is allegedly more interested in commercial possibilities from operating a fullfledged airport.

“Neither is willing to consider woes of the common man,” said a government official who attended the meeting. “The government is trying to bring them on the same page, but the road ahead is a long one.”

Another official said, “BIAL’s concessionaire agreement runs till 2033 and it’s not willing to budge. It is also concerned over a drop in user development fee should a second airport be opened.”

HAL officials confirmed the meeting, but did not divulge details. BIAL did not respond to queries from TOI.

Title: Watch: Priyanka Chopra adores herself in the mirror as she makes a bold statement with her appearance at the Grammys 2020
Content: Bollywood’s Desi Girl Priyanka Chopra does it again! The actress, who recently graced the Grammy Awards 2020 with her husband Nick Jonas , not only made a bold fashion statement at the grand musical do but also turned heads with the grace she carried herself with. While pictures from the award ceremony have been pouring in on the internet, we came across this short video of Priyanka Chopra where she is seen adoring herself in the mirror.Dressed in a custom Ralph & Russo design, which featured a plunging neckline and also included diamond-adorned pieces, fringe sleeves and intricate embroidery, she dazzled and grabbed eye-balls at the prestigious do.The actress walked arm-in-arm with her husband and singer Nick Jonas who also nailed his dapper look in golden suit and matching shoes.Check out some more pictures of the beautiful couple from the Grammys 2020 here:Meanwhile, on the work front, PC was last seen in Shonali Bose’s ‘The Sky is Pink’. Title: Billie Eilish emerges as the top winner at 2020 Grammys
Content: Singer Billie Eilish had a history-making night at the 2020 Grammy awards as she swept the four biggest prizes best new artiste, record of the year, album of the year and song of the year. Eilish, 18, became the youngest solo performer to ever win the album of the year trophy for debut 'When We All Fall Asleep Where Do We Go', breaking Taylor Swift's record, who won the award at age of 20 for 'Fearless'.She also became the first artiste in 39 years to take home the four major awards. Soft rock staple Christopher Cross was the last artiste to do so, in 1981.In the album of the year category, Ellish was nominated alongside Bon Iver ('I, I'), Lana Del Rey ('Norman F***ing Rockwell'), Ariana Grande ('Thank U, Next'), H.E.R. ('I Used to Know Her'), Lil Nas X ('7'), Lizzo ('Cuz I Love You') and Vampire Weekend ('Father of the Bride')."Can I just say that I think Ariana deserves this?" she said after accepting the award.Earlier in the ceremony, Ellish won record of the year and song of the year for 'Bad Guy' and was accompanied on stage by her brother Finneas O'Connell, who co-wrote the chartbuster with her."This is my first Grammys. I never thought this would happen in my whole life. I grew up watching them and this is my brother Finneas and he's my best friend."I feel like I joke around a lot and I never take anything seriously at these kind of things but I genuinely want to say I'm so grateful and I'm so honored to be here amongst all of you," the star said.Ellish also made her Grammys performance debut with a musical act on 'ocean eyes'.

Title: Trinayani update, January 26: Nayan reveals the truth to Rangana
Content: In the latest episode of Trinayani, Nayan and Rangana try to close all the windows as a storm hits. Nayan thinks about Dripta and feels restless. But she controls herself.Dripta too feels emotional and thinks about meeting her. But later, he recalls the accusation made against him and determines to prove himself innocent first before meeting Nayan. Suddenly, he hears her singing a song. Tears roll down Nayan’s cheek while singing. Dripta too, who is in his room, sings a few lines.Next day, Rangana requests Pratima to prepare tea and intends to go to Nayan’s room to serve tea. But on her way, she collides with Dripta, who seems to be extremely worried. Dripta storms out of their place, Pratima and Rangana try to stop him but fail.Rangana informs Nayan about Dripta and requests her to stop him. But Nayan asks her to let Dripta go. Nayan thinks she is a burden to Dripta. As Nayan tries to walk in the corridor, she injures herself. Rangana feels bad seeing her wound. Sanjukta overhears their conversation and informs Jasmine Dripta goes to meet Jasmine in the hospital and demands an answer for her past behaviour. But there is another lady staying in her cabin.The hospital staff informs that she has been transferred to another hospital.Nayan explains that she doesn’t want Dripta to suffer for her. She also reveals that Dripta is innocent. But Nayan wants to stay away from him for Dripta’s well-being. Meanwhile, Dripta tries to find out Nayan.

Title: Many ministers in Maharashtra govt earned position on merit: Sharad Pawar
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

NCP chief Sharad Pawar

THANE: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has said that many ministers in the Shiv Sena-led coalition government in Maharashtra do not belong to political families and have earned their position purely on merit.

Pawar made the statement on Sunday night in Kalwa area of Thane district while felicitating local MLA and cabinet minister Jitendra Awhad.

"Those who lacked any family background in politics became ministers in the Vikas Aghadi government purely on merit," he said.

Notably, 19 of the total 43 ministers in the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena-NCP-Congress government are dynasts.

On the occasion, Pawar praised Awhad for doing "wonderful" work in his Kalwa-Mumbra constituency.

During his speech, Pawar hailed late Yeshwantrao Chavan, the first chief minister of Maharashtra, for grooming him in politics.

The NCP chief also said that Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray had always supported him.

The makers of 'Malang' have created the right amount of buzz in the tinsel town. Helmed by Mohit Suri, the film stars Aditya Roy Kapur, Disha Patani, Anil Kapoor and Kunal Kemmu. The stars present for the brunch party took to their social media handles to drop pictures and videos.Anil Kapoor too shared a photo of Disha from the get-together. In this photo, the actress is all smiles. She sported lavender shaded crop top on a white floral mini-skirt. He wrote, ''And people think she doesn't eat. Thank you for the fan brunch @dishapatani''. Title: Ke Apon Ke Por update, January 26: Joba, Sarthak, and Suryashekhar to fight together

The brother of his former boss was the owner of the business but he used to run the racket using his (Sarthak’s) name.Sarthak tells Joba about a diary, which belongs to the brother of his former boss. The much-anticipated film is titled as Seetimaarr and the first look was unveiled on Monday morning. While Gopi’s face is not clearly visible in the poster, his sportswear and a whistle around his neck clearly indicate that the 40-year-old actor is essaying the role of a Kabaddi coach in the film.Reports claim that Gopichand worked on his body big-time and got to learn about the technical aspects of Kabbadi. After tasting a dud like Chanakya in 2019, he is looking forward to bouncing back in 2020 and deliver a big success.Starring Tamannaah Bhatia as the leading lady, Seetimaarr features Digangana Suryavanshi and veteran actress Bhumika Chawla in pivotal roles. Title: 4 tips to deal with grief after a miscarriage
Content:
FacebookTwitterPintrest

Miscarriage or loss of pregnancy is a common occurrence around the globe. According to official data, about 10 to 20 per cent of known pregnancies end in miscarriage. It can be due to genetic problems, infection, hormonal issues, uterine abnormalities, age or other underlying medical conditions.For most of us, miscarriage is nothing more than the loss of an embryo or fetus, but for the mother, it is more than just physical loss. It has a deep impact on her mind, which leads to emotional trauma and guilt. No matter how much you try to brush the feeling aside, it does not go away that easily.Transpersonal Regression Therapist Dr Gaurav Deka says that most of the time we try to cover up the situation and avoid discussion on miscarriage thinking that it might bring more pain to the grieving mother, but in reality, it does more harm than good. Moreover, the family starts pressurising the woman to try for the next child, believing that the arrival of the new member will heal everything. But by doing this they are actually not giving the woman any time to grieve.Dr Deka says that grieving is important for any individual who has suffered loss or has gone through a traumatic situation and the same applies to miscarriages. Not giving a sufficient amount of time to the mother to mourn the loss of her unborn baby will actually have a negative impact on her mental health, which will reflect even after the arrival of the next baby.He explained that there are five stages of grief. Each one has its own importance and helps the person to accept the harsh reality. It is important to let a person go through all the stages of grief to help them move ahead in life.Denial & Isolation: The first stage of grief is denial or isolation where people refuse to accept the truth that something like this has happened with them. The world around them become meaningless and they become numb. Denial or isolation is a natural thing, which helps a person to cope up with the emotional trauma.: The second stage of the healing process is anger. Their emotions come out in the form of anger. They feel angry with themselves, with the people around them and even the society for their loss.: Bargaining is the third phase, where the person starts to bargain for their happiness. They believe that when the next child will come, they will be happy or they will do a particular thing when they will have a baby.: In the fourth phase, the person goes into depression and go down low, refuse to meet people or communicate with anyone. They even feel lethargic and find it difficult to focus on their work. They lose the excitement, the joy and the enthusiasm to live or do their daily work.: The last phase is acceptance, where they finally move on the greiving phase, accept the fact and start living with it.Dr Deka reveals four ways to deal with the grief after miscarraige, which can help a person move ahead in life and start afresh.: Acknowledge the fact that you have lost a child and it is alright to talk about it. Communication is a powerful tool, which can help to deal with any complex situation. Allow the mother to express her feelings and be considerate towards it.: Grieving is equally important. Even if takes a week, a month or a year, allow them to mourn for the loss of their baby. If the grieving is not complete, the women remain stuck in that time and space, which reflect later in their life.: You can also involve a third person or seek a professional's help to cope up with the situation. Accepting the fact that you have lost a baby in front of a third person really helps.: Performing a small ritual like lighting a candle, giving clothes to the poor or floating a leaf in the river can help you move ahead in life. Rituals give you a sense of completion and closure.

Title: Realme Buds Air Iconic Cover: Realme Buds Air Iconic Cover gets listed online, to go on sale on January 28
Content:
Introducing real style now in Blue with realme Classic Blue Limited Collection. Get 10000mAh realme Power Bank Clas… https://t.co/p9Ox6gyhXm — realme (@realmemobiles) 1579851000000

Realme launched its first truly wireless headphones, Realme Buds Air in December 2019. Now, the company has launched a carrying case for the earbuds. Called the Realme Buds Air Iconic Cover , the case is priced at Rs 399 and can be purchased on January 28. It will go on sale via the company’s official site Realme.com and e-commerce platform Flipkart.The carrying case is already listed on the company’s website. It comes in four different colour options: Black, White, Yellow and Classic Blue. The Iconic Cover Case is said to come with a form-fitting and impact-resistant design which the company says helps protect Realme Buds Air against falls and slip-offs. It features the tailor-made R logo designed by Pentagram. The case supports Type-C charging and wireless charging. This ensures one need not remove the cover when charging Realme Buds.Availability of Realme Buds Air Iconic Cover was revealed by the company via a Twitter post. “Introducing real style now in Blue with realme Classic Blue Limited Collection. Get 10000mAh realme Power Bank Classic Blue in sale at 12:30 PM, 26 Jan & realme Buds Air Iconic Cover Classic Blue at 12:30 PM, 28 Jan on http://realme.com & @Flipkart”, said the company in its post.As the tweet reveals, the company has also launched the Classic Blue Limited Collection of its 10000mAh power bank. Priced at Rs 1,299, the new colour variant is already available on Realme’s official site for purchase. The power bank offers two-way quick charge and supports dual output simultaneously. It comes with 12 layers of circuit protection and offers both USB and Type-C port. Realme says that the high-density lithium-ion polymer battery can retain sufficient capacity even after 500 charge-discharge cycles.

Title: Cocoon production increases by 20 per cent in 5 years in Coimbatore
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

On an average 1.5 tonnes of cocoon is auctioned daily at the government cocoon market in the city

COIMBATORE: The demand for cocoon is still high, despite its production going up by 20% in the past five years in the district, according to the Coimbatore sericulture centre.

On an average 1.5 tonnes of cocoon is auctioned daily at the government cocoon market in the city. "About 20 to 25 farmers sell their cocoon at the market. At times, the production goes up to 3.5 tonnes a day. Yet, the demand for cocoon has not been met," said an official with the district sericulture centre. In Coimbatore, cocoon is produced at Annur, Narasipuram and Thondamuthur.

The state usually comes up with new targets every year, but this year the production target has been increased to 400 tonnes and the centre had met 75% of target, the official said

The silkworm rearing cycle is 28 days and farmers can earn on a monthly basis. But due to lack of awareness, official said, many farmers were not taking up the rearing process. Even though the quantity of silk thread produced from bivoltine silk cocoons is lesser than that of crossbreed yellow cocoons, most farmers produce bivoltine cocoons because of their ability to reflect the colour after dyeing. About 700m-900m of thread can be obtained from a cocoon and a kilogram of cocoon, he said.

"Until a decade ago, worms were prone to diseases and survival rate was low. A certain temperature had to be maintained, and the worms had to be fed four times a day. But, now the rearing process is not complicated at all," the official sad.

With the introduction of Chokki Rearing Centres, where worms would be reared till it attains stage 2 before handing it over to the farmers, the process has become simple, the official said, the state also gives subsidies for setting up of shed, plantation and installing drip irrigation.

Title: WBPSC Admit Card: WBPSC Civil Service admit card to be released today@pscwbapplication.in, Direct link here
Content: NEW DELHI: West Bengal Public Service Commission (WBPSC) has released the admit cards for the West Bengal Civil Service preliminary examination on its official website.The candidates who have applied for the WBPSC Civil Service examination can visit the official website of WBPSC — wbpsc.gov.in - to check and download the admit cards. It may be noted that no candidates would be allowed to enter the examination centre without presenting WBPSC Civil Service exam admit card.WBPSC has scheduled to conduct West Bengal Civil Service (Preliminary examination) on February 9, 2020, from 12.00 noon to 2.30 pm. The preliminary examination will be held at different venues in Kolkata and outlying centres.It is to be noted that calculator, mobile phone and other gadgets of communication are strictly banned in the campus of the examination hall. Candidates should also note that no candidates would be allowed to appear for the WBPSC Civil Service preliminary examination without presenting admit card.Candidates are advised to visit Commission's websites — www.pscwbapplication.in and https://wbpsc.gov.in regularly to get latest updates on the WBPSC Civil Service exam.

Title: mohanlal: 'Marakkar Arabikadalinte Simham' teaser: Mohanlal-Priyadarshan aims yet another epic narrative
Content: The teaser from Mohanlal starrer magnum opus 'Marakkar Arabikadalinte Simham' was released yesterday and it lived up to the grandeur promised for the Mollywood audience. The teaser features Kunjali Marakkar IV (Mohanlal) who vows to protect his motherland from the shadow of the foreigners. The only dialogue Marakkar says is, "Our land which has provided us everything to grow is like our own mother. And we could only refer ourselves as men, only if we chop off the legs of those who dare to invade our motherland," which proves his courage and love for the land where he is born. Mohanlal pulls off the role of Kunjali Marakkar IV in a dashing avatar. Showing a glimpse of the magnum opus, the 40-second teaser is quite good enough to leave the audience impatient till the release.'Marakkar Arabikadalinte Simham' is an ambitious project of filmmaker Priyadarshan and is touted to be a period drama. The movie is based on the life of Kunjali Marakkar IV, the naval chief of the Zamorin. Set in the 16th century Mohanlal essays the lead Marakkar. The movie also has a stellar cast of Manju Warrier , Suniel Shetty, Keerthi Suresh, Arjun Sarja, Suhasini, Prabhu, Siddique, Nedumudi Venu, Innocent, Mukesh, Pranav Mohanlal, and Kalyani Priyadarshan among others. Thiru has been roped in as the cinematographer for the movie. 'Marakkar Arabikadalinte Simham' is bankrolled by Antony Perumbavoor under the banner of Aashirvad Cinemas and is scheduled for release on March 26.

Title: Mamata Banerjee: West Bengal government has ensured food security of 90 per cent of the population
Content:
Mamata Banerjee

Today is #KhadyaSathiDibas. We have ensured food security of 90% of the population of #Bangla who get rice at Rs 2/… https://t.co/nkvPYfTODd — Mamata Banerjee (@MamataOfficial) 1580092295000

KOLKATA: The West Bengal government has ensured food security of 90 per cent of the population of the state, chief minister Mamata Banerjee said on Monday.On Khadya Sathi Divas, Banerjee said that her government was also providing special assistance to the people of Jangalmahal, the Hills and Aila-affected areas besides, farmers of Singur, the Toto tribe and tea garden labourers."Today is #KhadyaSathiDibas. We have ensured food security of 90% of the population of #Bangla who get rice at Rs 2/kg. We provide special assistance to people in Jangalmahal, Hill & Aila-affected areas, farmers of Singur, tea garden workers & the Toto tribe," Banarjee tweeted.The Khadya Sathi scheme was inaugurated by the West Bengal chief minister on January 27, 2016. As per the scheme, almost 90 per cent of the state's population, would get rice and wheat at Rs 2 per kg. Around 50 lakh more people would get the same at half the market price.

Title: Bengali director making a film on Dhaka terror attack
Content: The massacre in Holey Artisan Bakery in Dhaka had stunned everyone in 2016. It was the worst terrorist attack in the neighboring country Bangladesh. Now, Agnidev Chatterjee is making a thriller based on the terror attack.Incidentally, the film’s shooting had started way back in 2016 but got shelved for various reasons. Now, Agnidev will start shooting again next month. It will be shot in locations like Paris, Barcelona, Montenegro and the borders of Turkey.Titled ‘ Jihaad ’, the film has Rohit Roy Rituparna Sengupta and Koneenica Banerjee in the lead.“My film is a thriller. Most of the films on terrorism depict one-sided views. Terrorism is a relevant and contemporary subject and I felt the need to tell the story to the world,” says Agnidev.The film will have a few similarities with the shocking incident. Gunmen, who attacked the cafe in Dhaka on July 1, 2016 had asked the hostages to recite verses from Quran, and spared those who did it.Rohit Roy will be seen as a photojournalist while Koneenica plays his wife. Rituparna will play the role of Aparna, Rohit’s second wife.

Title: Samsung announces price cuts for these 3 smartphones
Content:
Welcome 2020 with an amazing flagship experience. Avail the #GalaxyS10 and #GalaxyS10Plus at a never before price s… https://t.co/BgcD3qgbcT — Samsung India (@SamsungIndia) 1580052146000

Samsung Galaxy S10+ and Galaxy S10 specifications

Samsung Galaxy S10e specifications

NEW DELHI: Samsung is all set to launch its next-generation Galaxy S series smartphones next month. The company has scheduled Galaxy Unpacked event for February 11, where it will unveil the Samsung Galaxy S20 and Galaxy S20+ smartphones. Just days before the launch, the Samsung has announced price cuts for its three flagship phones of 2019 -- Galaxy S10, Galaxy S10+ and Galaxy S10e.Launched in March 2019, the smartphones have received a massive price cut. The Samsung Galaxy S10+ has got a price cut of Rs 17,100, while the Galaxy S10 and Galaxy S10e are cheaper by Rs 16,100 and Rs 8,000 respectively. Customers can now purchase the 128GB variant of Samsung Galaxy S10+ at Rs 61,900, the company launched the smartphone at Rs 79,000. On the other hand, the Galaxy S10 which was launched at Rs 71,000 can be bought at Rs 54,900. Lastly, the cheapest of all three Samsung Galaxy S10e can be purchased at Rs 47,900.To recall, the Samsung Galaxy S10+ comes with a 6.4-inch Quad HD+ display with 1440x3040 pixel resolution. On the other hand, the Galaxy S10 comes with a 6.1-inch Quad HD+ screen. Both smartphones run Android 9.0 Pie operating system and are powered by Samsung's own Exynos 9 Series 9820 processor. The smartphones come with 8GB of RAM and 128GB internal storage. Users can further expand the storage by adding a microSD card.The duo comes with hybrid dual SIM support and sports triple rear camera setup with 12MP Dual Pixel rear camera, 12MP Telephoto lens and 16MP ultra wide lens. The front of the smartphones house dual selfie camera with 10MP and 8MP sensors. Both the devices come with IP68 rating which makes them dust and water resistant. The smartphones also come equipped with ultrasonic fingerprint sensor and stereo speakers tuned by AKG and Dolby Atmos.The Samsung Galaxy S10+ is backed by a 4,100 mAh battery, while the Galaxy S10 packs a 3,400 mAh battery.The Samsung Galaxy S10e features a 5.8-inch full HD+ AMOLED display with 1080x2280 pixel resolution. The display is protected with a layer of Corning Gorilla Glass 5. The smartphone is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 processor paired with 6GB of RAM. It offers 128GB internal storage which can be expanded further via a microSD card.The smartphone runs Android 9.0 Pie operating system and it comes equipped with a side mounted fingerprint sensor. The Samsung Galaxy S10e is backed by a 3,100 mAh battery with fast charging support.

Title: Indian women's hockey team lose 1-2 to New Zealand
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Image credit: Hockey India.

AUCKLAND: The Indian women's hockey team lost 1-2 to New Zealand in its second match of the ongoing tour on Monday.

The Indians had earlier defeated New Zealand Development squad 4-0 in the opening match of the tour.

New Zealand started the game on an attacking note and earned a penalty corner early in the first quarter and the chance was brilliantly converted by Megan Hull in the third minute of the match.

India drew parity when young Salima Tete converted a penalty corner in the dying minutes of the first quarter.

The visitors matched New Zealand in the second and third quarters but a defensive error in the final 15 minutes cost India dearly as they concede a penalty stroke, and Megan Hull made no mistake from the spot.

India's chief coach Sjoerd Marijne was disappointed with the result.

"We created enough scoring opportunities but we were not productive enough. New Zealand were very successful in the little changes they got. They executed them well," he said.

"It is not about how many opportunities you create but how effective you are. New Zealand were stronger today and in the beginning we were struggling with that. But after the first quarter, we played much better.

"We created eight shots on goal and four penalty corners. We are definitely working on being more effective in the coming matches," he added.

India will again take on New Zealand in the third match of the tour on Wednesday.

Title: What is Shiv Bhojan scheme: Here is all you need to know about Maharashtra government's Shiv Bhojan scheme
Content:
What is the 'Shiv Bhojan' scheme?

Under the scheme, which was launched on a pilot basis, thalis or lunch plates would be available to people at designated centres/ canteens during a stipulated time in all the districts. The 'thali' consists of two chapatis, one vegetable, rice and dal. The thalis would be available for people between 12 noon and 2 pm, officials said, adding that each canteen is going to serve at least 500 thalis (plates) per day. "Initially, 50 'Shiv Bhojan' outlets will be set up for people where full meals will be available at Rs 10. We will expand the number of such outlets phase-wise depending on feedback," CM Uddhav Thackeray had told the legislative assembly. What is the cost of Thali?

The state government is expected to incur an expenditure of Rs 6.4 crore for the pilot 'Shiv Bhojan' thali project that will run for three months. Even though the customer will have to pay just Rs 10 per thali, the actual cost of the food will be Rs 50 each in urban centres and Rs 35 in rural areas. The balance amount will be given as grant to the district collectorate, according to officials. Why has the government introduced this scheme?

Launching of the scheme was one of the poll promises made by the Shiv Sena, which shares power with the NCP and Congress in a coalition government. "The goal of the scheme is to provide affordable and quality food to all, irrespective of caste, creed, religion and financial status," tweeted Aaditya Thackeray, after the inauguration of the centre. Where all in Maharashtra is the scheme implemented?

Under the pilot scheme, at least one 'Shiv Bhojan' canteen has been started at district headquarters. A similar centre was unveiled by tourism minister and Mumbai suburban district guardian minister Aaditya Thackeray at the collector's office in Bandra. Guardian ministers of Pune and Nashik, Ajit Pawar and Chhagan Bhujbal, formally launched the scheme in their respective districts. Is this the first instance of a subsidised canteen in the country?

In the past, similar canteens have been started in Tamil Nadu — Amma Unavagam and Karnataka — Indira Canteen . In Tamil Nadu, the first canteen was set up in 2013 in Chennai. The literal translation of the scheme Amma Unavagam is "mother's canteen". (Amma also refers to late AIADMK chief J. Jayalalithaa). The canteens are set up by municipal corporations to sell subsidised food at a very low price. The Congress-led government of Karnataka started the canteen scheme in 2017. The food is served at civic wards of districts and taluka places of Karnataka. Last year in December, the BJP government in the state, much to the dismay of the Congress, announced that Indira canteens will be renamed as 'Maharshi Valmiki Anna Kutira'.

(With inputs from agencies)

NEW DELHI: The Shiv Sena-led Maharashtra government on Sunday launched its much-awaited ' Shiv Bhojan ' scheme, which is aimed at providing a meal to the poor for just Rs 10, on the occasion of the 71st Republic Day. Here is a look at the state government's 'Shiv Bhojan' scheme and all the other schemes related to it —

Title: Trichy: Two held for selling porn videos
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: The Trichy city police on Saturday booked four people and arrested two of them for downloading and circulating newly released feature films without copyright and selling pornographic videos in two separate incidents.

The Cantonment police registered a case against Mohammed Ashraf , owner of an electronic goods shop at Rockins road, and his staff, B Kadar Batcha, 21, from Alwar Thoppu, after searching the shop. Police said that Kadar Batcha was caught downloading newly released films from the internet and selling them to people by uploading them on their pen drives. He was also found downloading pornographic content from the internet and selling them to the customers.

The police said that Kadar Batcha confessed to have indulged in the crime at the behest of Mohammed Ashraf.

Title: D-Towners express their desh bhakti ki bhavna through movies & music
Content:
‘PATRIOTISM AS AN EMOTION ALWAYS WORKS AND IT’S A GREAT UNIFIER’

‘NO BETTER MEDIUM THAN MUSIC TO EVOKE PATRIOTISM’

While movies and music have always played a pivotal role when it comes to evoking the patriotic josh in Indian audiences, the narrative has never been so strong in Bollywood as it has been in recent times. The popularity of the dialogue “How’s the josh?” from Uri: The Surgical Strike across the nation was a revelation, and even other films like Raazi, Mission Mangal and Batla House, apart from achieving BO success, have made patriotism a truly popular emotion amongst the audience. Closer home, our regional entertainment industry has also been voicing its patriotic emotions through films and music. Albeit subtly, the desh bhakti ki bhavna has been prevalent in Dhollywood as well. There might have been fewer Gujarati films that have been outright patriotic, but several filmmakers have given their films a patriotic twist with sub-plots and story deviations, which make the viewers feel proud of our country. Gujarati musicians, on the other hand, have been more active on this front, releasing singles that celebrate the spirit of India and our unique culture. As we celebrated Republic Day recently, D-Towners share why patriotic films and music easily strike a connect with the audience.Films have a lasting impact on the psyche of the audience and they not only have the potential to be BO churners, but also evoke a sense of togetherness. And just like several Bollywood filmmakers have used patriotism well, DTown films have also tapped this emotion to good effect. While films like IMA Gujju and Pagalpanti were high on combating terror, films like Diya…The Wonder Girl have taken a dig at social evils. “Patriotism is an emotion that is inherent in all of us, and it just comes out when we watch patriotic films,” says Sunny Pancholi, who starred in IMA Gujju. He adds, “They make us feel good about our country and give us a moment of celebration. And patriotic films have done really well in recent times, which reinforces the fact that they are a really good medium to connect with your audience.”Gujarati singers and composers feel that music is one of the most powerful mediums to express themselves and share an emotion that strikes a common thread with listeners belonging to all age-groups. Both music and patriotism act as great unifiers, feels singer Aishwarya Majmudar, who recently released a patriotic song for this year’s Republic Day. She says, “Be it patriotic films or songs, these are reminders that above all, we are Indians and despite all our differences, we are one. And just like patriotism unites us all as Indians, music also acts as a unifier. And when you combine both, it’s a beautiful medium for music lovers.” Unlike films, songs are more freely available, thus making them even more accessible. The audience looks for occasion specific songs to celebrate the emotions related to special occasions like the Republic Day and when a song is released during that time, it finds an instant connect. Says music composer Parth Bharat Thakkar , “Be it Republic Day or Independence Day, patriotism becomes the popular emotion and people tune in to songs that evoke patriotism. These songs become our way of expressing our personal emotions as well as to connect with our audience.”

Title: Debjani Modak replaces Pavani Reddy in Rasathi
Content: Actress Debjani Modak has replaced Pavani Reddy as the female lead in the popular daily soap Rasathi Debjani Modak is seen from the 101th episode. Debjani is making her Tamil TV debut with the show. She is known for her performance in soaps like Aponjon (as Antara ).Rasathi premiered on September 23, 2019. Pavani Reddy played the female lead of the show till the 100th episode. She has quit the show due to personal reasons, sources suggest. Pavani is popular for her performance in the serial Chinnathambi (as Nandhini).Rasathi also features Devayani (as Ilavarasi Soundravalli), Aditya (as Rajadurai Pandian), Vichithra (as Chinthamani), Keerthi Jai Dhanush (as Kayal Shiva) and others in prominent roles.B. Babusivan is directing the serial produced by A. Anburaja.Actress Vichithra made her TV comeback with the show after a long hiatus. Rasathi also marks the TV debut of eminent comedian Senthil

Title: Despite road widening on Anna Salai, congestion continues
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

This junction on Anna Salai, deserted on Republic Day, is usually a picture of chaos due a barricade put at th... Read More

CHENNAI: When Anna Salai was made a two-way stretch after completion of Metrorail work, road users heaved a sigh of relief as they thought the stretch would be free of traffic snarls.

But they were mistaken. Traffic congestion continues at at least two locations on the arterial road due to recent changes made by the traffic police. The introduction of no-right turn at the junction of Cenotaph road and Anna Salai leads to massive traffic snarls. Another rule change of allowing a right turn to Peters Road from Anna Salai also leads to congestion, commuters said.

The first change on the Cenotaph Road-Anna Salai junction means that vehicles coming from Cenotaph Road to join near Appollo Hospital have to travel all the way to Nandanam singnal and take a U-turn.

A senior police official said on an average, nearly 20,000 vehicles congregate at Nandanam junction during peak hours. With the new change on Cenotaph Road, the number of vehicles entering Anna Salai has gone up considerably. "This new system has led to a delay in movement of vehicles near Nandanam signal," said a senior police official.

He said a solution to this problem is the opening up of a stretch near the Raintree hotel. That break was useful for vehicles from Cenotaph Road wishing to take a U-turn.

Another official said before the Metrorail work was completed, vehicular movement from Chamiers Road to Venkatanarayana Road was not allowed. If the U-turn is allowed near Raintree hotel on Anna Salai, it will result in more accidents, he said.

The opening up of Peters Road for vehicles turning right from Anna Salai is also affecting the flow of vehicles from Spencer's signal, a junction known for traffic snarls.

Motorists and road users said the General Patters Road should be made two-way. Introducing such a change will reduce traffic congestion on Anna Salai, they said.

On the two changes in traffic rules, an expert said that a possible solution lies in reverting to the old system of traffic flow on Cenotaph Road.

Similarly, the entry of vehicles from Anna Salai into Peters Road should be avoided to reduce congestion on the stretch, said several residents and commuters.

Title: Ravindra Jadeja takes a dig at Sanjay Manjrekar
Content:
Sanjay Manjrekar and Ravindra Jadeja. (Getty Images)

@sanjaymanjrekar What is the name of that bowler?? Pls pls mention 🤪 — Ravindrasinh jadeja (@imjadeja) 1580094967000

Ha ha...Either you or Bumrah. Bumrah, because he was extremely economical while bowling overs no 3, 10, 18 and 20. https://t.co/r2Fa4Tdnki — Sanjay Manjrekar (@sanjaymanjrekar) 1580095825000

NEW DELHI: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja on Monday took a dig at Sanjay Manjrekar regarding his tweet that the "Player of the match should have been a bowler'', and asked Manjrekar to name the bowler."What is the name of that bowler?? Pls pls mention," Jadeja asked.Jadeja, indirectly, claimed that he was the one who should have been awarded Player of the Match. He was the most economical Indian bowler. He took two wickets for eighteen runs in his four overs that helped restrict the Kiwis to 132/5 in twenty overs.India chased down the total easily with 15 balls to spare. KL Rahul made an unbeaten 57 while Shreyas Iyer scored 44 runs. Rahul was named the Player of the Match as India won by seven wickets. They now lead the five-match series 2-0.Earlier, Manjrekar and Jadeja were involved in a spat where the former had to apologise for his comment.During the 2019 World Cup, Manjrekar had said that he is not a big fan of bits and pieces players like Jadeja.The statement did not go well with the all-rounder and in a tweet, Jadeja said he had played twice the number of matches played by Manjrekar."Still I have played twice the number of matches you have played and I m still playing. Learn to respect ppl who have achieved.i have heard enough of your verbal diarrhea. @sanjaymanjrekar," Jadeja had tweeted.India will next take on New Zealand in the third T20I at Seddon Park in Hamilton January 29.

Title: US embassy vehicle rams into car in Pakistan; 1 killed
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative Image

ISLAMABAD: A US embassy vehicle in Pakistan rammed into a car here, killing a woman and injuring five of her family members, according to a media report.

The Pakistani driver of the embassy vehicle has been arrested and booked, police said.

The incident happened on Sunday at Islamabad 's Margalla Road when the speeding Toyota Land Cruiser of the US embassy hit the Suzuki Khyber car from behind, killing the woman on the spot, the Express Tribune reported on Sunday.

The police said that one of vehicles involved in the accident might have driven through a red light.

The injured were driven to the Pakistan Institute of Medical Sciences (PIMS) Hospital, where medics said one of the injured was in a critical condition. The deceased woman has been identified as Nadia, the paper reported.

Accidents involving vehicles of the diplomatic missions are common in Pakistan.

In April 2018, a motorcyclist was killed after being hit by a vehicle driven by the military attaché at the US Embassy in Islamabad, the paper reported.

Similarly, in February 2013, an SUV driven by an administrative assistant at the US Embassy hit two motorcyclists near Kohsar Complex on Margalla Avenue, killing one of them and injuring the other, the report said

Title: Naagin 4 update, January 26: Nayantara is attacked by Dev's brother; Brinda goes to save her
Content: In the latest episode of Naagin 4 , Rajat talks ill about Brinda and her family. Dev heads out to find Nayantara Brinda tells Rajat, Dev was right about him that he was not the one for her. Dev hears this conversation. Brinda asks Rajat to leave.Kanika messages Rajat that Nayantara is planning to leave the city.Dev messages Nayantara that he is worried for her, and Nayantara understands that Dev really cares for her. She thinks that Dev will protect her from his own family too.Nayantara informs Dev that she is at Amlapur station. Brinda hears Vaishali ’s conversation on call with Dev. She learns that he is angry and going to meet Nayantara.Brinda thinks she must warn Manyata about Dev. She tries to leave from the main door but gets pushed inside the house. She is unable to leave Parekh house.Vaishali sends Sparsh, Harsh and Hardik at Amlapur station to kill Nayantara. Manas and Rohan make an excuse to go out but they also join Sparsh, Harsh and Hardik.Brinda thinks she must save Nayantara from Parekh family. She uses her powers to get rid of the ash at the door which is not letting her leave the house.Manyata makes Nayantara board the train. Manyata tells Nayantara that she will come to meet her soon. Manyata leaves without waiting for the train to leave the platform.Brinda comes outside the house and does not find an auto, so she transforms into a naagin to reach the railway station quickly.Dev arrives at the railway station, and looks for Nayantara. Brinda also reaches the railway station.Parekh brothers find Nayantara before Dev and Brinda. Nayantara manages to run but falls outside the train on the platform. Brinda sees her but till she reaches Nayantara has disappeared.Nayantara runs towards the forest and the five Parekh brothers follow her. Brinda sees them running towards the forest and she too follows.Nayantara falls off a cliff but hangs on the slope, with the support of a stone.

Title: ‘Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan’ song ‘Gabru’: Ayushmann Khurrana and Jitendra Kumar seal the wedding song with a lip-lock
Content: After treating the fans with a super hilarious trailer, the makers of ‘ Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan ’ have now released the first track from the film. The song is titled ‘ Gabru ’ and it is a perfect start for a boring Monday.The song is a recreated version of Punjabi hit by J Star and Honey Singh . This one is sung by Romy and the music recreated by Tanishk Bagchi . The song showcases a wedding where Ayushmann Khurrana and Jitendra Kumar can be seen grooving to the tunes of ‘Gabru’.Jitendra cannot take his eyes off his lover Ayushmann even after his father Gajraj Rao trying his best to keep him away. Both of them can be seen flaunting their cool moves and they seal the wedding song with their lip-lock. Gajraj is even seen having a dance-off with Ayushmann but eventually the latter wins since Jitendra kisses him in front of everyone that leaves everyone in shock. Check out the song below:Apart from their love story, the song will also garner a lot of eyeballs because of its catchy music. It is surely become the newest wedding anthem of the year.'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan' which revolves around the same-sex relationship has been receiving positive responses from all quarters. Talking about the immensely positive response that the film's trailer has been receiving, Ayushmann opened up expressing his joy. He said, "The love of the people of India for the trailer of 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan' is immensely overwhelming. It is a very important film for India and all Indians."Helmed by Hitesh Kewalya , the film is slated to release on February 21.

Title: Chennai architect wins IIWA 2020
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

CHENNAI: The International Inspirational Women Awards (IIWA) 2020 was bagged by Ponni M Concessao , founder of Oscar and Ponni Architects, Chennaim in the category of best woman performer in architecture at a function recently held in Noida.

One among 1,300 nominees, Ponni bagged the best women performer in architecture award. The award recognises invincible potential of women changemakers and aims to inspire women achievers. The International Inspirational Women Awards 2020 is an initiative by GISR foundation.

Title: DMO asks hospitals to conduct awareness programme on coronavirus
Content:
Representative image

KOZHIKODE: District Medical officer Dr V Jayashree has chaired a meeting with the doctors of government and private hospitals in Kozhikode district here on Saturday in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak in China. District medical officer has directed the doctors to carry out health awareness programme on coronavirus among all the hospital staff.The district medical officer (DMO) also directed the hospitals to ensure enough stock of hand sanitizers and triple-layer masks as part of the preventive measures to meet any impending situation. The DMO also informed the meeting that direction will be given to tour operators to take special care as the coronavirus is reported in ten countries across the world.District medical officer said coronavirus which was reported on December 31 in China was officially confirmed on January 7. The health department has directed the people who arrived from China to Kozhikode district to report about their arrival to nearby hospitals. DMO said that around 50 persons arrived from China have already reported to various hospitals about their arrival so far.DMO Dr Jayashree said that symptoms have not been detected among those 50 persons who arrived in Kozhikode district so far. "There is no need to panic, the health department authorities have taken steps to keep them under observation for 28 days and they are kept under the observation of the health department," said the DMO. "Steps have already been taken to set up isolation wards at the Kozhikode Government Medical College Hospital and Government Beach General Hospital in case a need arises," said the DMO.DMO also urged the people to forward details about people arrived after China visit to report it to either at the nearby health centres or email their details to district medical office email coronakkd@gmail.com . They can also inform the district medical office over phone 0495-2371471,0495-2376063.

Title: Air India Stake Sale: Government plans to sell entire stake in Air India: Things to know
Content:
(File photo)

Here's an explainer on the sale of

Air India

also known as 'Maharaja':

What's the deadline to submit initial expressions

A government document released showed March 17 as the deadline for submission of initial expressions of interest, and that any bidder must agree to assume Rs 23,287 crore in debt plus other liabilities. It also mentioned that the substantial ownership and effective control of the airline must remain with an Indian entity. Why Centre wants to sell 100% stake in Air India

The potential sale of an airline kept aloft by a more than Rs 30,000 crore 10-year bailout in 2012 comes as the administration of Prime Minister Narendra Modi divests of money-losing assets to manage the fiscal deficit. The government in 2018 tried to sell 76% of Air India. What are the changes made in this offer

Learning from the experience of the first unsuccessful bid, the key changes made this time include offering to sell 100% government take in Air India and AI Express, which gives complete operational freedom to the new owner. Secondly, last time the bidders were expected to take over debt of Rs 24,576 crore and current liabilities of Rs 8,816 crore — a combine figure of Rs 33,392 crore. This time the debt expected to be taken over has been reduced by almost a third to Rs 23,286, crore all of which is backed by aircraft part of the transaction. The transaction advisor of the Air India proposed sale is Ernst & Young LLP India. What an Air India owner will get

Air India, known for its Maharaja mascot, has more than 13,000 permanent employees and fixed-term contract staff, including over 1,850 pilots and 4,600 cabin crew. A successful bidder would win control of the airline's 4,400 domestic landing and parking slots and 1,800 international slots at Indian airports, as well as 900 slots at airports overseas. While several of Air India's subsidiaries will be excluded from the sale, the buyer will get 100% of low-cost arm Air India Express and 50% of AISATS, which provides cargo and ground handling services at major Indian airports, the bid document showed. The iconic Nariman Point headquarters in Mumbai and the corporate headquarters in Delhi near Connaught Place are not part of this transaction and will remain with the government. Successful bidder will be allowed to use them during the transition period for a couple of years. How is much is the debt on Air India

Air India’s debt as on March 31, 2019, was Rs 58,282.9 crore, with contingent liabilities of another Rs 3,178 crore. Why it may interest Tatas more this time

The Tata Group founded Air India 87 years back. In November last year, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran had said the he will ask his team to evaluate the Air India bidding. There is a sense that Ratan Tata, chairman emeritus of Tata Sons and head of Tata Trusts, might be favourably disposed towards the acquisition of Air India, which his predecessor JRD Tata founded in 1932. Apart from Indian carriers, Air India sale may excite some global players too. What the draft share purchase agreement further mentioned

Potential bidders for Air India will have access to draft share purchase agreement and all records of the airline in the initial stage of the disinvestment process itself, according to a bid document. Besides, a due diligence report about the airline would be provided to potential bidders before the request for proposal (RFP) stage. Generally, access to all data records and draft share purchase agreement (SPA) are provided to bidders put in their interest after the preliminary information memorandum (PIM) stage.

NEW DELHI: In a renewed push to sell Air India, the government on Monday said that it plans to sell its entire stake in debt-laden national carrier. The last unsuccessful attempt to sell a majority of Air India stake was done two years back.

Title: 'Inflammatory speech': JNU student Sharjeel Imam's house raided in Bihar's Jehanabad
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Sharjeel Imam

PATNA: A joint police team of Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar conducted raids at the ancestral house of JNU student Sharjeel Imam at Kako in Jehanabad district late on Saturday following arrest order issued against him by Aligarh police in a sedition case.

Imam, one of the organisers of the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) protest at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, had allegedly made "seditious" statements in Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) by calling for cutting off Assam from the rest of India.

Jehanabad SP Maneesh told TOI on Sunday that raids were carried out in search of Imam at Kako Bazar under Kako police station limit of the district. However, Imam couldn't be arrested.

Imam is wanted in connection with a case lodged with Aligarh police station in Uttar Pradesh, another in Assam as well as Delhi for allegedly giving a provocative speech at Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) on January 16, a video of which later went viral on social media. He can be heard giving a clarion call for cutting off Assam from India in the video.

The SP admitted that some family members of Imam were quizzed by the members of the visiting police teams. Sleuths of intelligence agencies also interrogated Imam's close relatives. A few of them have been detained as well.

"We are cooperating with the police teams from outside the state in their investigation. There is no case pending against Imam here," the SP told TOI over phone before leaving for another destination to trace the JNU student.

Authoritative sources said that the police team left for Patna where some relatives of Imam were living. "Imam’s immediate family members stay in Patna. We can't share more information related to the ongoing investigation as it's a sensitive issue. Senior officials are monitoring the police operation," a police officer posted at the police headquarters said.

Sharjeel has stated on his official Facebook profile that he is from Patna and done schooling from St. Xavier’s High School here as well as DPS-Vasant Kunj in Delhi. Later, he got admitted to IIT-Bombay, from where he did post-graduation in computer science. He also worked as an IT programmer at the University of Copenhagen before coming to JNU, where he is a student in Centre for Historical Studies.

Meanwhile, another video of Sharjeel has surfaced, in which he is heard asking people sitting on dharna in a village reportedly in Gaya district to come out of villages and block national highways in a bid to cut- off vehicular movements between states.

"…The remedy for our problems is forcing the government to agree to our demands…The first thing we did was to unite people to put forth our demands. This step was important because Muslim people stopped coming out on the streets. Last time, we were seen in 1985 but we have not come out on streets thereafter, especially not in such large numbers. The second step will be to use the anger of Muslims by forcefully stopping vehicular movement by sitting on the streets and not getting up till this law (CAA) is not taken back," he is heard saying in the video, the authenticity of which has not been verified by TOI.

He goes on to say that Muslim protestors should not get up from the streets "till the detention camps in Assam are closed". "Tell me what you will do if detention camps will be opened in Bihar and women from your houses will be put in those camps. You will have to burn those detention camps."

Talking about Shaheen Bagh, Sharjeel said: "Highway has been blocked due to the dharna at Shaheen Bagh- 1.5km has been blocked by protestors and another 1.5km by police. Thus, we blocked the highway for 3km, closed down petrol pumps, toll plazas and shopping malls. Moreover, every resident of Noida now reaches their homes three to four hours late. This is our success that we have kept vehicular traffic jammed in Delhi from one- and-a-half-month. But except Shaheen Bagh, highways have not been blocked anywhere else in India. You all should remember that dharna is different from blocking highways. We will get real success only when 100 Shaheen Baghs will be created."

Title: Prabhas 20: Prabhas wraps up the third schedule of his upcoming film
Content:
6'2.5" Cutout Handsome Hot Tempting OutfitBelt missing #Prabhas ❤️ #Prabhas20 ❤️ https://t.co/kiLBQuFn3b — PrabhaSara (@ScorpionPisces_) 1579975095000

Actor Prahbas has completed his third schedule of the shoot for his next film tentatively titled Prabhas 20 . Tipped to be a period-drama, the forthcoming movie features the gorgeous Pooja Hegde as the female lead and Prabhas will reportedly be seen as a fortune teller.While the first schedule has been canned in the exotic locales of Italy, the second schedule was shot in a huge set erected at the Ramoji Film City, Hyderabad. Jil fame Radha Krishna Kumar is helming the film, and Krishnam Raju is bankrolling it under Gopikrishna Movies banner in association with and UV Creations.As said by the makers, Prabhas 20 is going to be a Pan-India release as it will be simultaneously dubbed in multiple languages. Title: Noida: Free health check up to cleanliness drives, residents celebrate 71st Republic Day
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

A free health check-up camp was organised on the occasion in Meghdootam Park

NOIDA-GREATER NOIDA: Residents and RWA bodies celebrated 71st Republic Day across sectors in Noida and Greater Noida on Sunday. While residents hoisted the national flag, children staged shows with Hindu-Muslim solidarity, engaged in painting competition on social subjects and sang the national anthem.

A free health check-up camp was organised on the occasion in Meghdootam Park for residents of sectors 50, 51 and neighbouring areas. Sector 19 RWA organised a free eye check-up camp in the sector’s community centre on the occasion.

Even as district MP, MLAs and local leaders sent out greetings to all residents on the occasion, the district magistrate GB Nagar recalled collective progress of the district citing achievements of Jewar greenfield airport, farmers’ willingness and collaboration in land acquisition for the airport, eastern peripheral expressway and conducive law and order of the district.

While MP Mahesh Sharma, former minister Nawab Singh Nagar, Dadri MLA Tejpal Nagar greeted residents of GB Nagar on the occasion and called for national unity, integrity and fraternity to celebrate the world's largest democracy, Jewar MLA Dhirendra Singh along with UP cabinet minister Suresh Rana, district magistrate BN Singh and police commissioner Alok Singh participated in Republic Day celebrations and parade at the Surajpur collectorate where Rana was the chief guest.

Samajwadi party's local wing also celebrated the occasion. While Subay Yadav former city president Samajwadi Party Noida wing sent out greetings on the occasion, district spokesperson Raghvendra Dubey hoisted the national flag at their Nithari office. “Wishing all of you countrymen a happy 71st Republic Day,” said Yadav.

While children from century apartment sector 100 staged a show on religious tolerance of Hindu-Muslim-Sikh solidarity, residents of Parasvnath Prestige Society sector 93A had slum children participate in their celebrations.

Dharmendra Sharma RWA president B3 Aravali Apartments sector 34 raised awareness on various issues through sloganeering messages including ‘cleanliness as a service, water for tomorrow, waste segregation, say no to single use plastic, environmental protection, pollution control and obey traffic rules, etc,' children of the sector participated in painting competition on social concern subject.

In Greater Noida, residents participated in flag hoisting events from 8 am onwards. While Rajesh Bhati, RWA president Swarn Nagari Greater Noida hoisted the national flag in the central park of the sector, residents of sector Delta 1 felicitated ex-servicemen on the occasion followed by cultural programme by children of the sector.

Interestingly, in sector Pi 3 residents woke up to only one hour of water supply on Sunday dampening their celebratory fervour, while in sectors Beta 1, 2, Alpha, Gamma and more, residents held flag hoisting celebrations across their sectors from early morning even as about 240 children participated in Republic Day celebrations in sector Omicron 2 “where those who’d excelled in sports at district, state and national levels were felicitated on the occasion,” said Satish Bhati RWA president sector Omicron 2.

While national flag was hoisted for the first time in Savitri Market sector 18, traders of the market participated in the celebrations with gusto. Industries too held flag hoisting event on the occasion with Noida Entrepreneurs’ Association at the helm of festivities.

Residents bodies including Federation of Noida Residents Welfare Associations (FONRWA) under president Yogendra Sharma marked the occasion in their office in sector 52 by flag hoisting, District Development Residents Welfare Associations (DDRWA) under president NP Singh celebrated in sector 35.

District magistrate BN Singh participated in the national anthem and flag hoisting ceremony at the Surajpur collectorate. Addressing officials at the collectorate he called for discharge of duties and responsibilities with full devotion so that the development of India, state and the district can be achieved. “Big schemes such as the Eastern Peripheral Expressway, Greenfield airport at Jewar etc. are being materialized in the district with the cooperation of the public especially the farmers, so that the development of the district progresses more rapidly,” said Singh who added that whenever there are adverse situations in the district, the people here have fully cooperated with the administration.

26th January also marked a special day for Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) as exactly one year back, commercial operations of the Aqua Line Corridor commenced and on Sunday, NMRC completed one year of its successful operations.

Celebrating the occasion, Ritu Maheshwari, MD/NMRC hoisted the national flag at its head office in Ganga Shopping complex Noida along with officials PD Upadhyay ED/NMRC, Manoj Vajpayee general manager and RK Saxena COO Noida-Greater Noida NMRC. A cultural programme by children followed the flagging of 4.2 km half marathon which commenced from NMRC head office to Noida Stadium, Sector 21A Noida.

Apart from this, residents of sectors 50, 51, 52, 55, 56, 30, 34, 19, 20, 24, 25, 28, 29, 119, 120, 100, 108, 93 and more held various cultural programmes and felicitations of meritorious children and resident on the occasion as they took part in flag hoisting ceremonies across their sectors and carried out cleanliness drives on the occasion in some areas.

Title: THIS video of Hrithik Roshan’s mother Pinkie swaying to his ‘Ghungroo’ song is a must watch!
Content: Rhea Chakraborty has been facing a lot of allegations since Sushant Singh Rajput’s untimely demise on June 14. While the late actor’s father has levelled several accusations against the actress, it was only recently that Rhea opened up about her side of the story. The ‘Jalebi’ actress, who was in love with Sushant Singh Rajput, has found a lot of support from Bollywood. Here’s taking a look at celebs who have expressed support for Rhea.

Title: Chennai: Two roaming near Thuglak editor's house booked
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Police on Sunday registered a case against two men who were found walking aimlessly near the residence of S Gurumurthy, editor of Tamil magazine Thuglak , in Mylapore .

A team of police personnel on duty at the house noticved this and came to question them when the men got on to their bikes and sped away, an officer said. The members of the police team gave chased, but they manage to escape from the spot.

The police personnel at the spot lodged a complaint with the Mylapore police and a case was registered. Police got hold of footage from the CCTV camera which caught the two men and are trying to trace them.

Title: AIFF launches football masters course
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

NEW DELHI: The All India Football Federation has launched a football management program after the signing of an MoU with Spanish second division side Cadiz CF .

This will enable students in the program to study in three cities over the course of a year – New Delhi, Mumbai and Cadiz in Spain.

AIFF 'Masters' provides students with complete hands-on experiential training on every aspect of football in India and abroad through live tournament exposure, match staging, clubs and team management, data management and analysis, leadership and project management skills, contractual and legal obligations, sponsorship marketing and business communication.

The program will provide exemplary football managers to meet the needs of Indian football.

The multi-campus approach is set to ensure maximum exposure for the students to learn and develop within the different national and international eco-systems of the game.

AIFF president Praful Patel said, "Football is without any doubt the number one global sport and is growing very quickly in India.

"We felt that such a program was needed to help students understand the nuances and global practices involved in managing football not only in India but across the world."

Title: Tamil Nadu: Eight arrested for petrol bomb attack bid on Gurumurthy's house
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Four Thanthai Periyar Dravidar Kazhagam workers have been arrested in connection with the Sunday’s wee-hour petrol bomb attack bid on the house of Tughlaq magazine editor S Gurumurthy.

“We scanned CCTV footages and nabbed a couple of people,” said Chennai city commissioner of police A K Viswanathan on Monday.

Police arrested eight Thanthai Periyar Dravidar Kazhagam workers including Jana of ICF and Sasi, Tamil and Babu of Royapettah in connection with the the attack.

Unidentified men attempted to hurl the Molotov cocktail at Gurumurthy’s Mylapore house, at around 3am on Sunday.

Chennai police had been conducting intense investigation into the incident, but did not reveal much to the media, as they did not want to create a scare during the Republic Day.

When cops scanned CCTV footages, they noticed a few men arriving on two-wheelers in the vicinity of Varadarajapuram in Mylapore where Gurumurthy’s house is located. One of them had a suspicious bag in his hand.

They then tried to hurl two bottles into the premises. Police on duty gave a chase, but the suspects got away.

Soon after the incident, commissioner Viswanathan and other senior police officers visited the house and conducted inquires. In 2013, a similar attack was reported at Gurumurthy’s house.

On January 14, it was during Thuglaq magazine’s annual function that actor Rajinikanth made a controversial comments about Periyar E V Ramasamy and a rally he had conducted in Salem in 1971.

Title: Revised property tax rate will not burden ordinary men: Kozhikode corporation mayor
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Thottathil Raveendran

KOZHIKODE: Kozhikode corporation mayor Thottathil Raveendran said that the introduction of property tax revision after a gap of 25 years will not burden ordinary men as the residential buildings having an area upto 2,000 square feet and constructed before 2016 were exempted from the revised tax rate.

Speaking to media persons in Kozhikode on Saturday, mayor said that the houses having 660 square feet need not remit any type of tax hence there will not be any burden of tax on the ordinary men. Mayor said that the corporation officials have almost completed the official process involved in issuing building numbers to commercial buildings, establishments and houses for the introduction of revised property tax with retrospective effect from 2016, April 1.

Mayor said that the public can remit the revised tax in five installments before March 31, 2020. Mayor said that the last tax revision in the corporation limit was done in 1994. He said that the tax revision was done giving special thrust to residential buildings and educational institutions. He said that the civic body has already set up helpdesks at the corporation zonal offices of Cheruvannur-Nallalam, Elathur and Beypore and main office to rectify anomalies and to resolve public complaints related to tax revision.

Based on the revised tax rate, it has proposed Rs 14 per square meter for residential building fall in the limit of primary zone. The finance standing committee has proposed Rs 90 per square meter for commercial buildings within 100 square meters and Rs 105 for commercial buildings that occupies more than 100 square meter areas. The rate is Rs 90 for the super markets within 200 square meter and Rs 150 per square meter for the super markets and malls above 200 square meters. The rate is Rs 40 per square meter for other industry purposes, Rs 75 for office buildings, Rs 16 for education institutions, Rs 20 for the hospitals and Rs 500 for mobile towers.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Two held for cheating Bihar migrant labourers
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Police on Sunday arrested two men from Bihar for cheating people by giving them fake currency notes in return for money of lesser denomination.

The duo, identified as Chottilal Paswan, 30, and Ram Babu Mahanto, 30, are involved in at least five cheating cases in the city. They targeted only migrant workers from Bihar or Rajasthan.

Explaining their modus operandi, a police officer said the two spoke to migrant workers in Hindi or in Bhojpuri and befriended them. They used to ask their targets if they had notes of smaller denomination in exchange for Rs 2,000 or 500, but gave them fake currency with a few genuine notes of 500 or 2,000 on top.

They used to make an excuse to explain the need for cash in smaller denominations such as 100 or 200 notes. They were also involved in three cheating cases at Kothavalchavadi and two in Esplanade.

Title: It’s official: Samsung is not launching Galaxy S11 and Galaxy S11+
Content:
This story is from January 27, 2020

NEW DELHI: Samsung has already announced that it will launch its next-generation Galaxy S series smartphones on February 12, at the Galaxy Unpacked event in San Francisco. However, a lot of speculation was going around the names of the upcoming smartphones. Now, it seems that the company has cleared the air about it.

As per the latest information, it is confirmed that Samsung will not be launching Galaxy S11 and Galaxy S11+. Instead of the S11 series, the company is calling its upcoming smartphones Samsung Galaxy S20 and Galaxy S20+. Recently, two smartphones with codenames SM-G980F/DS and SM-G985F/DS have been certified for use in Thailand by local NBTC organization. The smartphone models come with the name of Galaxy S20 and GalaxyS20+.

The new model names fall in line with that of the previous flagships and the letter F in the end usually denotes the international units which are the unlocked versions. The two devices are filed by Samsung Thailand but the certification said that they are being manufactured in South Korea.

As per earlier leaks and rumours, the Samsung Galaxy S20+ is said to pack 16GB of RAM. The smartphone is also expected to come with Samsung's own 108MP camera. The smartphone is also said to feature a 48MP secondary camera with a 10X zoom and 12MP ultra-wide angle lens.

The device is also expected to come with 512GB of internal storage which can be expanded further by adding a microSD card.

Rumours also suggest that the device will come with a dedicated Bixby button placed on the side of the smartphone. The microphone is expected to be placed on the rear panel and is said to support Samsung's zoom-in mic feature. This time the company is also expected to ditch the curved glass and replace it with 2.5D glass instead of the Galaxy S20+.

Title: India Post GDS result announced for AP, Telangana, Chhattisgarh & WB circles
Content: NEW DELHI: India Post has released the results of Gramin Dak Sevak (GDS) recruitment for Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, and West Bengal circles on its official website.Candidates who have applied for the GDS recruitment for above-mentioned circles can visit the official website of India Post — appost.in - to check and download the result.Candidates can follow the steps given below to check and download the India Post GDS results.1. Go to the official website of India Post — appost.in2. On the homepage, under result category click on the link which reads "Chhattisgarh (1799 Posts)/ Telangana (970 Posts)/ Andhra Pradesh (2707 Posts)/ West Bengal (5778 Posts - Cycle I)" (Choose your circle)3. It will direct to a new page of India Post website4. Your India Post GDS result will be displayed on the screen5. Download and take a print out of your India Post GDS result for future referenceIndia Post has conducted this recruitment drive to fill up 1799 GDS vacancies at Chhattisgarh circle, 970 GDS vacancies at Telangana circle, 2707 GDS vacancies at Andhra Pradesh circle, 5778 GDS vacancies at West Bengal circle.

Title: Maruti Suzuki Alto Price: 2020 Maruti Suzuki Alto launched at Rs 4.33 lakh, gets S-CNG BSVI upgrade
Content:
File photo

NEW DELHI: Maruti Suzuki India Limited on Monday launched the S-CNG variant of hatchback Alto in two variants, starting at Rs 4,32,700 (ex-showroom, Delhi).Alto BSVI LXi S-CNG: Rs 432,700Alto BSVI LXi (O) S-CNG: Rs 436,300The CNG-powered Alto BSVI offers a mileage of 31.59 km/kg, the carmakers say. Maruti Suzuki S-CNG vehicles are equipped with dual interdependent ECUs (Electronic Control Units) and intelligent injection system. Vehicles are specially tuned and calibrated to deliver optimum performance and enhanced drivability across all kinds of terrains.Shashank Srivastava, executive director (marketing & sales), Maruti Suzuki India Limited said, “At Maruti Suzuki, we continuously strive to offer products that are technologically advanced and environment friendly. With the introduction of Alto BS6 S-CNG, we reinforce our efforts towards sustainable green mobility. The Alto BS6 S-CNG is designed to deliver optimum performance, safety, engine durability, convenience, and mileage. Maruti Suzuki’s large portfolio of green vehicles is a testimony of its commitment towards environment. We are encouraged with wide acceptance of S-CNG technology by our customers.”
